story:
Breve reseña

Desde hace dos años nos hemos dedicado a recuperar la sabiduría antigua con la que los Maya teñían sus tejidos de forma natural; hemos identificado las plantas y los árboles que utilizaban preguntando aquí y allá, hemos recogido las semillas de las plantas que crecen en los bosques, hemos hecho un banco de semillas y hemos hecho un Estudio de Viabilidad Vegetal para saber cuál es la mejor manera de germinar las semillas y poder cultivar las plantas en un huerto controlado. Ahora queremos expandir este pequeño huerto-madre en varios huertos-hijos, de modo que se puedan cultivar de forma controlada las plantas tintoreras usadas antiguamente, y recuperar su uso para teñir ropa de forma natural.

El objetivo es que las mujeres de las comunidades Maya, a menudo empobrecidas y muchas veces en riesgo de exclusión social, encuentren una manera de salir adelante, una fuente de ingresos estable. Las mujeres de las comunidades Maya no tienen acceso a la propiedad de la tierra, que está en manos de los hombres, tampoco acceden al mercado laboral para que las mejores oportunidades las ocupan los hombres, ya menudo deben encargarse solas del mantenimiento familiar.

La creación de un huerto de plantas tintoreras y la obtención de tejidos tradicionales teñidos de forma natural es una buena oportunidad para ellas, ya que les abriría las puertas a un sistema de auto-financiación ética y sostenible.

Ahora nos encontramos con que se ha generado interés por la labor ya hecha, pero no tenemos recursos económicos para seguir adelante. Disponemos del terreno, pero necesitamos ampliar el huerto de plantas tintoreras, hacer un pequeño invernadero, también un abrigo desde donde hacer el trabajo cuando llueve (la temporada de lluvias dura seis meses) y desde donde mostrar las técnicas a otros mujeres, grupos o asociaciones, también a los turistas, claro, poner riego por goteo (el agua es escasa durante la temporada seca), comprar herramientas agrícolas de mano, y dar a conocer lo que hacemos.


Un poco de historia

Ancestralmente, los tintes naturales usaban no sólo para la ropa, también para pintar los murales de los templos, decorar las casas y pintar el propio cuerpo con motivos ornamentales. En la tradición textil se mezclaban los tejidos de algodón con los de maguey, las plumas y objetos diversos como pedrería y detalles de metal. Todo formaba parte del lenguaje corporal y de signos que se conoce como la cosmovisión Maya.

En la actualidad, después de tantos años, y debido a la dinámica de toda cultura y también a elementos externos como la aún reciente guerra civil en Guatemala, el terremoto del año 1976, o el huracán Mitch, la inestabilidad social es elevada, muchos de estos conocimientos se han olvidado o están a punto de olvidarse, o bien han sido superpuestos por los de otras culturas dominantes. Hoy en día ya tan sólo algunas ancianas recuerdan las antiguas técnicas de teñido con plantas, y la demostración de cómo se hacía ha quedado relegada a un mero papel turístico. Pero las mujeres, en su papel social de madres, gestoras de la vida y transmisoras de cultura, han utilizado el lenguaje de los colores y de las geometrías de los tejidos como un texto de palabras silenciosas que ha llegado hasta hoy en día (aunque la mayoría ya usen hilo de algodón transgénico y teñido artificialmente en otros países).

La zona del lago Atitlán es especial, no sólo porque su microclima favorece la reproducción y crecimiento de muchas especies vegetales, sino también porque la lengua y la tradición Maya se conservan muy intensamente (la lengua Tz'utujil, el Cakchiquel y el Quiché que se hablan en el lago Atitlán son las 3 lenguas principales de las 22 lenguas Maya que aún hoy se conservan, repartidas entre el norte de Guatemala y Chiapas, en el sur de México).


Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

Tan sólo pedimos 1.000€, pero en Guatemala con esta cantidad se pueden hacer muchas cosas! Queremos comprar herramientas agrícolas de mano porque no tenemos suficiente para todos, queremos hacer un sistema de riego por goteo, un pequeño invernadero de 10m2 y una Choza tradicional, hecha con materiales locales (madera y hoja de palma) donde las mujeres puedan refugiarse cuando llueve (la temporada de lluvias dura seis meses del año, y llueve todas las tardes) y así seguir trabajando.

En el pequeño invernadero queremos hacer germinar las semillas de las especies silvestres que hemos ido recogiendo, ampliar el banco de semillas y que las podamos distribuir localmente entre otras mujeres interesadas en teñir el algodón de forma natural.

En la Choza queremos instalar un pequeño fuego central de leña donde se pueda calentar el agua que luego utilizaremos para teñir el algodón, así como poner unos tendederos donde secar el hilo de algodón ya teñido. También será un lugar de reunión y de demostración del proceso.

El huerto debe ser el motor central del proyecto, un huerto-madre desde donde se puedan hacer crecer las plantas que hasta ahora se recogían de forma salvaje y que sirva de banco vegetal para otras mujeres interesadas en recuperar la tradición.

Hemos hecho un pequeño presupuesto que no tiene en cuenta la mano de obra, sólo los materiales, porque lo haremos todo nosotros:

Construcción de la Choza: 700 €

Compra de herramientas de mano (azadas, picos, palas ...): 50 €

Construcción de un sistema de riego por goteo: 50 €

Construcción de un pequeño invernadero: 50 €

Varios utensilios para la germinación de semillas y reproducción por esqueje: 50 €

Abono orgánico: 50 €

Compra de ollas y otros utensilios para el teñido del algodón: 50 €

TOTAL: 1.000€

Aunque no consigamos TODO el dinero, cualquier cantidad nos servirá para seguir trabajando.


El impacto

Todo ello nos servirá para abrir un mercado hasta ahora inexistente, y así crear una fuente de riqueza para las pequeñas comunidades de mujeres que viven alrededor del lago Atitlán.

No tenemos otra fuente de financiación. No creemos en las ONG, muchas de las cuales vienen aquí a hacer creer que son solidarias, que quieren ayudar, y gastan un poco de dinero para justificar sus enormes ingresos y luego se van dejando la misma situación de antes. Queremos avanzar por nuestros propios métodos, sin deber nada a nadie y sin paternalismos.

Este proyecto es interesante desde cuatro vertientes: 1) porque supone la recuperación de la cultura Maya; 2) porque cohesiona la comunidad y la hace más sostenible económicamente; 3) porque supone el fortalecimiento del papel de la mujer en la sociedad; 4) porque implica el respeto por la naturaleza y el cultivo ecológico.

Experiencia previa

Este proyecto ya lleva dos años de andadura, sin ayuda económica alguna y todo gracias a la confianza mútua del pequeño equipo local. Tenemos formaciones muy diversas pero un interés común; nuestro equipo "multidisciplinar" està formado básicamente por mujeres de las comunidades Maya del lago Atitlán, pero también por otros voluntarios, como yo mismo. 

A nivel de crowdfunding, he organizado 3 proyectos (Verkami), y los tres consiguieron llegar a la financiación total: el libro "El largo camino de escribir", de Cesk Freixas y Marc Freixas, el libro "Ta Kritiká - viaje por la música de Creta ", de Jordi Alsina, y la obra colectiva "Historias vecinales", dirigida por Josep Melero.

A nivel de proyectos sociales, hace dos años que colaboro con diversas asociaciones, fundaciones privadas y ONG en Guatemala, desde las estadounidenses "Mayan Families" (www.mayanfamilies.org) y "Niños del lago" (www. ninosdellago.org), a la guatemalteca "Ati't Ala" y la española "Exterior XXI" (AECID). Antes había colaborado con Médicos Sin Fronteras y fuí uno de los primeros voluntarios de la Asociación de Familiares de Enfermos de Alzheimer de Cataluña (AFAC).


Riesgos y desafíos

Riesgos: En la base de los problemas se encuentra, como ya es usual en este tipo de proyectos, el alto grado de analfabetismo y de desescolarización de la población local, sumado a un progresivo descontento social por la falta de alternativas laborales, con la consecuente fragmentación de las familias y creación de colectivos marginados (en este caso, principalmente las mujeres).

Las alternativas de cambio se ven dificultadas por la propiedad de la tierra en manos de los hombres y por un desigual nivel de acceso al mercado laboral: las profesiones están reservadas a los hombres; los salarios por servicios domésticos, en el caso de la mujer, están peor pagados. Se suman a estos factores el creciente turismo en manos extranjeras, que se apodera de los mejores enclaves y relega a la población local a ser meros espectadores, y también la expansión de monocultivos ( café, maíz) que se venden a cooperativas que, a su vez, venden a multinacionales que fijan los precios.

A nivel del presente proyecto, se detecta el problema de la fragmentación de las organizaciones de mujeres, lo cual dice mucho de su desorganización interna y falta de efectividad. También se advierte el desconocimiento de técnicas de cultivo ecológico y de silvicultura.

Otro reto a superar es la creciente presencia en el mercado local de hilo de algodón transgénico teñido mediante procesos sintéticos, que ha sustituido prácticamente en su totalidad al hilo tradicional, provocando una pérdida de valor de la artesanía y resultando en que los colectivos de mujeres se vuelven dependientes del mercado textil internacional. La principal barrera a superar es el precio final del hilo local teñido mediante procesos ecológicos y naturales.

El turismo juega un importante papel a la hora de valorar este tipo de productos y las organizaciones locales que hay detrás de ellos. El turismo local es una oportunidad pero también es un reto, ya que las asociaciones de mujeres deben organizarse de modo que puedan atenderlos. En este sentido, uno de los retos a superar es el desconocimiento del comprador, que no distingue entre un tejido elaborado por métodos tradicionales e hilo natural de otro confeccionado con hilo sintético.

Finalmente, el gran problema sigue siendo, como siempre, la falta de recursos económicos. Este proyecto supone arrancar una pequeña iniciativa que puede ser multiplicada sinérgicamente y “copiada” a otras localidades de Guatemala, mejorando la calidad de vida global.


Desafíos: Para este proyecto se parte de los resultados ya obtenidos (Estudio de Viabilidad Vegetal, o identificación de los sistemas más adecuados de germinación de semillas silvestres y desarrollo de plántulas en invernadero) que permitirá pasar de la recolección silvestre de plantas tintoreras a su cultivo organizado. 

El objetivo general, sin lugar a dudas, es la mejora de la calidad de vida de las comunidades de mujeres de la zona de Atitlán, rompiendo el círculo que les niega el acceso al trabajo remunerado y aumentando el nivel de sus ingresos fijos. En el fondo, se trata de lograr una mayor cohesión social y familiar.  Los objetivos específicos son, por un lado, conseguir que las mujeres de Atitlán se organicen en un sistema de producción basado en sus propias tradiciones y conocimientos, darles formación en cultivo ecológico y sostenibilidad, y formación en gestión de asociaciones y/o microempresas familiares. Por otro lado, son objetivos específicos de este proyecto también revalorizar el mercado local de artesanía y fomentar el turismo cultural sostenible en la zona.


Resultados esperados:

• La ampliación del actual huerto ecológico, en el cual formar a las mujeres, reproducir semillas de plantas tintoreras y poder ofrecerlas a los grupos de cultivadoras para expandir su cultivo.

• Organizar de forma sistemática el proceso de teñido en un único centro del cual puedan servirse todas las mujeres tejedoras. 

• La formación de las mujeres en cuestiones de organización interna, sistemas de control y gestión comunitaria efectiva.

• La revalorización del mercado local artesanal tradicional y la promoción ante el turismo cultural hace necesaria la creación de sellos de calidad claramente diferenciables.

• La expansión de este sistema organizativo y de producción a todas aquellas otras comunidades de mujeres de Guatemala que así lo deseen.

• Lograr que su organización interna sea suficientemente efectiva como para que no sea necesario, por más tiempo, el soporte externo.


Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

Si,  por la razón que sea, no puedes colaborar económicamente, también nos pueds ayudar:

  • Ayuda a difundir este proyecto entre tus conocidos, en las redes sociales, la vecindad, el lugar de trabajo...
  • Esta plataforma, Indiegogo, te ofrece herramientas que puedes usar para ayudarnos a difundir la campaña.

Y eso es todo.

story:
Hello Everyone! I'm an Indie Author, published by a small press. My debut paranormal thriller, THE FEATHERS, was published in August, 2014. It currently has 48 Five-Star reviews on Amazon and word is spreading! My second novel, THE IRISES will be out in June, 2015. Both books are part of The Southern Spectral Series. I have been working very hard in the last year in the marketing of my first novel and although I have received positive attention, it's time to raise the bar.

Since the press I work with is small, there are no funds for marketing or distribution of my books into independent bookstores. That's where you come in! I am seeking donations to fund these endeavors:


-Contact indie bookstores, mail copies of books, provide book postcards.

-Mail books across the country to bookstores and follow up with book signings and book talks where applicable and doable.

-Market both books to magazines, websites, blogs, and bookstores.


What We Need & What You Get


WHAT WE NEED:

-I am seeking $4,250  for this project. Here's why:

- $1,400: Purchase of THE IRISES. Yes, I have to purchase my own book for distribution as my press cannot afford to send books out to bookstores, etc. I currently have copies of THE FEATHERS for distribution.

-$400: Mailing of both books, letterhead mailings sent to bookstores, magazines, and other places that may carry the books (record stores, New Orleans related stores, etc.)

-$600: Payment towards my very qualified PR guru. This money will help him spread the word wider and further. He works behind the scenes and provides an amazing product.

-$400: Postcards and bookmarks created for both books. These will be used for book insertions, handouts, and mailings.

-$400: New Orleans trinkets, tokens, gifts, marketing products sent with both books and displayed with them at bookstores.

-$450: Bouchercon Conference in October. This is a premier thriller writers conference and a crucial place for the sharing and marketing of books.

-$600: Various paid advertisements and marketing announcements on website, blogs and magazines.

WHAT YOU GET!:

-$35 donation: A signed book of my first novel, THE FEATHERS

-$50 donation: A signed book of my first novel, THE FEATHERS along with a New Orleans inspired gift.

-$100 donation: A signed copy of both THE FEATHERS and THE IRISES along with A New Orleans inspired gift.

-$250 donation: Both books, signed, a New Orleans inspired gift and your name in my next novel, the third book in the series. If too many names are received, your name will go into my fourth novel. Or course I have the freedom to  assign your name to any character I choose. :)

-$500 and up: donation: All of the $250 donation gifts plus a free audio version of THE FEATHERS along with a gift basket of New Orleans treats.



The Impact

As an Indie Author, this project is incredibly important to me. Unlike those published with the big publishing houses, I have no marketing team other than my own private PR person. Word of mouth and exposure is crucial to the success of my books and opening up readers to an author and a series that they may never hear of otherwise.


Risks & Challenges

I will work hard to bring all of this to fruition. Your donations mean the world to us and with them, we will be able to send THE FEATHERS and  THE IRISES further into the world. THANK YOU! xxx

story:
Dear friends and visitors, 

thanks for visiting  this Campaign and for being ready to learn about a project which is of particular importance to me. And of course, I do hope, you will understand why this is so, and hope you will share the cause and support this project! So here is the

Purpose of the project

I want to have the German book "Mein Theresienstädter Tagebuch 1943-1944" (My Terezin Diary) by Helga Pollak-Kinsky (1930) translated into English, I want to  edit and to prepare it for an English edition (print) and to produce and release, as a first step and result of this project: an Ebook in the English language.

Helga's Diary

"The story of Helga Pollak is a model case of remembering the fate of the European Jewish children during the Holocaust. Her autobiographical notes are comparable to those of Anne Frank... Her story will move many more generations to come." 

This is what the distinguised Professor of education and history,  Dr. Peter Gstettner, Austria, wrote in the epilogue for the book.

Many readers have compared Helga's diary with the diary of Anne Frank. And in fact, this document has, in the last ten years, unfolded an astounding  international impact and developed a strong life of its own. This is so because excerpts of it form the heart of the book 'The Girls of Room 28'. This book was first published in 2004 in Germany, followed by a Czech, American, Polish and a Brazilian edition. Parallel to this book the exhibition 'The Girls of Room 28' was created in 2004 and  shown all over Germany and abroad. There is an outstanding new version in Brazil: As Meninas do Quarto 28. Please look at it on: www.room28projects.com

My role in the project

I am the author of the book and the exhibition 'The Girls of Room 28' and of 'Room 28 Projects'. In 2014 I founded  Edition Room 28  and became editor and publisher of Helga's precious Theresienstadt Diary. So this is my first publishing adventure. I published Helga's diary, because I know what a treasure of documents and what a stirring story Helga is sharing with us. And I published it, because I did not want to wait any longer. Helga is 85 years old. She lives in Vienna - a wonderful woman!

"Mein Theresienstädter Tagebuch 1943-1944" contains the complete original diary of Helga and the calendar-notes of her father Otto Pollak and many more valuable testimonies. The book tells Helga's very personal story, it reveals the strong bond between father and daughter, their togetherness and the interwovenness of their experiences, hopes and fears.

Quotes from book-reviews:

"Helgas Tagebuch ist ein einzigartiges Dokument des Widerstands; weil aus ihm eine Halbwüchsige spricht, die sich über die Verhältnisse erhebt."

Helga's Diary is a unique document of resistance; we are witnessing a youth rising above the conditions she is forced to live in.
Austrian author Erich Hackl

"Was dieses Buch so besonders macht, sind nicht nur die überdurchschnittlich reflektierten Tagebucheinträge des jungen Mädchens, sondern auch deren Gegenüberstellung mit den kurzen, nicht minder eindringlichen Notizen ihres Vaters, der zur selben Zeit in Theresienstadt lebte und sogar miterleben musste, wie seine einzige Tochter nach Auschwitz deportiert wurde. "

What makes this book so special, beyond Helga's highly reflected diary entrances -   is the juxtaposition of her notes with the notes of her father, which are no less poignant. Her father, who is living at the same time in Theresienstadt, even had to see and experience  how his only daughter was deported to Auschwitz.
Sonja Harter, APA (Austrian Press Agency)

For more medio-echos please visit:  Editon Room 28 Medienecho.

Special offer

within the frame of the Campaign

Should you consider to donate, but hesitate, as you do not know the book -
Here is my special offer:
You can get the book with 50% discount plus mailing expenses. This means: You get the book for 11€ instead of 22€. If you want to have a set of postcards and some flyers, the prize is 15€. Send me an Email please if you are interested. 
You find this offer also on: www.edition-room28.de


The risk: What happens if the Campaign does not reach its aim

Whatever money comes in:
The amount will be used to start the translation of the book into English.

And we will raise more money over the charity Room 28 e.V. This charity is founded in 2007 to support the cause of 'The Girls of Room 28'. In fact: You could donate directly. If you do, just add as purpose: Helgas Diary.
Germans  will get a tax-reductable donation-receipt. The charity is acknowledged a non-profit organisation. Visit: room28.net
if there are any questions, please write me an Email.

Liebe Freunde in Deutschland: Spenden können auch auf das Vereinskonto überwiesen werden mit dem Vermerk: Helgas Diary. Der Verein stellt eine steuerbegünstigende Spendenbescheinigung aus! Das Geld wird ausschließlich für dieses projekt verwendet.

Helga Pollak-Kinsky, née 1930

Helga Pollak-Kinsky is a highly recognized 'Zeitzeugin' (eyewitness) and survivor of the Holocaust. She was keynote-speaker of the Holocaust Remembrance Ceremony at the United Nations in Geneva in 2014, a year before she was invited, for the same occasion, to the European Commission in Brussels, where she read from her diary. In 2013 she was awarded the Federal Cross of Merit (Bundesverdienstkreuz) from Germany, the celebration took place in the German Embassy in Vienna.  For more information and impressions of Helga's activities and events visit: Edition Room 28 events.


Recently, in the new film about the Holocaust project of the renowned Austrian artist Manfred Bockelmann "Zeichnen gegen das Vergessen" (Drawing against Oblivion"), Helga is playing an important part. The film premiered on 8 May 2015 in Munic and is a great success. More about this film on the Website of Zeichnen gegen das Vergessen.

My deepest wish and obligation

As editor and publisher of Helga's Diary, it is my deepest wish and obligation to bring about the English edition during life-time of Helga Pollak-Kinsky - after all:  Helga will have her 85th birthday on 28 May 2015!

So this is why I ask you, friends of Helga and her Terezin Diary, friends of Room 28 and dear visitors of this  Site and Fundraising Campaign: Help me to realize this project, so that Helga's  precious documents can be published soon in the English speaking countries, both in print and as Ebook. And help me to bring joy into the life of Helga - I know, that she will be happy to see her book published in English and, hopefully soon, in other languages.
 


"The diary of Helga Pollak with its wealth of details is a completely authentic and a moving account of a girl's life in the Terezin ghetto. For my documentaries it became the most important inspiration"
Zuzana Justman, filmmaker, whose documentaries "Voices of the Children" (Emmy Award) and "Terezin Diary" were inspired by Helgas Diary.


Required budget to produce an E-book of 'My Terezin Diary' (English)

Translation of the book:                     5000 €
Editing, proofreading:                         2000 €
Design of the Ebook                            2000 €
Organization, Promotion                   1000 €

Planned date of publication:

at the latest on Helga birthday next year:  28 May 2016

In addition to the Perks all donators get the Ebook once it is released.


Helga's Painting from Theresienstadt

The aquarell below was made by Helga Pollak, in Art Lessons with Friedl Dicker-Brandeis in Room 28, Theresienstadt, 1943/1944. It was the front-page of the 1996 Calendar published by the United States Holocaust Memorial Museum in Washington. The accompanying text said, that it is from Helga Pollak, followed by the words: "Her fate is unknown". -

Those who read the book "Mein Theresienstädter Tagebuch" will learn about Helga's fate and life.

Aquarell by Helga Pollak, Theresienstadt, 1943/1944

story:
We are from Gaza, 
and we are not numbers.

That is the slogan of our campaign, launched in conjunction with the one-year anniversary of the Israeli assault on Gaza, “Operation Protective Edge.” 

We say it with conviction, we say it with pride, and we say it with determination. Despite the fact that reconstruction of our destroyed homes is almost nonexistent, our fishermen and farmers are regularly shot at when they try to make a living, and we still cannot travel freely, 

we will – with your help – keep on rising up.

In February of this year, we raised $8,500 from 136 donors around the world. It enabled us to build our website, hire a part-time project coordinator, complete training of 15 promising English writers (including paying for travel to weekly meetings and fuel for a back-up generator) and publish our first round of stories with the help of our incredible mentors. (Have you read any of them yet? Please do! We think you’ll be surprised, and as excited as we are. We’ve had pieces published now on Truthout, Middle East Eye, Mondoweiss and more. )

But more and more Gaza youth want to join, and we are already at 30! 

Our international director also has traveled to Lebanon and is partnering with an organization to help Palestinian refugees there join our project.

So we are coming back earlier than planned and hope you will help us leap to the next step. If we can make our stretch goal, we can expand our capacity for writers by:

  • adding another staff person
  • paying everyone's transportation costs
  • rewarding all writers who meet their commitments with periodic income that will help support their families.

Please donate what you can and share this page, because

you know we aren’t numbers!

story:
Very good advice:  Introduce yourself and background, briefly describe your campaign, express the magnitude of what support means to you, be concise and personal....

I believe this journey, A Breakthrough in Bali, speaks to the possibility and power of love and transformation in all of our lives, not just my own.

 Years ago, I moved to DC to become a writer.   I wrote a novel called Learning This Life.  After my father had his first of three heart attacks, I essentially stopped writing. I couldn't find the words.  In the last 15 years I’ve learned incredible lessons about life, crisis, grief, loss, friendship, fear, faith, and family.  I want to share these lessons with hope that my experience, and the experience of others featured in the book, will somehow inspire and help anyone navigating a crisis.  

I've received an invitation to travel to Bali, Indonesia with a small group of writers.   The purpose of this 28 day retreat is to help writers who have been blocked, liberate their project through a structured writing process that includes coaching and peer support.  http://bali.thedailylove.com/ 

Joining this journey by donating any amount doesn't just "help me go on a trip" as someone who won't be donating shared.
 
I think joining the journey speaks to the possibility of opportunity in all of our lives.  I think it supports the idea that none of us can make it through the rollercoaster of life without a community, support, humility and gratitude.   I think it represents finding courage to take a chance, and what amazing things can happen when we all say yes to living with purpose.  

Very good advice:  Break it down for folks in more detail, and what will they get by supporting you.

The trip will cost me over $10,000.  I want to fundraise a portion of it because this was an unexpected opportunity.  I work very hard, but at the moment I'm on my own, and don't have a full-time job (another leap of faith).  The flow of money can be very tight, and not working for a month will present an additional financial obstacle.  

I will have tangible perks to those of you who donate.  There will be ways your support will come back to you.   When I know what the perks are I will share more.   They will exist, and they will be beautiful and come from the heart.  


    Very good advice:  explain more about the impact, be open to the risks and obstacles and what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles, describe your plan for solving any challenges:

    My book will be called Learning This Life.   This time it will be my story, and the stories of others who have had to navigate crisis and what we've learned.  I know firsthand sharing these stories can make a positive impact on our lives.  

    The truth is - the list of risks and obstacles in this endeavor are too many to list here.   There are hundreds of ways that this could be all bad.   However, one of the greatest lessons I've learned from the life and the loss of my father was to learn to manage fear.   There are hundreds of ways this could be all good.  So as of this sentence, I'm cultivating less and less fear about Bali.   Let's all get on the less fear, more faith train.  

    Very good advice: some people can't donate - other ways to support.

    Positive thoughts, prayers, good energy, spreading the word.  Most of all - living your own powerful life - we are all connected and I can never get enough inspiration.

    I believe there will be a breakthrough in Bali!  I truly appreciate your consideration and your support.

       

    Sample Writing:

    Here Comes The Sun:  http://michonlartigue.blogspot.com/2012/12/here-comes-sun-today-is-december-1-2012.html

Positive thoughts, prayers, good energy, spreading the word.  Most of all - living your own powerful life - we are all connected and I can never get enough inspiration.I believe there will be a breakthrough in Bali!  I truly appreciate your consideration and your
support.    Sample Writing:Here Comes The Sun:  http://michonlartigue.blogspot.com/2012/12/here-comes-sun-today-is-december-1-2012.html

story:
Who we are: Italian buddies

We are three Italian friends and we have an idea.

We live in Venice, one of the most spectacular cities in the world (the most beautiful, to us).

We meet the tourists who visit our city every single day. We often stop to talk to them and give them information. Some of them even become our friends.

Everyone is charmed by Venice. But, having said that, we know that many of her visitors encounter more troubles than they could have imagined.

Tips in tourist information leaflets are often incomplete or misleading, and sometimes prices aren’t clear. In general, life for tourists in Venice is much more difficult than it is for locals.

Let us give you some real examples:

  • H.D. from Portland, Oregon, had planned to visit Italy for six months, but had to go back after just two: he came across so many hidden costs that he ran out of money.
  • Two friends from Ukraine, right after landing at the airport, spent more money on bus tickets than they should have done. The next day, a shopkeeper short-changed them. 
  • One of us (Elvio), was speaking English with an American friend at a bar counter. They ordered a coffee and were charged 1.50€ instead of the regular price of 1€. When Elvio asked for explanations (in Italian) they were charged the correct price. 

Those are just a few examples of the kind of unfortunate experience it is possible to have in Venice. (You could find many more on the Internet). The way we see it, all of them could easily have been avoided with the help of a local buddy.

Just imagine how much easier life would be for all tourists if they had a local friend to guide them with hints and tips on how to avoid bad deals, saving money and time, and generally living like a local.

For all those reasons, we decided to do something. We want to make sure that:

  1. Every tourist returns home with only beautiful memories.
  2. The reputation of Venice is protected from the dishonesty of the few.

Our hope is that our work will set an example not only for Venice but for every Italian city, that tourists will be respected and treated fairly as a result, and – why not? – that one day everyone will have an Italian Buddy ready to help them.

What You Get

So, how are we going do to it?

We are writing a concise and direct guide to Venice. Inside, you won’t find any cultural information, nor any advice on restaurants or hotels of the sort you’d find in a traditional guidebook.

What you will find instead are practical and honest suggestions that only locals could know, which will help you to save tons of money and time.

What you will find

  • You will find concise, honest and direct advice on enjoying Venice without wasting money and time.
  • You will learn some of the tricks that tourists find most difficult to figure out.
  • You will learn how to spot tourist traps like an Italian
  • You will find frank explanations of what to avoid and what to enjoy, and maps showing all the most important things, like toilets!
An example? D

id you know that if you sit down in a bar and order a coffee the price will be higher than if you drink it standing at the counter?


What you won’t find

  • You won’t find cultural information about monuments or the city itself. There are already hundreds of guides like that and they can tell you a lot more than we ever could.
  • You won’t find long, rambling paragraphs that mean that you have to read through ten lines of text when you just want basic answers.
  • You won’t find hotel or restaurant recommendations. Why would we bother? There are already amazing websites where you can find reviews of every place in town. Why should you trust us more than them? And how could you be sure that our recommendations are honest and not sponsored, like those of many other guides?

Table of contents

Below is a detailed list of the names of different sections of our guide. The numbers enclosed in square brackets are the number of pages in each section (format 5x8in/13x20cm).

  • Preface [1]
  • Introduction [4]
  • How to get there [10]
  • How to get around [12]
  • Useful Information [8]
  • Accommodation [8]
  • Useful and practical info [16]
  • Myths to confirm and to debunk [10]
  • Hints and Tips [8]
  • How to avoid bad deals [12]
  • Food and eating [18]
  • Nightlife [12]
  • Annual Events [18]
  • Surroundings [8]
  • Curiosities [12]
  • Maps[6]

But wait! It’s not over, yet.

The guide will be released both in print form and as an ebook. Here are the specs:

  1. Printed version: format 5x8in / 13x20 cm, printed by Blurb.com. Standard Color pages, Softcover (perfect bound).
  2. Deluxe version: same as above with hard cover.
  3. Electronic: PDF or EPUB.
We also have a demo guide on our website that you can fully browse to see how the final product will look like. Click on this link to access the preview.

Whatcha sayin'? You're stunned by all this?
BAM. T-SHIRTS. Everybody loves t-shirts, right?

For all those of you who'd like to share your love for your Italian buddies, we've prepared four t-shirt designs, each one more awesome than the other.

Check out the gallery using the link above to see all the designs and a few samples.
All t-shirts are available in:
  • Male/Female/Female tank top
  • Colors: white
  • Plenty of different sizes

Visit our website to see the possible designs and sizes cheat sheets.

What we need and why

So, how much does all this cost?

The sad news is that we've had already a few expenses:

  • Graphic design (logo, cover, t-shirts, etc.): 800$
  • Website domain and related expenses: 250$
  • Translation: 1000$
  • Video shooting: 300$
  • Test prints and inDesign classes: 300$
  • Advertising: 400$
  • Legal and financial consulting: 200$

The total, approximately, 3250$, is the amount we hope to raise with this campaign.

The Impact

As we’ve said, we feel like our country (Italy) isn't doing enough to protect its reputation amongst tourists. Many people see them as a resource to exploit and not as a mean for sharing our culture.

We (Italians) have always been a little shortsighted. We tend to have excellent ideas but we often lack the perseverance to plan things ahead and bring them to a conclusion. That's why so many people don't understand that whilst exploiting a tourist on their holiday is certainly profitable in the short term it will irremediably damage our image over time.

Instead, we, your Italian buddies want to put an end to this, as much as we can. We’re starting with Venice because it’s our city and we know it well but, as we said, we like to think that we're just beginning. Our next targets are Rome, Florence and Milan.

So let us ask you: would you help us help tourists like you, not just in Venice, but in all the major cities of Italy?

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, that's perfectly fine! Really! What else you can do:

  • For starters, if you like the sound of our mission, tell it to your friends! We always like having more buddies.
  • Share this campaign. Visit our website www.italianbuddy.com and share that too
  • Send us feedback, comments, insults or whatever you want. Everything will help us become better.

story:
Short Summary

I'm a PhD student in English literature and an experienced writer and editor. I wanted to self-publish my poetry, so I did -- and I figured I'd keep using my layout and editing skills to publish other people's work, too. Right now, creators get a percentage of sales from the booklets and PDFs. I would love to be able to pay my authors up front just for contributing, on top of the sales percentage. I would also love the hire other editors from the LGBT community to help me with copyediting. Paying creators and editors from my community is especially important to me. Your donation can make that happen!

Read more about Lemniscate Small Press here. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • Right now, I pay for all printing costs out of pocket. Each run of 30 booklets costs about $90 CAD. On top of this, my labour (editing, layout, communicating with creators/printing company, and illustrating if necessary) means that each run costs me about $250 at minimum wage on top of the printing costs. If I had a crowdfund to draw on, this would ease the burden on me financially and allow me to print more booklets. My goal is a pie-in-the-sky goal, and any bit helps! 
  • For supporting Lemniscate Small Press via IndieGoGo, you will get the satisfaction of knowing you are paying members of the LGBT community for their creative output, helping up-and-coming writers get a wider platform, AND the reward for which you qualify. 

What We Do

We seek:

-short fiction (less than 10,000 words) and poetry

-speculative, fantasy, confessional, experimental genres

We are especially interested in:

-topics relating to mental illness, trauma, identity, time & temporality

-publishing work by PoC and members of the LGBT community

We love:

-weird stuff; gore; “mature” content/themes

We abhor:

-anything racist, homophobic, transphobic, misogynist, ableist, fatphobic, etc.

We pay:

-royalties based on sales to be negotiated at time of manuscript acceptance (and with your donations, a one-time flat rate as well)

We consider:

-unsolicited submissions in the form of a PDF attachment in an email including author’s name, title, and word count

-previously unpublished work

-illustrated and unillustrated submissions

We:

-edit for spelling/grammar/punctuation but seek author approval before printing

-format and print all publications

-sell printed and pdf versions of our publications online and at flea markets, galleries, etc.

-are available to illustrate your work

Contributors:

-retain all rights to their work

-receive a copy of their printed publication mailed to them for free

 

Risks & Challenges

I don't foresee many risks or challenges, because I'm already running this press on my own with my own funds; I'm going to keep doing that. But I can expand and pay more creators even more money with your help. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, but you'd like to help out, you can:

  • shop for a previous booklet or PDF 
  • spread the word! Share this campaign or the website with anyone and everyone you think might be into it.

Thanks so much for reading!

story:
Hi, my name is Ellen. Bienvenue à Paris, welcome to Paris! I am a native of Palo Alto, California, but  I grew up on the East Coast, on Long Island. When I was a student in college, I had the opportunity to do study abroad. So, I arrived in Paris France in August of 1991, and I’ve lived and worked here ever since.

Now, a quarter century later, I’d like to document and chronicle my story, by writing my memoires. I’m hoping to add to the body of work written by minorities about extraordinary experiences abroad.

My book about my life in France is almost finished. Twenty plus years of notes, in drips and drabs. I’m crowdfunding to cover a lot of things: editing, illustration, cover design, cross editing, proofreading, purchase of advance copies, translation, professional recording of an audio book.

But most importantly, your gift will be the gift of time. Suspend my day job; spare me the busy work, so that I can get this project done. Thank you so much, merci beaucoup!

story:
NOW AVAILABLE on Amazon: https://www.amazon.co.uk/Founding-Women-African...

All proceeds go towards proving training and mentorship to support young African women into entrepreneurship and technology

Why is this book important?

The lack of visible role models hinders many young African women from becoming tech entrepreneurs who can create solutions that solve challenges in their communities.

The Founding Women book will share the inspiring entrepreneurship journeys of African women who are overcoming the odds to build successful, high-impact businesses in tech.

Our goal is help break down the barriers preventing young African women from becoming future tech leaders by highlighting role models and providing mentorship

We are interviewing inspirational founders such as Rebecca Enonchong, CEO of AppsTech who was named one of the top female tech Founders to watch in Africa by Forbes (Read her interview) and Hilda Moraa - Founder & CEO of Pezesha who previously founded Weza Tele, the first African tech startup to successfully exit when it was acquired by JumoWorld in 2015 -  as well as other established and upcoming founders working in energy, health, software and fintech. View our growing list of female founders.

 

How will the funds be used?

Apart from printing and delivery costs, all contributions will go towards our training & mentorship programme supporting young African women to kick-start their businesses.

Milestones & targets

  • £4500 - Will enable us to print  100 books, donate 50 books and provide 50 hours of mentorship to young African female entrepreneurs over the next 6 months.
  • £7500 - Will enable us to print 200 books, donate 100 books & provide 100 hours of mentorship to young African female entrepreneurs over the next 6 months.
  • £10000 - Will enable us to print 300 books, donate 150 books & provide 200 hours of mentorship to young African female entrepreneurs over the next 6 months.

About our Training & Mentorship Programme

HerFutureAfrica is our programme equipping young African women to build tech-enabled businesses that create change in their communities. 

To date we have provided mentorship to 32 young female entrepreneurs in Ghana. Watch the video from our startup bootcamp in Accra.

One of them was 26 year old Ivy Barley, joined our programme with just a rough idea and her passion for teaching others to code. We helped her carry out market research to refine her idea, develop her business proposal and pitch deck and connected her with a mentor. She and her co-Founder also met and connected at our bootcamp! Just a few months down the road,  she has won multiple awards, pitched in front Angela Merkel and won  €15,000 to launch her venture Developers in Vogue which is now training 20 young women in Ghana to code.  

 

"I want to take this opportunity to thank the partners and sponsors of the Her Future Africa program. Aside from all the other benefits that came with it, I'd like to highlight the role my mentor Huw Thomas has played so far. My mentor has been very instrumental to starting Developers In Vogue. Aside from giving me very valuable feedback on all my assignments, he has been very supportive to date. He's always on the lookout for opportunities to promote my work and through him, I've been connected with a number of people who have been valuable to my success." Ivy Barley 

Research shows that investing in women provides a x10 return for community and Ivy's story is proof of that!  Read Ivy's journey

By pledging a book and supporting our campaign you can become part of creating a ripple effect of impact in African communities!​

How else can you help?

1) Share our campaign with your network and help us spread the word!

Suggested tweet/social media post:

Help inspire & equip young African women to be future #tech leaders & change-makers by supporting #FoundingWomen igg.me/at/foundingwomen

2) Volunteer to be a #HerFutureAfrica mentor.  Learn more about becoming a mentor.

3) Introduce us to your employer or organisation to sponsor one of our programmes. Email programmes@africatbn.com

 

About us:

Africa Technology Business Network (ATBN) is a non-profit social enterprise working to empower African technology entrepreneurs to grow their businesses and impact their communities.

 

We believe in the immense potential of technology as a catalyst for development in Africa and that African tech entrepreneurs will be the key drivers of growth. Our vision is to see Africa as a leading hub for globally relevant innovation with skilled entrepreneurs, particularly women at the forefront.

To learn more about our work and how to get involved visit www.africatbn.com

Connect with us on Twitter and Facebook.

Research shows that investing in women provides a x10 return for community and Ivy's story is proof of that!  Read Ivy's journey
By pledging a book and supporting our campaign you can become part of creating a ripple effect of impact in African communities!​
How else can you help?
1) Share our campaign with your network and help us spread the word!
Suggested tweet/social media post:
Help inspire & equip young African women to be future #tech leaders & change-makers by supporting #FoundingWomen igg.me/at/foundingwomen
2) Volunteer to be a #HerFutureAfrica mentor.  Learn more about becoming a mentor.
3) Introduce us to your employer or organisation to sponsor one of our programmes. Email programmes@africatbn.com
 
About us:
Africa Technology Business Network (ATBN) is a non-profit social enterprise working to empower African technology entrepreneurs to grow their businesses and impact their communities.
 
We believe in the immense potential of technology as a catalyst for development in Africa and that African tech entrepreneurs will be the key drivers of growth. Our vision is to see Africa as a leading hub for globally relevant innovation with skilled entrepreneurs, particularly women at the forefront.

To learn more about our work and how to get involved visit www.africatbn.com
Connect with us on Twitter and Facebook.

story:
Our Editor-in-Chief is a coder and journalist of the old school. He wrote a game hints and tips column for Australian Commodore & Amiga Review for a year when he was 17, had a SEUCK game published commercially by local games company ECP in 1989, and released demos in the early 90's. He made a comeback in 2005, releasing several productions and the failed development of TRONSCII; which he hopes to revisit at some point.

Earlier this year he launched the Zeroeth Issue of INC $D020; and wrote most of the content, to be received with a mixed response tainted by the league of trolls he had attracted at the time. But, it was still a good magazine chock full of interviews and code theory, and had hundreds of downloads.

You can now get a free copy of the Zeroeth Issue here, just to get a taste of what you're in for in the flagship issue. Not only will there be great in-depth interviews; there will be extensive code based articles as well.

All we need are pre-orders for 50 copies (around $1,500AU), but to be on the safe side we're erring to around 250. If we can raise just $5000AU we will be able to bring you pre-orders on the full professional colour printed first issue of INC $D020 for these low, low prices.

If we raise more than that, it will be directed at further developing the marketing and distribution of the magazine; as well as giving our contributors a little bit of pocket money.

The magazine will be supplied with an 8Gb fully loaded SD card for your sd2IEC, packed with demos, games and tools. 

The magazine will be launched at Midnight Resurgence on September 2nd. 

The flagship issue will have the same level of quality interviews with notable coders, musicians and hardware developers; as well as in-depth code theory based articles to teach YOU how to code your own demos and games. 

A disk magazine will be launched along with the first issue, and the PDF version of the magazine will be available for free after the first month of publishing. 

Already lined up for the flagship issue are an interview with the Editor-in-Chief of INC $D020, as well as interviews with Cadaver, Stingray and his Freedom Expansion Cartridge, demoscene coder and SID musican Buddha and an interview with Gazza/Warriors of Time about his upcoming BitPop C64 album. As well as this, we will feature coding articles from notable scene coders, code snippets to assist you in coding your own demo parts, and news and reviews of the latest releases. 

In the first issue we will have the following code articles; Introduction to 6510 Assembly Programming, Introduction to C64 Screen and Graphics Modes, The Art and Science of the DYCP by Buddha, Guide to Making C64 Games by Richard Bayliss, Displaying a Koala image by Richard Bayliss, Rasterbars by Graham/Oxyron, and FLD by HCL. 

So please, consider buying some of our merchandise, shouting our editor a coffee and lunch, or pledging for a pre-order of the first issue of INC $D020. No matter what, the first issue will be produced; but be warned our publisher charges high prices on postage for individual orders, hence this campaign.

We hope you can join us on this adventure and help us bring you the best C64 coders' digest we can produce.

story:
Hi. I am Dr. Catherine Pesek Bird, Founder of Paratus Consulting. My mission is to inspire, to educate & to motivate you, to be prepared for a medical emergency in your life, and in the lives of your loved ones.  As a cardiologist by training, I have worked with many patients and their loved ones, to help them to determine what they want done for them, not just done to them.

I have seen the stress that comes from not being prepared, for the patient and for their loved ones.  I believe you want to have control and I can help you achieve it.   I am passionate about my work with clients, and their loved ones, to help them to personalize their healthcare decisions.

Only about 20% of patients have an advanced directive, some written form of what they want done, in the event of a medical emergency.  Of those that do, studies show that about 70% of them are not certain of all of their choices, even after their physician explains their choices.  Some just complete the standard form offered on line or with their attorney, without an opportunity to personalize their choices.  Although some people name a person to speak for them, a  healthcare agent, rarely do they truly empower that person to speak for them.  This makes a difficult situation even more so!

I believe you do not want this confusion and uncertainty.  I believe you want to be in control and have your healthcare decisions known and your agent empowered to speak for you.  

My next project is a book that will help even more people to be prepared for life’s medical emergencies by personalizing their healthcare decision.  It is called Your Voice, Your Choice: Personalizing Your Healthcare Decisions. But I need your help.

I need to raise $5620 to cover the cost of bringing the book to life, in terms of: 1) editing, 2) proofreading, 3) cover designing, and 4) printing, or the book will not exist. So, I am turning to you, my strongest supporters, to ask for contributions. In exchange, I am offering perks, such as:

·     Autographed copies of the book,

·     Book club opportunities with me, to share our medical emergency experiences, and,

·     One-on-one time with me, to review your choices and to empower your agent.

Your contribution will help to bring my book Your Voice, Your Choice: How to Personalize Your Healthcare Decisions to life, and further, it will help all of us to be prepared for medical emergencies in our lives and the lives of our loved ones.

Thank you!

 
 
 
 
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

The Duran has been in existence now for well over a year...

In that time, we called these major events right, where most were dead wrong:

  1. The Brexit vote
  2. Donald Trump's victory
  3. Russian victory in the Syrian war
  4. Recovery of the Russian economy despite the oil price crash and the sanctions

All things the MSM said would NEVER happen, and with a fraction of the resources.

Imagine what we could do with more...

Here are some articles written by The Duran's Editor-in-Chief that prove our analysis was correct:

http://theduran.wpengine.com/jihadi-fighters-suffer-heavy-losses-battle-aleppo/

http://theduran.wpengine.com/update-great-battle-aleppo/

We have provided you with clear, objective reporting of the DNC/Podesta emails, of the Russiagate scandal in the US, and of the Korean crisis.

We have done all these things, getting these stories right where the MSM has got them all wrong.  What we report today, they (sometimes) report tomorrow, often copying us without attribution.

We have done this with only a tiny fraction of the resources that they have, in the face of a campaign by them to ban and shut down all sources of alternative news including the one we provide.

All this we have achieved purely through our own hard work.  We are a wholly independent transparent news provider bound to and associated with no-one and dependent on and controlled by no-one.  All of us are known, and we are proud that this is so, and all money we receive is fully and publicly accounted for.

Hard work however can only take us so far.  However much better we are than our MSM rivals, however hard we work, the simple fact is that we are massively outgunned.

You can help to change that.  

We are now crowdfunding to make our site grow, to add other sites to it, to give ourselves proper technical back-up, so that we can extend our reach, provide an even better news service and beat the barriers of large corporations, that under MSM encouragement, are in our way from telling the truth.

If you believe that there is a need for good objective news, for people to be properly informed so that they can make proper decisions decided on by themselves, if you want to know what is really going on and why, then we ask you to support us.

This is a key moment.  

Together we can defeat the news monopoly the failing MSM is abusing in order to retain its undeserved position of pre-eminence. Without your support it just cannot be done.

That is why we ask you to support this crowdfunding campaign.

What is DRN Media?

DRN Media is the organization we created that manages and maintains The Duran and other sites (which you may have already seen) and which employees our staff of 8 full-time writers and managers. DRN Media has absolutely no government affiliations, and we are 100% independent and reader supported.

This is who we are:

  • The Duran -  a conservative media platform that reports on global affairs from a realpolitik position (www.theduran.com)

 

  • RussiaFeed - a news aggregator and analytical platform that is the FASTEST source for news on Russia (www.russiafeed.com)

 

  • Red Pill Times - a social news and content aggregator that reports on the ridiculous world of identity politics, virtue signaling, and political correctness (www.redpilltimes.com)

 

  • COMING SOON: Hellenic Insider - a conservative media platform that reports the true situation in Greece, not a sugar-coated picture which is repeatedly given.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Managing one site is difficult and expensive - managing FOUR sites will require more full-time staff:

  • We need to pay fair salaries to our full-time writers, editors, and web team. We have built The Duran brand on the hard work of our founding team, and this is the first time we are looking to the public for help to get us to the next level!
  • Our monthly expenses for office space, writers, social media, marketing, and hosting is approximately $13,000. Advertising revenue only help us cover a fraction of our costs, and with Google, Facebook, and Twitter pushing back on alternative media, keeping our heads above water becomes increasingly difficult.
  • For your support, we will send you an assortment of The Duran branded products of mugs and pens (FREE SHIPPING WORLDWIDE!) - and even have the opportunity to speak to one of our founders or writers! Purchasing one of our mugs is a way for us to remain sustainable and in fact GROW!
  • You also have the chance to have dinner and have a night on the town with the whole team and discuss whatever you like! We can be in either London, Moscow, or Athens!
  • And for our most dedicated readers, we also have the ability to fly you and a friend out to either city and get the chance to spend 4 days with us! (Scroll down to the bottom 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Dinner with a view of the Kremlin

  • The funds we raise will go directly to hiring a full-time staff of dedicated writers, maintaining the technological infrastructure of the sites, and growing our reach through marketing.

We are a collection of journalists, writers, and media critics that seek to give our readers a different perspective on world affairs through well-researched analysis.

Alexander Mercouris, Editor-in-Chief

 

Alex Christoforou, President

 

Vladimir Rodzianko, Managing Director

 

Adam Garrie, Managing Editor at The Duran

 

Ricky Twisdale, Managing Editor at RussiaFeed

 

Anna Lutskova De Bacci, Social Media Manager

 

Peter Lavelle, Creative Director

 

The Impact

Hard work however can only take us so far.  However much better we are than our MSM rivals, however hard we work, the simple fact is that we are massively outgunned.

You can help to change that.  

 

  • Without sites like The Duran, where else would you go for your news and analysis?

 

 

  • We have shown our readers over the last year and a half that we have what it takes to be a respected part of the journalism community - amassing over 1.5 million views every month.

 

 

  • If you approve of what we have been doing over the last 18 months - consider supporting us here so we can continue to deliver you the best in journalism and help us grow even more!

 

Take a look in the right column at all the different combinations of merchandise you will get when you support us - and as another way of saying 'thank you', we have included FREE SHIPPING!

Thank you!

story:
Summary

During HCPT's Easter pilgrimages to Lourdes for disabled and disadvantaged children, many special events take place. One such event is the publication of Father Perry Gildea's daily reflection known as the "Grotto Jottings".

The daily reflection, written and published in Lourdes over the Easter week, has been ongoing for many years. In HCPT's Diamond Jubilee 60th anniversary year, the Pope's Jubilee of Mercy, HCPT would like to put together some of the most popular Grotto Jottings from previous years. We would use them to publish a beautiful book called Jubilee Jottings. 

As a reader, you would be able to reflect on the spirituality of Lourdes and share a part of the HCPT pilgrimage.  

HCPT is a charity and we do not think it would be fair to use the donations of our supporters on this project - we maintain they should always go directly to helping those who travel with us.

Therefore, if you would like a copy of Jubilee Jottings, please help us fund its printing and production .

About HCPT

HCPT is a charity offering pilgrimages to the shrine of Lourdes in France for disabled and disadvantaged people from around the UK and further afield.

Every Easter over 1,000 disabled and disadvantaged children enjoy a week in Lourdes, staying in hotels with their volunteer helpers.

Each Summer over 1,500 people, many of them disabled adults, enjoy a week at HCPT's Hosanna House in Bartrès near Lourdes. 

What We Need and What You Get

In order to produce a viable amount of the books we are hoping to raise a total fund  of £3,500.

The money will only be used for the printing and production of Jubilee Jottings, with any surplus copies being sold and the profits returning to HCPT's central fund to help pay for the pilgrimage of a vulnerable child or adult to Lourdes.

There are lots of perks to encourage you to help us fund this project, not to mention the good deed you would be doing!

The Digital Pack - £5 Donation

For a small donation of £5 you will receive the digital version of Jubilee Jottings.

Hard Back Version - £25 Donation   

At this level of giving you will receive the digital version as well as a hard back "coffee table" version of the Jubilee Jottings book.

Personal Acknowledgment - £50 Donation

At this level of giving you will receive both the Digital and Hard Back perks along side your name (or name/s of your choice) appearing in the acknowledgments of the book.

Signed Copy - £100 Donation  

At this giving level you would receive all the previous benefits; you would receive a digital copy, a hard back copy, the buyers name would be in the acknowledgments plus the author himself, Father Perry, will sign your hard back copy of Jubilee Jottings.

Personal Message - £250 Donation

At this level of giving you would be entitled to receive all four previous perks along with a handwritten note from the author Father Perry.

Launch Event Invite - £500 Donation

At the highest level of giving we would like to present you with the full experience! Along with receiving all previous five gifts, you will be invited to a launch event for the Jubilee Jottings book, which will be in the UK or Lourdes 2016/17.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to help through donations, you can still contribute with your time and effort, help us to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign to publish Fr Perry's Grotto Jottings. Why not spread the word via social media and good old word of mouth!

We would use them to publish a beautiful book called Jubilee Jottings. As a reader, you would be able to reflect on the spirituality of Lourdes and share a part of the HCPT pilgrimage.   HCPT is a charity and we do not think it would be fair to use the donations of our supporters on this project - we maintain they should always go directly to helping those who travel with us. Therefore, if you would like a copy of Jubilee Jottings, please help us fund its printing and production . About HCPTHCPT is a charity offering pilgrimages to the shrine of Lourdes in France for disabled and disadvantaged people from around the UK and further afield.Every Easter over 1,000 disabled and disadvantaged children enjoy a week in Lourdes, staying in hotels with their volunteer helpers.Each Summer over 1,500 people, many of them disabled adults, enjoy a week at HCPT's Hosanna House in Bartrès near Lourdes. What We Need and What You GetIn order to produce a viable amount of the books we are hoping to raise a total fund  of £3,500. The money will only be used for the printing and production of Jubilee Jottings, with any surplus copies being sold and the profits returning to HCPT's central fund to help pay for the pilgrimage of a vulnerable child or adult to Lourdes.There are lots of perks to encourage you to help us fund this project, not to mention the good deed you would be doing! The Digital Pack - £5 Donation For a small donation of £5 you will receive the digital version of Jubilee Jottings.Hard Back Version - £25 Donation   

At this level of giving you will receive the digital version as
well as a hard back "coffee table" version of the Jubilee Jottings
book.
Personal Acknowledgment - £50 Donation
At this level of giving you will receive both the Digital
and Hard Back perks along side your name (or name/s of your choice) appearing in the acknowledgments
of the book.
Signed Copy - £100 Donation   
At this giving level you would receive all the previous
benefits; you would receive a digital copy, a hard back copy, the buyers name
would be in the acknowledgments plus the author himself, Father Perry, will sign
your hard back copy of Jubilee Jottings.
Personal Message - £250 Donation
At this level of giving you would be entitled to receive all
four previous perks along with a handwritten note from the author Father Perry.
Launch Event Invite - £500 Donation

At the highest level of giving we would like to
present you with the full experience! Along with receiving all
previous five gifts, you will be invited to a launch event for the Jubilee Jottings book, which will be in the UK or Lourdes 2016/17.

  
Other Ways You Can Help

 If you are unable to help through donations, you can still contribute with your time and effort, help us to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign to publish Fr Perry's Grotto Jottings. Why not spread the word via social media and good old word of mouth!

But as usual I'm not asking for something for nothing. My perks, as always, are bargains - and I'd sooner give out bargains to fans than schlep my arse out to entertain stag nights and hen dos anyway. Oh and there's some other cool shit here too essentially making me your bitch.Those of you that know me, know I've spent most of last year making free content. I've loved doing it and it's helped me keep in touch with you all. However, now my script has been accepted into the Montreal sitcom competition I'd like to ask fans of the show to help me get there and dig myself out of a little bit of a hole while I'm at it. I can't actually afford to fly myself out and put myself up, nor can I take the time off unless I cover my accom and other costs ahead of time for the Edinburgh fringe. So pledges go towards getting me there and self-producing at the Edinburgh fringe. We have 48 hours to get this done so hurry please!

story:
On April 13th I got the news I made it into The Odyssey Writing Workshop, held at St. Anselm College in Manchester New Hampshire. Many talented and skilled writers apply and only sixteen make the cut.

In one day I went from believing I hadn’t made it, to being over the moon, and fretting over the monetary logistics. 

What is Odyssey?

The Odyssey Writing Workshop is a six week, writing intense, workshop for writers of fantastic fiction encompassing fantasy, science fiction, horror, magical realism, and works that fall into the in-between. Find out more about the workshop here.

About Me

Hi! I'm Chloie Piveral.

I have a super power. I can arrange symbols together on a page, in small groups, and by doing so I place pictures and ideas in another person’s head. I may never even meet that person, but by doing so I can create a bond, and a shared emotional experience. I can cause them to replay experiences from their youth, or a lost loved one, or experience empathy or joy in a way never before experienced. And it is time to share my superpower with the world.

That's just another way to say, I write fiction. In addition to writing, I am a creative consultant and a costumer. I've had an opportunity to do a great many things so far in my life, but the one passion that always draws me back is writing fiction.

My Work

I've written for business magazines, run writing workshops, and consulted on books for other writers. Teaching and helping others is  great way to learn. I’ve been writing and helping others with projects since 2000.

About five years ago I decided to concentrate on my own work.  I have some really lovely personal rejection letters. 

 I have been a NANOWRIMO winner four years in a row. That’s 50,000 words written in one month. Find out more here.

What do I write?

Science Fiction, Fantasy, and Horror stories, but the descriptor most often applied to my work is weird. Couldn't the world use more weird?

Last year I  had a flash fiction piece, 50 Miles to Gone published by 713 Flash from Kazka Press. I've reposted the story here for those interested in reading an example of my work. 

What do I want to write?

Better stories. It is that simple. I want to write better stories for the sake of all the editors who find them in their slush piles, for the sake of my readers, and for the sake of better art.

Attending The Odyssey Writing Workshop is a way to make that happen.

What I'll be doing at Odyssey

While at Odyssey I'll be creating new work, learning a more comprehensive set of writing tools, and study the elements of fiction more in depth.  All of this will be done in cooperation with fifteen other amazing fiction writers, and under the tutelage of fantastic writers and teachers.

The workshop is a six-week boot camp of writing.  The coursework is intense. The pace is fast. And the opportunities to improve my work are various and vast.  

I Need Your Help

Simply doing the work it took to prepare a submission for Odyssey helped me improve. After four years of trying, and seeing the level of the other writers applying, I didn't expect to get an acceptance. 

But as I've been saying, while I waited for the reality of it to sink in, "No takesy backsies!" I'm in and I'm going to make the most of this opportunity.

This leaves me scrambling to find a way to make my dream a reality. 

Cost Breakdown

I’m raising funds to cover tuition, books, housing, and travel.  We are jokingly calling this campaign the "Better Than Selling a Kidney Fundraiser," because no matter what I’m going. Even if I don’t reach the total goal, all funds raised will go toward the expenses listed above. Anything raised above the total will go toward food and incidentals.

Here is the breakdown:

$2095 Tuition plus books

$830 Housing

$550 Airfare

Total= $3475

About the Perks

First and foremost you will contribute to the making of a better writer. I thank you. Editors who read my work thank you. And the overworked, underpaid, slush pile readers thank you.

Over the years I have consumed many books on writing. After years of working with other writers, and their given stumbling blocks, I developed a quick reference guide  to help. Every time I pick up one of these books, and reread it, I learn a little more about craft and style.  I would love to share this list with my benefactors.

I was as fascinated with the prompts, when I first started writing, as the process of creating itself.  It 's amazing how a surprise prompt can start the creative flow. Let me send you one, and see where it takes your creative endeavor.

Have you ever wanted to have your own personal writer? Have a piece of fiction created just for you? Maybe you have one of those names that's never on a keychain? Pffft. Who needs a keychain when you can have your own work of flash fiction? Let me write a little work of delight just for you.

                      

Need your yard mowed? It is that time of year. Why not get the job done and mess with your neighbors at the same time?  Who hasn't wanted to see the look on their neighbors faces when they pull into their drive and see Edward Scissorhands mowing the yard next door? Note: Columbia, Missouri residents only.

How about a story critique? I've spent many years critiquing the work of other writers. And one of the books I helped edit has been on the New York Times Best Seller List and translated into four other languages.

Or maybe you just want a peek into this process and to know a little more about what this experience was like for me-- with your help I can do that.

Examples of the Charming Perk give away:  

*Note--Charming perk give away will be chosen at random, but you may specify comic or charm as long as supplies last.


Hey if you’ve gotten this far and think this is great but don’t have a dollar to spare, you can still help with a repost/ share. Any help is appreciated!


THANK YOU!


Update 5/13/15

I’ve been so overjoyed by the support, that I’m paying it forward with random acts of kindness. So far I've fed expired parking meters, picked up trash and debris from a local trail, baked cookies for firefighters at a local Fire House, written kind e-mails to managers about their employees, and today given compliments to strangers. I plan at least one for each patron.

story:
Please support the editing and publishing of my first novel, Other Wise, a juicy adventure about a young woman healing from a psychological crisis without the use of medications, set in a squatted village in southern Spain.

Other Wise touches on some heavy topics, yet I promise it will be an exotic light read. I couldn't resist adding a splash of my greatest obsession, flamenco music! This artistic genre exemplifies the soul's initiation of transforming pain into growth!

Other Wise is not only about changing ones lifestyle to recover from a mental disorder; it is also about coming of age during a paradigm shift, overcoming addiction, and moving beyond black and white thinking.

This story of healing is relevant to everyone who believes life's challenges are gateways to becoming more truly ourselves. One by one we are reclaiming the conscience, the value of community, and the sacred in our own souls.

Please make a contribution to this uplifting vision of the future. Becoming "other wise" is not just for people struggling with stigmatized mental issues, but for everyone seeking to find themselves in others and others in themselves.

Please join me on this creative journey! All donations go directly towards my salary while editing the book.

Keep in touch and

THANK YOU!

Asra

story:
Why We Need Your Help

The established parties receive millions of euros of state funding each year, which creates a huge disadvantage to those who want to create change. Between leaflets, posters and support for volunteers, effective campaigns cost tens of thousands of euros to run. If we are to give a credible challenge, I need your support. I would appreciate you donating whatever you can.

What Makes Niall Different

  • "I have always been driven by having a positive impact on people’s lives and improving society around me and when politics is done right there’s no better place to have a big impact”
  • “Recently I had the honour of running the Yes Equality campaign in Galway, there were hundreds of people who got involved and when the results came in we were so proud of what we had achieved for equality in Ireland and I hope that there are many more days ahead of us like that”
  • “I've worked all over the world in public health, building infrastructure and designing technology and whenever you have talented, people smart decision-making and great leadership, anything is possible”
  • “Ireland has everything it needs and if we can get the right people into politics we can build a great society of which we can all be proud”
  •   “I want to see a Galway and an Ireland with a thriving economy so that my son will never need to leave to live his life where we have high quality public education, health and childcare services and where we have strong communities where everyone belongs”
  • “By building a movement based around social democracy, we can build one of the greatest societies in the world right here at home”

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Any real change in Irish politics and society is impossible without people like you who are willing to get involved. We’ll be out canvassing from the 7th of September; If you would like to join our team, in whatever capacity you can, please let us know at:
    http://www.niallotuathail.ie/jointheteam/
  • You can also call or text us on 083-4825385 or drop into the campaign office at 2 William Street West (between Claddagh Cabs and The Blue Note)
  • If you would like to receive our newsletter you can email us on niall@niallotuathail.ie
  • You can also help by liking us on Facebookwww.facebook.com/niallgalwaymayo , https://www.facebook.com/pages/Social-Democrats-Galway/1481700278794008 ,  by boosting our social media posts on @niallotuathail, @SocDemsGalway and using #SocDem
