story:
Books to Inspire Your Child to Read & Write

We live in a world that celebrates violence and taking things by force. The news is full of stories of tragedy and human suffering, and it’s not just our grown up world either. The world our children experience is sadly not so different. As a parent myself, I am horrified when my child watches cartoons that portray characters winning by brute force, or using aggression and martial arts skills.

My books provide children with role models who achieve great things using their intellect, their guile and by working collaboratively with others.

My main characters are three young children with a shared passion for reading mystery books. Roly, Nine and Charlie work from a hi-tech basement clubhouse. Using a variety of cool gadgets, they work together to use their detective skills, intelligence and keen powers of deduction to solve mysteries and crimes in their small town of Anchor Bay.

What these three young detectives have in common are the shared qualities I believe are important for youngsters today: 

Integrity

Loyalty

Intelligence

A Great Sense of Humour


Read the first chapter of Zodiac and the Missing Diamond



Interview with the Author

What was your inspiration for the Countdown Mysteries?

When I was a child I had a best friend called Rob. We lived on the edge of Sherwood Forest and had some great adventures together. He was like the brother I never had. I want to write about children who have true friends and share amazing adventures just like Rob and me. I want my characters to feel the same way about each other as we did all those years ago. 

What makes the Countdown Mysteries series unique?

Characters! I want the characters in my books to be smart and thinking detectives. I loved watching Agatha Christie mysteries on television. Her detectives used their brains to solve crimes. I want to give my readers characters like that. That’s why my three main characters solve mysteries using their intelligence and teamwork. I can’t remember another series of alphabetical mysteries that works its way backwards through the alphabet. Mine do, and the characters also solve their mysteries against a countdown clock that ticks down towards zero. 

Who are these books for?

My books are for anyone who loves a good mystery. Some of the language I use is simple so my books and their stories are accessible to children between the ages of 7 and 10. I also love to add a few twists and surprises to add interest and intrigue. It’s great to throw in more challenging vocabulary to stretch my readers and to teach them new words. Even now as an adult I always still love learning new words and then trying to use them that day somehow. 

Who are your favourite authors?

I love John Grisham books. I’ve read nearly everything he’s written. I love the way his characters use their intelligence and wits to achieve what they are doing. I also adore the books by Will Randall and Polly Evans. Both authors write about their travel adventures and use humour effectively. I know a lot of people think Enid Blyton books are old fashioned now but I used to love those too. Her characters had so much fun and they always worked well as a team – just like my characters!

What do you plan to do with the funds you raise?

It’s been great planning and writing the first books of the Countdown Mysteries series. To continue to develop the series and to write more and more books in the series I need the funds I raise from this crowd funding campaign. I want to send my books to print and have a stock that children can access from my author website. I’m also going to visit schools across Asia later this school year so having a stock of books to take with me would be absolutely fantastic.


Why Your Support Is Important

  • As a teacher and a parent I know how crucial it is for children to have books that engage and excite them, books that inspire them to read. 
  • It’s a well-known fact in education that children who read more, write better. Children learn by example, so by providing them with sources of good writing, you boost the development of their writing skills. Buy a book and help develop the next generation of creative writers.

  • In today’s technological world, is there anything better than seeing your child engrossed in a good book?
  • I have always enjoyed sharing my stories with the children in classes I have taught, and fortunately I’ve also been able to model good writing for those children. Being able to publish my stories allows me to go one step further. It allows me to reach a much wider audience, and that is just fantastic!  
  • I’ve had a long-held dream of becoming a published children’s author and a passion for sharing stories with children. Your support will help my dream come true.


What You Get

In exchange and as a THANK YOU for being a part of our initiative, we have some really creative special perks for you. Check out the rewards listed in the right column.

We also have additional exclusive benefits for all our initial supporters from this crowdfunding campaign. All supporters purchasing a book will:

  • Form an exclusive online community, receiving previews of future titles before they are released.
  • Have the opportunity to pre-order the next title and limited edition versions before I take them to market.


Testimonials, Partners & Supporters

As a young, ambitious new author, I’ve received some incredibly gratifying feedback from children and their parents, who really value the contribution I am trying to make:

  • A brilliant book, which my daughter loved a lot. The book is like a modern day Secret 7. All the characters were very likeable and I would say that this book is perfect for both boys and girls. I am a teacher myself and I thought that the choice of vocabulary and description throughout was fantastic and gave us lots to talk about. – Andrew Foster

  • Suitable for emergent fluent readers both girls and boys, this is the first in an exciting new series of detective mystery books. I know the author and he is a talented writer, with an excellent understanding of children, having worked in schools. I will certainly be introducing his book to my current class of 8 year olds. Looking forward to the rest of the series. -  Elizabeth Wood

  • The second great book in this series - bodes well for the rest of them. Another story for young readers who like mysteries. Great plot line, not too difficult to follow, but twists enough to keep you brain puzzling over whodunnit! – Amazon reader.



My Dream

My goal is to have a stock of each book here in Thailand, allowing children across Asia to buy them through my author website, or during my visits to schools during the next school year. 
I hope you remember the great books you read as a child, those that inspired you, and that you will help me ignite the same kind of passion for reading in children here today.
If you would like to help children in Asia have access to quality books the same way that children in Europe, the US, and Oceania do, please contact me at jonathancamm@countdownmysteries.co.uk
story_txt:
Books to Inspire Your Child to Read & Write We live in a world that celebrates violence and taking things by force. The news is full of stories of tragedy and human suffering, and it’s not just our grown up world either. The world our children experience is sadly not so different. As a parent myself, I am horrified when my child watches cartoons that portray characters winning by brute force, or using aggression and martial arts skills.

My books provide children with role models who achieve great things using their intellect, their guile and by working collaboratively with others.
 My main characters are three young children with a shared passion for reading mystery books. Roly, Nine and Charlie work from a hi-tech basement clubhouse. Using a variety of cool gadgets, they work together to use their detective skills, intelligence and keen powers of deduction to solve mysteries and crimes in their small town of Anchor Bay.   

What these three young detectives have in common are the shared qualities I believe are important for youngsters today: 


Integrity
Loyalty
Intelligence
A Great Sense of Humour

Read the 
first chapter of Zodiac and the Missing Diamond


Interview with the Author


What was your inspiration for the Countdown Mysteries?
When I was a child I had a best friend called Rob. We lived on the edge of Sherwood Forest and had some great adventures together. He was like the brother I never had. I want to write about children who have true friends and share amazing adventures just like Rob and me. I want my characters to feel the same way about each other as we did all those years ago. 
What makes the Countdown Mysteries series unique?
Characters! I want the characters in my books to be smart and thinking detectives. I loved watching Agatha Christie mysteries on television. Her detectives used their brains to solve crimes. I want to give my readers characters like that. That’s why my three main characters solve mysteries using their intelligence and teamwork. I can’t remember another series of alphabetical mysteries that works its way backwards through the alphabet. Mine do, and the characters also solve their mysteries against a countdown clock that ticks down towards zero. 
Who are these books for?
My books are for anyone who loves a good mystery. Some of the language I use is simple so my books and their stories are accessible to children between the ages of 7 and 10. I also love to add a few twists and surprises to add interest and intrigue. It’s great to throw in more challenging vocabulary to stretch my readers and to teach them new words. Even now as an adult I always still love learning new words and then trying to use them that day somehow. 
Who are your favourite authors?
I love John Grisham books. I’ve read nearly everything he’s written. I love the way his characters use their intelligence and wits to achieve what they are doing. I also adore the books by Will Randall and Polly Evans. Both authors write about their travel adventures and use humour effectively. I know a lot of people think Enid Blyton books are old fashioned now but I used to love those too. Her characters had so much fun and they always worked well as a team – just like my characters!
What do you plan to do with the funds you raise?
It’s been great planning and writing the first books of the Countdown Mysteries series. To continue to develop the series and to write more and more books in the series I need the funds I raise from this crowd funding campaign. I want to send my books to print and have a stock that children can access from my author website. I’m also going to visit schools across Asia later this school year so having a stock of books to take with me would be absolutely fantastic.



Why Your Support Is Important




As a teacher and a parent I know how crucial it is for children to have books that engage and excite them, books that inspire them to read. 

It’s a well-known fact in education that children who read more, write better. Children learn by example, so by providing them with sources of good writing, you boost the development of their writing skills. Buy a book and help develop the next generation of creative writers.








In today’s technological world, is there anything better than seeing your child engrossed in a good book?


I have always enjoyed sharing my stories with the children in classes I have taught, and fortunately I’ve also been able to model good writing for those children. Being able to publish my stories allows me to go one step further. It allows me to reach a much wider audience, and that is just fantastic!  


I’ve had a long-held dream of becoming a published children’s author and a passion for sharing stories with children. Your support will help my dream come true.



What You Get

In exchange and as a THANK YOU for being a part of our initiative, we have some really creative special perks for you. Check out the rewards listed in the right column.
We also have additional exclusive benefits for all our initial supporters from this crowdfunding campaign. All supporters purchasing a book will:



Form an exclusive online community, receiving previews of future titles before they are released.
Have the opportunity to pre-order the next title and limited edition versions before I take them to market.






Testimonials, Partners & Supporters
As a young, ambitious new author, I’ve received some incredibly gratifying feedback from children and their parents, who really value the contribution I am trying to make:


A brilliant book, which my daughter loved a lot. The book is like a modern day Secret 7. All the characters were very likeable and I would say that this book is perfect for both boys and girls. I am a teacher myself and I thought that the choice of vocabulary and description throughout was fantastic and gave us lots to talk about. – Andrew Foster

Suitable for emergent fluent readers both girls and boys, this is the first in an exciting new series of detective mystery books. I know the author and he is a talented writer, with an excellent understanding of children, having worked in schools. I will certainly be introducing his book to my current class of 8 year olds. Looking forward to the rest of the series. -  Elizabeth Wood

The second great book in this series - bodes well for the rest of them. Another story for young readers who like mysteries. Great plot line, not too difficult to follow, but twists enough to keep you brain puzzling over whodunnit! – Amazon reader.









My DreamMy goal is to have a stock of each book here in Thailand, allowing children across Asia to buy them through my author website, or during my visits to schools during the next school year. 

I hope you remember the great books you read as a child, those that inspired you, and that you will help me ignite the same kind of passion for reading in children here today.

If you would like to help children in Asia have access to quality books the same way that children in Europe, the US, and Oceania do, please contact me at jonathancamm@countdownmysteries.co.uk

story:
CLIMATE CHANGE 4 the SOUL...


WHAT IF IT JUST STARTED RAINING? 

  • It's THE most important question no one is asking...
  • AND one the whole world should be asking...
  • A children's book...with a message for adults...
  • It's more than just a book...it's a campaign...a global cause...

Bottom line up front: 

1) Raising enough $ to order and purchase the first run of 5,000 copies will enable me to put books immediately into the hands of a growing number of people who seek a copy for themselves, their children, friends and family.  

2) Additionally I will be able to visit schools & organizations requesting books in order to speak as well as distribute books.

3) Every contribution builds a foundation towards putting books into the hands of school children in a growing number of countries across the planet!

Printing this initial run of 5,000 copies builds a bridge while the following (and more) exciting projects continue to develop:

World Bank Group:  Ministries of Education across the world (71 countries) use the World Bank Group to build educational programs that form the foundation for their future.  I have given my presentation to the World Bank Group in Washington, D.C. and have developing educational projects in several African nations.  

Zambia: Zambian Film Director Jessie Chisi (her film "Between Rings" will premier in the UK October 31, 2015) will begin filming a series of short films based on "What if it Just Started Raining?"  and MOJO New Media (Lusaka) is in the process of writing and directing a collaborative "Rain" song based on the book and patterned after "We are the World for Africa."

Washington, D.C.: Having just recently briefed Mayor Muriel Bowser, "What if it Just Started Raining?" is in line to become one of a series of books mailed to children throughout the District of Columbia.

Belarus & Russia: In December 2015, "What if it Just Started Raining?" will be translated into Russian as part of a University student contest and subsequently distributed throughout Belarus and Russia.  

Team Kambimbi: Coren will soon begin marketing the Kambimbi brand seeking team members across the globe to become peace builders, human unifiers and conflict prevention agents in their community.  The legend of the Kambimbi (African Rain Bird) is coming soon.

Translations in progress into the following languages: Russian, Italian & French.

"What if it Just Started Raining?" teaches

  • That despite our many differences as people, there is only one human race
  • That the many differences we use as labels (skin color, religion, language, social status, gender etc...) are only excuses some use to do awful and unthinkable things to others they wish to think lesser than ourselves
  • That life would be infinitely better if we were just "more good" to each other

PROJECT TIMELINE:  It will take approximately 10 weeks to receive the first 5,000 copies and have them available for direct sales and mail distribution.

story:
Empowering Young Cancer Patients With Writing

Inspired by the young patients of a pioneering, Boston-based pediatric oncologist, Dr. Giannoula Lakka Klement, Engagement With Life will publish a book by 13-year-old Ava D'Ambrosio and plan an integrative program to teach writing for self-expression and growth to children with cancer.

When Ava first came to see Dr. Klement several years ago, she was suffering with a pre-cancerous, overgrown spleen and brittle bones from previous prednisone treatment. Now, her condition under control with continuing therapy, Ava has her radiant life back. An outstanding student and talented writer, she participates in theater, plays the piano, and hopes someday to become a hematologist.

"I want other kids to know it's important not to give up," Ava says. With the publication of her book about her illness, and with the planned inclusion of contributions from her family, Dr. Klement, and program director Carl Vigeland, readers everywhere will be able to share in this life affirming story.

A keystone of Dr. Klement’s practice is for her patients to remain connected to the people and places around them. After the shock of a diagnosis, and with all the challenges of getting better compounded in these cases by the factor of age, a young person with cancer can feel especially lonely, dealing not only with an insidious disease but an experience that can seem unfathomable. In addition to Ava's book Engagement With Life will develop detailed plans and educational materials, including photography, to launch a multifaceted program for other children of varying ages and cancers who are grappling with that experience.

Launching a Beta Program and Pilot Project

Though writing programs for prison inmates and other programs integrated with music and art for patients have been very successful, Engagement With Life and its emphasis on the therapeutic impact of writing represent something new and innovative for young cancer patients.

For some children with cancer, confined to a hospital bed or at home, the program will create in-person tutorials with a distance or online learning component. For others, able to be out and about, planning will be made for field trips to sporting and musical events or just a walk on the beach or by a beautiful river, providing a takeoff for writing as young essayists and journalists. The program's team is currently exploring strategic relationships with several Boston-based and national sports and arts organizations. Among these are the Boston Symphony Orchestra, which has already offered to provide concert tickets.

A Committed Team and Passionate Vision

Program founder and director Carl Vigeland, a long-time writer and educator, met Dr. Klement two years ago near the beginning of his work on a forthcoming book. With an honors degree from Harvard, where he did volunteer tutorial work at Roxbury elementary schools, and a masters degree in education from the University of Massachusetts at Amherst, he has taught at every level, from E.S.L. children as young as kindergarten age to post-graduates in the award-winning UMass Certificate in Online Journalism, which he helped develop.

A core team of other team members— an acclaimed book publisher, an outstanding graphic arts designer, a veteran social media expert, and an advanced student with many community connections—will assist Engagement With Life's inception and evolution. Our focus, of course, is on the children the program will benefit, and our ambition is give the beta program a shape and depth that will enable us to seek an eventual partnership with a medical institution. As the program grows, we will enlist the advice of a lawyer with experience in non-profits and get help from an expert in distance learning software. We will also explore a process to select and train volunteers.

Your Donation Will Make it Happen  

Teaching time will be on a pro bono basis. To plan and organize Engagement With Life and insure the success of both its pilot project and program formation--with a completion date for both of six months after our launch--we need funds software, legal advice for incorporation as a non-profit, overhead and administration, travel (including insurance), design and book publication.

If we fall short of our initial goal, the program will still go forward with publication of its book in an e-format. Funds in excess of our goal will accelerate the initiation of related programs with several sports and arts organizations, including a golf experience that children who are able to participate will then also write about and a similar activity using jazz. Additionally, as the program grows, we will reach out to other localities to explore implementation on a wider basis.

A Unique Program Will Have a Growing Impact

From its very beginning, with the writing and publication of its pilot project, Engagement With Life will have an immediate impact both on the life of its young author and its many readers, young and old. Throughout the process, donors to the program will receive regular progress reports, and we will in the meantime consult with Dr. Klement on each step the program takes. By the time we reach the final, partnering phase of the program, we will seek media coverage to spread the word.

As an expression of gratitude and acknowledgment of donor generosity, a number of perks commemorate the support the program seeks; if you wish to receive a perk, remember to check the box within the donation portal. And please note that the e-book download that is offered with each perk will be available upon completion of the beta program and pilot project.

Copyright 2016

story:
My name is Misako Yamazaki and I've had a passion for writing since I was six years old. I'd like to share with you a collection of 27 of my favorite poems that I've written over the past couple of years. If you help contribute to my campaign, you'd be helping me achieve a dream I've had for over a decade.


What the money goes towards:
  • Printing
  • Design
  • Formatting
  • ISBN
  • Print on Demand (POD) & Shipping
  • Advertisement

The first 50 people who donate $25 or more will receive one free signed poster and one free signed copy of my book. Also, all donors will get their name printed in the acknowledgments of my book.
If I do not reach my goal, I will subtract what I do raise from the total amount of money needed and pay it myself.

I've always wanted to hold my own book in my hands. The feeling of seeing a book you wrote and holding it in your hands, turning the pages...I've yet to experience any of that,
I've entered poetry contests and gotten some of my poems (which will not be included in this project) published before in anthologies. I was published in CONVERGENCE: Best Arizona Teen Writing of 2015 just last year.
I really hope you understand, dear donor, just how much this means to me.

I know that money can be tight, but I'm creating this campaign in the hopes that someone, out of the goodness of their hearts, will help me achieve one of my dreams. Every dollar donated helps.

If you are unable to donate, please get the word out to others who might have a dollar or two to spare! Use your twitter, facebook, tumblr - any and all social media to get the word out about my campaign. Tell your friends, your family, co-workers, neighbors - help me self-publish my first book!

- Misako

story:
STORY LAND: A QUIET, beautiful space to write in, with free WIFI, coffee and tea, a kitchen area,  sound proof phone booth,  reading area,  reference library, and a printer for hard copies… all for the price of a cup of coffee a day at a noisy café.

STORY LAND is an affordable, comfortable, quiet space where writers can focus their attention on fiction instead of friction.  Free WI-FI, coffee, tea, a kitchen area, a "phone booth," and printing are included in our monthly membership plans, as well as 24-hour access. STORY LAND has a two-tiered membership system: prime membership (9am-5pm) and regular membership, with discounts for students.  The space is a QUIET ZONE and is open 24/7, 365 days of the year. Amenities include various desks and work spaces for diverse needs, a conference room, and Friday afternoon “Happy Hours: 5-7pm free trial period."

For the duration of this campaign, you can get a half-priced trial membership for your IndieGoGo contribution.  You can also contribute because you want to support the arts and specifically creative writing in Tucson, by funding a space that allows writers to create in peace and quiet. The purchase of an advanced membership will ensure your spot in our architecturally beautiful writing space.  The only requirement for membership is seriousness of intent. 

The goal is to raise a minimum of $35,000 to buy chairs, pay rent, utilities, liability insurance, and all of the day to day operational costs until our membership base pays for the space on its own. If the goal is not met, what funds are raised will go to rent, utilities, the purchase of chairs, a coffee maker, tea pot, and a security system.

Early marketing and branding for this venture is already in place, incorporating the tagline “The write place.” The web site (www.storylandtucson.com) is currently live and serves as the primary tool to market the space, as well as a vehicle for interested writers to apply for membership. Additional marketing and promotion is ready to launch through local print publications such as Zocalo magazine and underwriting promotion with KXCI community radio. Both of these vehicles speak directly to the creative community as a whole. Heavy word of mouth promotion is also being implemented through fellow writing contacts, various writing organizations, bookstores and coffee shops around the Tucson area. The response has already been overwhelming.

Statistics indicate that nearly every family household contains at least one aspiring writer. Consequently, risk for this type of business model is low, considering Tucson’s vast population of writers and the constant and apparent need they verbalize for a quiet space, away from the distractions of life and noisy café’s, to write in. I feel confident about the support for such a place from what my fellow writers have already expressed. Marketing and promotion will continue on an ongoing basis, including social media marketing, to ensure that reservations are kept to capacity.

Every serious writer needs a serious place to work without distractions in the company of like-minded people. No excuses, no distractions, just words on the page, every day, for however long you want to write.  Those of you who are not writers, but love reading and support writing can help spread the word or share the link to this campaign, using the IndieGoGo share tools. Be sure to tell every writer you know!

STORY LAND Founder Cecily Crebbs has been working on a biography of singer/songwriter Mark Sandman for over 12 years.  Over those years she has tried renting office space, cafes, libraries, and other out of the home strategies.  Office space is expensive, cafes noisy and distracting, and libraries are no longer quiet. She heard about the original Writers Room in New York City years ago from a friend.  Since 2007 she has been following the trend of writers rooms popping up all over the country and has personally visited two in Santa Monica, California.  Writers get more work done in shared, quiet writing rooms where they can focus on their writing in a supportive community. 

Cecily Crebbs has lived in Tucson for over 25 years.  She has studied with a diverse mixture of writers including Nick Flynn, Luis Alberto Urrea,  Kate Horsely, Abigail Thomas,  and Anthony Swofford. She has attended Tin House Summer WritersWorkshop a number of times. She is a substitute DJ on the Music Mix on KXCI and has served on KXCI's Board of Directors as well as ZUZI! Dance Company's Board of Directors.

community as a whole. Heavy word of mouth promotion is also being implemented through
fellow writing contacts, various writing organizations, bookstores and coffee
shops around the Tucson area. The response has already been overwhelming.
Statistics indicate that nearly every
family household contains at least one aspiring writer. Consequently, risk for
this type of business model is low, considering Tucson’s vast population of
writers and the constant and apparent need they verbalize for a quiet space,
away from the distractions of life and noisy café’s, to write in. I feel
confident about the support for such a place from what my fellow writers have
already expressed. Marketing and promotion will continue on an ongoing basis,
including social media marketing, to ensure that reservations are kept to
capacity.
Every serious writer needs a serious
place to work without distractions in the company of like-minded people. No
excuses, no distractions, just words on the page, every day, for however long
you want to write.  Those of you who are not writers, but love reading and
support writing can help spread the word or share the link to this campaign,
using the IndieGoGo share tools. Be sure to tell every writer you know!
STORY LAND Founder Cecily Crebbs has been working on a
biography of singer/songwriter Mark Sandman for over 12 years.  Over those
years she has tried renting office space, cafes, libraries, and other out of
the home strategies.  Office space is expensive, cafes noisy and
distracting, and libraries are no longer quiet. She heard about the original
Writers Room in New York City years ago from a friend.  Since 2007 she has
been following the trend of writers rooms popping up all over the country and
has personally visited two in Santa Monica, California.  Writers get more
work done in shared, quiet writing rooms where they can focus on their writing
in a supportive community.  
Cecily Crebbs has lived in Tucson for over 25 years. 
She has studied with a diverse mixture of writers including Nick Flynn, Luis
Alberto Urrea,  Kate Horsely, Abigail
Thomas,  and Anthony Swofford. She has
attended Tin House Summer WritersWorkshop a number of times. She is a
substitute DJ on the Music Mix on KXCI and has served on KXCI's Board of
Directors as well as ZUZI! Dance Company's Board of Directors.

story:
Das Longboard…

ist in den letzten 4 Jahren konstant zu den Spitzenreitern der Trend- & Fun-Sportarten aufgeschlossen. 2013 berichteten längst Massenmedien wie die RTL-Kanäle  über den Massentrend. Doch während Neuentwicklungen schnell über Fachmagazine Verbreitung finden, gibt es noch immer keine belastbare Geschichte des Sportphänomens.



Wo kommt das Longboard eigentlich her?


Das Autoren-Team ist eng mit der internationalen Board-Szene verbunden und hat sich gemeinsam den umfangreichen Recherchen gestellt um diese Frage umfassend zu beantworten. Dabei begleiten sie den Brettsport von den Anfängen in Polynesien vor 4000 Jahren, über erste Longboards auf Rädern 1930 und den darauffolgenden Boom in den 60ern des letzten Jahrhunderts – bis hin zum aktuellen Höhepunkt des Sports.

The Lost History Of Longboarding

Jede Sportart hat seine Geschichte, bei vielen Sportarten lässt sich diese chronologisch und fachlich einordnen. Ob nun Formel 1 oder auch Fußball, es gibt immer Quellen, die darlegen, wann und wie diese Sportarten das erste Mal durchgeführt wurden. 

Beim Longboarden ist das ein wenig anders. Es gibt sehr viele veröffentlichte Theorien, die allerdings stark voneinander abweichen. Die meisten sind äußerst spekulativ und nicht belegbar. Dies liegt daran, dass Longboarding als Sportart in den 50er und 60er Jahren kaum dokumentiert wurde. Viele Zeitzeugen, die in der Förderung oder Entwicklung tätig waren, sind 50 bis 60 Jahre nach dem ersten großen Boom schon nicht mehr unter uns.

Wir haben inzwischen drei Jahre recherchiert, mit den Nachkommen der Pioniere gesprochen, Bilder gesammelt und die Geschichte dazu aufgeschrieben. Es ist die Geschichte der faszinierenden Welt der Brettsportarten, in der das Longboarden eine absolute Ausnahmeerscheinung ist. Viele bekannte Stimmen der Szene haben uns dazu ihr Wissen zur Verfügung gestellt und wir freuen uns, einige Fakten erstmals der Öffentlichkeit zugänglich machen zu können.


Das Buch

wird eine gut recherchierte, liebevoll gestaltete & aufwendig produzierte Chronik. Kurzum: ein amtliches Werk, das unseren Sport angemessen präsentiert und die Lücken der bisherigen Geschichtsschreibung schliesst. Im Vintage Style, mit vielen Bildern und Illustrationen versehen und einer typographischen Qualität, die einer "Lieblings-Sport-Chronik" gerecht wird.

  • Einband: Hardcover mit Schutzfolie - 4c
  • Druck: 308 Seiten - s/w
  • Verlag: Ministry of Stoke
  • Sprache: Deutsch, English
  • Größe: 302 x 215mm
  • Gewicht: 1,2 kg
  • ISBN-10: folgt
  • ISBN-13: folgt


Unterstützt dieses Projekt

Wir haben so viel Zeit & Herzblut in dieses Buch investiert und hoffen nun auf die Unterstützung aus der Community. Drucken wir 100 Exemplare oder können wir für euch mit 1000 Exemplaren in den Offsetdruck gehen? Es liegt an euch - wir haben für dieses notwendige Projekt bereits alles gegeben.

Risiken & Herausforderungen

Das Buch wird in jedem Fall erscheinen, doch die Druckqualität nimmt erst ab höherer Auflage auch zu. Solltet ihr über die Pearks eines der nummerierten 100 Bücher ordern, bekommt ihr diese von einem Autor des Teams auch handsigniert. Zögert ihr zu lange, könnten die signierten bereits vergriffen sein.


Andere Wege, wie man helfen kann

Teilt unsere Kamapgne!

story:
M E N S T R U A L   R E V O L U T I O N 

- t h e  b o o k -

it's time. period.


This book will change the world, ditch taboos and shift ideas. Sounds pretty awesome, right?!
On this page you find everything you need to know about the book, pre-ordering, how to support and of course: what YOU will get!

Iris has been inspired by the menstrual cycle since before she started bleeding. She is a Cycle Awareness Educator, anthropologist, doula who LOVES making the earth shake with positive change - especially through writing.

'Menstrual Revolution' is all about creating more awareness about the subject of period blood,  the menstrual cycle in general and how to make mindful choices concerning birth control and menstrual management. We have the brains, the knowledge and the bodies and yet we do not seem to be able to connect those. This book is a catalyst for body positivity, menstrual badassery and healthy options [for both our bodies and the planet]. Because I believe we deserve to treat ourselves to the luxury of knowing our gorgeous bodies and how to support them in the best, most healthy way possible.

This campaign is YOUR chance to add your cup of awesomeness to the party.

• What I Need & What You Get •

I can't do this alone. There is research to be done, writings to be completed, covers to be designed, interviews to be held, etc. Just to be very direct and clear: I need €20.000 to make this happen and I simply don't have the money. That's where YOU come in - a tribe of supporters who all believe in the necessity of this book and the change it will ignite.

All of the money will be used to do research, get access to articles + books + video material I need (for research), cover some travel costs I will have to make to do interviews with 'big folks' in the field, photography, illustrations, translations, cover design, printing, self-publishing in hardcopy and digital versions, and in two languages . Since I want to publish in Dutch and English at the same time, I am obliged to self-publish (unless you are that TWO awesome publishers wanting to back me up on this!).
If I do not reach the entire goal, the money will still go to everything stated above, yet the number of books printed will be smaller.

If you support this campaign, you are rewarded with thank-you-gifts. I will be giving a way the most epic products I received from gorgeous companies whose vision is similar to mine. My gratitude is endless and I can't wait to send these life-changing, body- and planet-friendly products to you!

Here's a sneak preview for all that's waiting for you:

And here's a little explanation of all the perks:

Moon Chart + Moon Meditation audio

--a guided Moon Meditation, with the voice of yours truly, to tap deeper into your bleeding time and really focus on what it means for your body, mind and spirit to be menstruating. The Moon Chart teaches you how to connect your own cycle to moon and her cycles.

Reusable Pads*
--EcoFemme (India) and ImseVimse (Sweden)
These pads are your toxic-free reusable option: use them, wash them, use them again (they last for years!). Both of these brands are super soft, nice to your lady parts, easy to use and very absorbing (I never leaked with these!).

Menstrual Cups*
--RubyCup (Germany), Lunette (Finland) and OrganiCup (Denmark)
All of the cups I am giving you are made of medical grade silicon, can be worn up to 12 hours, are easy to clean and gentle to wear. Each cup comes with a little bag to store it in.

Oh ps: keep your cup away from pets! -- I had a cat eat mine......Whoops!

Menstrual Manifesto Tote Bags
Aren't they super awesome?! The manifesto was written initially for Menstrual Hygiene Day 2015, and after that, Iris performed it at a Menstrual Poetry Slam at the conference organized by the Society for Menstrual Cycle Research in Boston -- many people liked it and the idea to trademark it was born. This bag is exclusively made for this campaign and is the only way to get it for FREE.

Fertility Computers*
A fertility computer helps you to chart your cycle and keep track of your fertility. You do this by taking your basal body temperature every morning. These products have a Pearl index of 0.7 which means they are 99.3% safe.
I have the honor to give away TWO fertility computers to people who sponsor this campaign:
--LadyComp is a handy-to-use fertility computer I have used for over 4 years now.
You can find all the info you need right here [English] and here [Dutch].

--Daysy is the little sister of LadyComp and designed by the daughter of the man (!!) who came up with the idea of creating a the LadyComp. You can connect Daysy to your phone.
Want to learn more about Daysy? Click here.

Mindful Menstrual Management Workshop
If you want to learn easy systems to make mindful menstrual shifts in your life (and have 24 other friends join!), this is your chance! Iris (+a suitcase full of books, pins, bags and awesome information) will visit you

This includes all the information of the workshop, a Menstrual Revolution lecture, a Mindful Menstrual Management booklet, Menstrual Revolution - the book, Menstrual Manifesto tote bags, stickers, pins, and a personalized book signing with Iris. All of this takes 5 hours in total. All costs except travel costs (which will be on you) are included. It is required to provide me with food and a place to sleep if you live far away.

The Book [of course!]
Duh. Yes you will receive a copy of the book! The choice is yours: hardcopy or digital, Dutch or English.

ps:  I can see some you think "But I don't menstruate".. Well..giving your lady a menstrual cup/reusable pad/moonchart is probably the coolest badass present you can ever give. Respecting the cycle means a lot for menstruators! So go ahead, you can sponsor the campaign. And yes, the book is for all PEOPLE. Everyone can read it. And everyone can walk around with Menstrual Manifesto Tote Bags. So nope, no excuses!

*I use all the brands -- RubyCup, Lunette, OrganiCup, EcoFemme, ImseVimse and LadyComp (except for Daysy, similar to LadyComp) myself. I only want to give you the products that I know and use myself, just to make sure I give you the best options I have found.

• The Impact •

Let it be very clear that this is not about me writing a book for ME. This book is my contribution to ALL of humankind. Because think about it: without women having healthy menstrual cycles, you wouldn't be sitting here reading this. It's quite a biggie, really. This is about YOU, for YOU, for the WORLD, for our PLANET. 

In an era of body-shaming, cycle suppressing, medicalizing menstruation (and pregnancy + birth!) it is time for a positive, open, encouraging sound. This book is the sound the world needs. Now. There is no time to lose - our daughters and sons grow up believing they should be ashamed for their bodies and how it works. Is this the world we want to raise our children in? No. The change is so easy, and we can do it together! Are. You. In?!

• Risks & Challenges •

I've done all I could to make the perks simple, clear and safe. Worldwide shipping costs might vary but I have kept them as low as possible.
There is a slight chance you might be confronted with some small import duties - only for some cases. As said, the chances are small (because all the gifts are free from import duties in most countries) but I do want to be transparant with you and give you the scenarios in case they do appear.

I have made a list of countries/regions I considered most likely to ship to:

EUROPEAN UNION/ UK: 
nope, no import duties.

UNITED STATES & CANADA: 
no import duties, with the exception of the ones including a tote bag and fertility computer. you might have to pay around one euro import duties on the tote bag and a little bit more on a fertility computer.

AUSTRALIA:
nope, no import duties. 

CHINA:
no import duties, with the exception of the ones including a tote bag and fertility computer. you might have to pay around three euros import duties on the tote bag and a little bit more on a fertility computer.

If you live in a country other than the ones listed above, and you want to be sure you don't pay (much) import taxes, just pop me an email via info@cycleseeds.com please and I will let you know ASAP.

PAYPAL PAYMENTS
If you want to learn more about how to pay with PayPal, click here. It's easypeasy!

• Other Ways You Can Help •

I understand contributing in money is not possible for everyone. That's okay. You can also make some menstrual noise in real-life (on the streets! in your class! at your job!) or on other social media platforms.

Sharing is caring >> hit the share buttons below to help 

or e-mail/text/tell your friends/family/colleagues/boss/neighbors/sisters/brothers/EVERYONE you know about this campaign.


♥ t h a n k   y o u ♥
♥ t h a n k   y o u ♥
♥ t h a n k   y o u ♥


Psst! Did you know the song you hear is about the sacredness of menstruation!?Wanna hear the full song by the awesome Shylah Ray Sunshine? Check it out here!

story:
Short Summary

We are authors:  Narate Keys (The Changes...Immigration Footprints of Our Journey) and Peuo Tuy (Khmer Girl)  appreciate your support and donation to help us promote the multi-state “Art of Healing Book Tour 2016,” running April through September.

We believe young Cambodians and other oppressed people should voice their identities and experiences as children of immigrant parents affected by war and genocide. Other artists and communities are invited to help explore these questions: How do we process intergenerational trauma? How do we negotiate our identities in this ever-changing world? How have we overcome adversity? We hope to make a positive impact in the communities we visit by promoting storytelling and conducting writing and self-empowerment workshops.

The itinerary for the tour, featuring free spoken word poetry performances, writing and self-empowerment workshops, yoga (Minnesota location), conversations with Q&A periods, and open mics, look like this:

  • Minneapolis, Minnesota: April
  • Chicago, Illinois: end of June
  • Northern California: beginning of July  — mid-July
  • Southern California: mid-July — end of July
  • Seattle, Washington: mid- September


What We Need & What You Get

We would like your help to raise $6000 by April 30th, 2016.  We’ve set aside some of our own personal funds to go on this promotional book tour. We’ve also saved money to print our own poetry books too,  but we would still like your help. Here is where your money will go:  To help pay for transportation, housing, food and refreshments for events, workshop and office supplies, space and equipment rentals, marketing and promotional materials, and other miscellaneous fees .

Perks for your donations:

  • $5 - Personal “Thank You” cards with our autographs and positive quotes mailed to you to your home.  We truly value and appreciate your support!
  •  $10- All of the above + one hand-written poem of choice from the books with our autographs mailed to you to your home.  
  • $20- All of the above + one personal video hang-out with both authors. We will read and perform our poems and speak about overcoming adversity. 
  • $30- All of the above + 6  spoken word poetry MP3 downloads (3 from each author); will include mixtures of musical backdrop soundtracks and  acapella tracks. 
  • $50- All of the above + 6 spoken word poetry MP3 downloads (3 from each author); will include mixtures of musical backdrop soundtracks and  acapella tracks + autographed books from each author.
  • $100- All of the above + one promotional recognition and appreciation of your business during book tour via  our websites and your banner at all of our events.
  • $500 - All of the above + sponsor a writing and self-empowerment workshop.  Your contribution will encourage those who come from any history of trauma – genocide, war, oppression, damage relationship - to view writing and self-empowerment workshops as a way to heal and overcome obstacles.  With this healing via workshops, we hope to create more positive and self-determined people who we believe will live happier and healthier lives so that we can interdependently live in a society where there are less hate, wars, genocide, and greed. We believe that people who work together cohesively become successful people. It is only when people are healed from trauma we can begin to be more giving and loving towards each other, ourselves, and we can finally live our lives the way we truly want to.
  • $1,000 -  All of the above + a portion of your contribution will go to non-profit organizations that participate in social justice work: National Asian Pacific American Women Forum (Minnesota), Khmer Girls in Action (Long  Beach, CA), Mekong NYC (New York City), and two- three organizations who are in need of funding for Syrian refugees.
  •   $5,000 -  All of the above + two special spoken word poetry readings,  2 writing and self-empowerment workshops, and book signings at your location (will include a limited number of donated books for your organization).

If we do not reach our entire goal, we will still commit to the above perks as much as we can, and use some of the funds to help us on the promotional book  tour. We appreciate any donations and are very happy and super excited to get this on the road!

ABOUT THE AUTHORS

Narate Keys is a 1.5 generation Cambodian American born in the Thailand refugee camp. Her family fled the Khmer Rouge’s brutal genocide in the late 1970’s. She is a poet, spoken word artist, and a songwriter from Rosemount, Minnesota.  She is the self-published author of a growing collection: The Good Life (poetry and songs), and The Changes… Immigration Footprints of Our Journey (poetry).  As a Khmer immigrant, Keys writes to express the true meaning of her voice. It is through poetry that Keys have found love, appreciation, and encouragement.  Keys has performed her poems in Washington D.C., Minnesota’s The Loft Literary Center, Seattle, amongst others.  Keys is also a mother and currently a student seeking a degree in Doctor’s of Chiropractic.

At the age of one, Peuo Tuy and her family escaped the Khmer Rouge’s genocide in Cambodia. Tuy is a poet, spoken word artist, fiction writer, and an educator from New York City. Raised in Lowell, Massachusetts, she began writing about her childhood experiences as a dark-skinned Asian girl, searching for self-love while experiencing the inequalities of immigrant life. Tuy is the self-published author of Khmer Girl poetry book.  Her spoken word has been featured at Sullivan Middle School in MA, Rutgers University New Brunswick in NJ, and Quinnipiac University in CT.  For New York’s schools - Freeport High School, Alexander Hamilton Junior High School, The New School University, amongst others. Tuy was one of the original members of Urbintel's HerStory cast, which toured universities and performance venues on the East Coast, from Boston to North Carolina. Tuy uses poetry to educate audiences about Khmer heritage and self-love. As an educator, she offers writing and self-empowerment workshops focusing on peace, self-love, compassion, and overcoming adversity. Tuy holds a Bachelor of Arts degree in Africana/Puerto Rican/Latino Studies. Tuy is currently working on writing fiction storybooks for children.

The Impact

The impact:  Creating future generations of healers, thinkers, shakers, and doers!

It is important to acknowledge those who have gone through traumas in their lives. It not only happens in our own homes, but in other parts of the world, too. For example, due to the current state of Syrian refugees re-settling into the United States, it is important to bring up topics of war, oppression, trauma, and repression. It is vital as a nation to support the innocent children, mothers, and fathers whose lives are being drastically changed.  We believe we are placed on earth first to help others, then, we help ourselves. When you help others you in turn help yourself.  This level of commitment gives rise to compassion, love, and peace, thus creating a more serene and harmonious place to live in. 

We both come from the genocide that occurred in Cambodia in the mid 1970’s. We feel that as spoken word poets and educators who have a history of genocide and repression, it is pertinent that our voices be heard.  Literature, art, writing and self-empowerment workshops are crucial healers for the current generations of Cambodians and oppressed people. 

With the influx of Syrian refugees coming into the U.S or any families/people who are experiencing trauma, we believe that every human being should have access to food, shelter, clothing, education, and positive motivational tools to help them heal. We had those opportunities when we first arrived as refugees to this country. Shouldn’t everyone else, no matter what the traumas are? With your contribution, you will help us tell our stories of trauma, genocide, and overcoming adversity. You will also not only get the perks above, but you will help create many more generations of healers, thinkers, shakers, and doers!

*A portion of your donation will go to helping organizations (if the $1000 perk is chosen) who are working to help Syrian refugees adjust to living in the United States.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share the Indiegogo tools/links with friends, families, work associates, and anyone you think will be interested in our passion for our book tour and to help us create change in our communities.  

If you have anyone in mind we should contact to help contribute to our cause, please send them our way!  We would be happy to speak to them in more detail at tuyandkeys@gmail.com.

story:
Short Summary

Hello, I'm J.F. Jenkins, the author of "Sheltered", book three in my self published series The Achlivan Cycle. I've been here in the past to help fund my project. Time to give it another go!

In this volume, Timber, Chevelle, and Wicken's story comes to a close. Will they make it to Sanctuary alive? Will the human race survive? The answers lie in the pages of this book!

What We Need & What You Get

The money will be broken up as follows:
- Editing costs.
- Formatting costs.
- Artwork costs.
Everything extra will go to swag for you!

The Impact

Publishing is expensive, especially if you want to make it the best book possible. Your contribution will help fund a story that might not otherwise see the light of day.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge is going to be making the amount of money needed to get the book put together. The story itself is already finished and in editing. As it stands, I have enough of my own personal funds to pay for half of the editing job. Every little bit helps. I would love to see this book fully funded and available by this summer.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share, share, share! That always helps. The more people who see the campaign, the more people who might want to contribute.

story:
Second printing of "Transforming Ottawa"

IF YOU HAVE LANDED HERE LOOKING TO PRE-ORDER "TRANSFORMING OTTAWA" PLEASE NOTE:

The second printing will proceed. As the Indiegogo campaign is now over, all pre-orders will be handled from the www.oldottawa.ca site starting mid-February. The print run should be completed by March.


The book, which was originally crowd-funded through Indiegogo and released in November 2015 with a print run of 500 copies, sold out in six weeks. There have been many requests for a second printing. This crowd-funding campaign is a pre-order campaign to help me cover the up-front costs of a second print run.

This campaign is very straightforward: if you are interested in a copy of the book, simply pledge for it here. Your pledge will be a pre-order. Once the second printing is ready, I will organize another "perks pick-up at the pub" event for those who choose to pick it up in person. For those who are are unable to commit to attend, I will mail it to your home (a postage fee will apply).

This will be a short 30-day pre-order campaign. This will allow for the second printing to be in your hands by April.

The price of the book has had to be increased from $45 to $55 due to the decline in the value of the Canadian dollar and an increase in the cost of paper. The cost of shipping includes postage, an appropriate bubble mailer to protect the book, and handling.

As with the initial Indiegogo campaign, I would ask anyone who has official business with the City of Ottawa to please refrain from pledging here, and simply wait until the book is back in bookstores. Local independent bookstores are keeping lists of interested people.

If you prefer to pre-order at your local bookstore, you can secure your copy that way too. Just contact them and pay the $55 pre-order directly to them, and you'll be able to pick it up at the store.

I would like to express my sincere gratitude for the terrific support for this book.


BACKGROUND

My name is Alain Miguelez. I'm an urban planner and an amateur historian. I love my city, and I love researching its history. This book, titled Transforming Ottawa: Canada's Capital in the Eyes of Jacques Gréber, was inspired by the rediscovery, at the National Archives, of a large collection of hauntingly beautiful street scenes of Ottawa in 1937-39, commissioned by Jacques Gréber, the French urban planner hired by the Prime Minister of the day (W.L. Mackenzie King) to prepare a master plan for our city. The book looks at the city as Gréber saw it in 1937, when he first set foot in Ottawa, describes his famous 1950 plan, and discusses its outcomes and effects on our city.

If you live in Ottawa, chances are you’ve heard of the Gréber Plan. Now 65 years old, this blueprint for our city was almost entirely implemented over the decades and, in many ways, has defined the city as we know it today. But what did Ottawa look like before the Gréber Plan? What did that Plan see as the city’s burning problems, and how did it propose to resolve them? In hindsight, how did the solutions play out?

The book contains about 300 of these incredibly sharp and crisp black-and-white Ottawa street scenes from the late 1930's, in high resolution. You will see photos of streets and corners that are now unrecognizable, and some that have stayed amazingly identical to how they looked 75 years ago.

The book itself is intended as a contribution to the ongoing conversation about our growing city, its planning history, and its present-day challenges. I feel that it's important to know where we've been in order to better map out the future. Especially these days, with all the exciting projects that are taking place in Ottawa, the much stronger sense of civic identity emerging in our city, and the genuine interest in the stories and legends of our past, this book is intended to become a reference about the pivotal 1950 master plan by Jacques Gréber that changed the face of our city in a number of ways.

This is my second book - in 2004, I published "A Theatre Near You: 150 years of going to the show in Ottawa-Gatineau", a history of Ottawa-Gatineau theatres. That book is almost sold out -  the last remaining copies are at Perfect Books, corner Elgin & Somerset (Ottawa).


Alain Miguelez

story:
Why I Write 

During an annual Lets-Figure-Out-Your-Life session, a dear friend asked me what I am most passionate about. 

"A lot of things," I said. I am passionate about kids within the welfare/state custody system. I am passionate about disaster relief, about humanitarian work, about the worldwide water crisis.I guess more than anything I am passionate about writing--because it can encompass all of those things. 
It is how I tell the world what I have seen.

What started out as a sort of "Christian Inspiration" piece that I began writing during my 6-month stint in Uganda, East Africa, eventually became a travel memoir/spiritual journey. It evolved from a strictly biblical approach, to a sort of "what do I believe in, and how does that affect how I love God and others?"

wOnderlust is about what we don't know. It's about accepting that we know much less than we think we do--specifically, about God. It's about lessons learned and Truths discovered and questions unanswered. It's about the orphan children of Uganda, the welfare children of Missouri, the abortion rights activists of Fayetteville, Arkansas. It's about life in Korea, surviving St. Louis, and questioning what I grew up believing all along the way. 

It's a story I would love to share with you. 

What I Need To Make This Happen

I am self-publising this book and it will be available on eBook as well as in hard copy format. 

The total cost? 

$4,000

I would greatly appreciate your support either monetarily, through sharing via social media, word of mouth, or all of the above!

Risks & Challenges

This is scary. 

I have been writing this piece for five years, and avoiding an attempt at publishing for quite some time. Why? 

Because What if I fail?

Isn't that the question that crushes us all? How many times have you not pursued a dream because the fear of failure paralyzed you to the point of complete inaction?

Nothing is safe. 

But everything worth anything is worth pursuing anyway. 

So I wrote a book :)

story:
I'm a fantasy/sci-fi geek girl from way back. I remember how thrilled I was to find books with characters I could identify with. When I was younger I wanted girl heroes. When I was a teenager I was hit with a serious illness. Fantasy heroes like myself went from being rare to being almost nonexistent.

I'm talking here about the lack of protagonists with disability. Protagonists who are not spending the entire book looking to fix themselves or angst-ing about their loss of able-bod privilege. Protagonists whose disability doesn't hand the character super powers (looking at you Daredevil) or enable them to suddenly becoming ultra evolved Zen masters who take their rotten luck in stride with gentle philosophy.

I couldn't find the books I wanted to read, so I started writing them.

This is a Young Adult Fantasy with a PG-13 rating for dark elements, that features LGBTQ characters and characters with disabilities.

Book Summary:

Present-day southeastern Michigan is a place quietly under siege by darkness. The Nain Rouge has been sighted in Detroit. The Loupe Garou is rumored to haunt the woods near Mackinaw. There have been reports of witch lights near the small town of Saline. A suicide cluster plagues Washtenaw County. 

Fifteen year-old Bailey is a young transgender man whose current ambition is to make it through high school alive and with good enough grades that he can attend college. He wishes his premonitions would reveal something more concrete than impending doom. Winning lottery numbers, perhaps.

Sixteen year old Lydia Cohen is an intelligent, extroverted high school junior
whose favorite activity is sleight-of-hand magic tricks that, unknown to
her, have begun to become true mage craft. An inveterate skeptic,
she will tell you there’s no such thing as magic, but perhaps she is
only trying to convince herself. Though she was born with a severely
deformed right hand, she doesn’t consider herself disabled by anything
but the perceptions of others.

Unknown to her family, fourteen year old Angela is a changeling. She was exchanged with a faerie when she was a baby through an accidental bargain made with a fae court . She and her fae counterpart have returned to their rightful places in the world. The transition from the Twilight Realm to the mortal world takes a terrible toll on her mind and body. Angela suffers from the aftereffects of severe meningitis with ongoing neurological effects-confusion, brain fog, impulse control issues and more.

Evil touches our heroes when a girl from their school is found dead in a nearby park. Her death follows the eerie pattern of the suicide cluster. In the wake of this death, Angela, Lydia and Bailey are hunted by supernatural creatures, who take the form of black eyed children.

This is a story that begins the classic hero’s journey. The three protagonists are called to become heroes. Forces array against them. They discover the world is deeper than they thought.


What I Need & What You Get

I am a firm believer in the value of good editing. This is not cheap. To bring this finished manuscript to a bookstore near you, I need funds for editing and publishing.

I will also donate print copies to local libraries and schools.

Any money over and above the goal will go towards paying my bills so I can spend more time writing. The more time I get to write, the faster I can finish the next (already started) manuscript!

The Impact


Its difficult to find stories with queer or disabled characters that don't make disability or queerness the story. Or else they become a stereotype: the disabled BFF, the gay confidante. Worst of all, they may merely be a part of the hero's tragic backstory-the chronically ill or queer significant other who died and left the protagonist with a hunger for justice/vengeance or whatever.

The cast represents a more realistic view of disability and difference than is often portrayed in young adult novels.  While each of the characters has some kind of disability, these disabilities are only part of them, not their defining feature.
Night Draws In  is a contemporary fantasy that features characters who are more than one attribute.

Supporting this book is supporting diversity in fantasy/science fiction.

story_txt:
I'm a fantasy/sci-fi geek girl from way back. I remember how thrilled I 
was to find books with characters I could identify with. When I was 
younger I wanted girl heroes. When
 I was a teenager I was hit with a serious illness. Fantasy heroes like 
myself went from being rare to being almost nonexistent. I'm 
talking here about the lack of protagonists with disability. 
Protagonists who are not spending the entire book looking to fix 
themselves or angst-ing about their loss of able-bod privilege. 
Protagonists whose disability doesn't hand the character super powers 
(looking at you Daredevil) or enable them to suddenly becoming ultra 
evolved Zen masters who take their rotten luck in stride with gentle 
philosophy.
I couldn't find the books I wanted to read, so I started writing them.
This is a Young Adult Fantasy with a PG-13 rating for dark elements, that features LGBTQ characters and characters with disabilities.
Book Summary:




Present-day southeastern Michigan is a place quietly under siege by darkness. The
 Nain Rouge has been sighted in Detroit. The Loupe Garou is rumored to 
haunt the woods near Mackinaw. There have been reports of witch lights 
near the small town of Saline. A suicide cluster plagues Washtenaw County. 
Fifteen year-old Bailey is a young transgender man whose current 
ambition is to make it through high school alive and with good enough 
grades that he can attend college. He wishes his premonitions would 
reveal something more concrete than impending doom. Winning lottery 
numbers, perhaps. 
Sixteen year old Lydia Cohen is an intelligent, extroverted high school junior whose favorite activity is sleight-of-hand magic tricks that, unknown to her, have begun to become true mage craft. An inveterate skeptic, she will tell you there’s no such thing as magic, but perhaps she is only trying to convince herself. Though she was born with a severely deformed right hand, she doesn’t consider herself disabled by anything but the perceptions of others.
Unknown
 to her family, fourteen year old Angela is a changeling. She was exchanged with a 
faerie when she was a baby through an 
accidental bargain made with a fae court . She and her fae counterpart have returned 
to their rightful places in the world. The transition from the Twilight 
Realm to the mortal world takes a terrible toll on her mind and body. 
Angela suffers from the aftereffects of severe meningitis with ongoing 
neurological effects-confusion, brain fog, impulse control issues and 
more.

Evil touches our heroes when a girl from their 
school is found dead in a nearby park. Her death follows the eerie 
pattern of the suicide cluster. In the wake of this death, Angela, Lydia 
and Bailey are hunted by supernatural creatures, who take the form of
 black eyed children.
This is
 a story that begins the classic hero’s journey. The three protagonists 
are called to become heroes. Forces array against them. They discover 
the world is deeper than they thought.



What I Need & What You Get



I am a firm believer in the value of good editing. This is not cheap. To bring this finished manuscript to a bookstore near you, I need funds for editing and publishing. I will also donate print copies to local libraries and schools.Any money over and above the goal will go towards paying my bills so I can spend more time writing. The more time I get to write, the faster I can finish the next (already started) manuscript!

story:
Writing is a form of magic. As you read this, my thoughts at the moment I put them down are transmitted through time and space to be with you, wherever you might be. As a medium, this particular form of magic is most potent when used to tell a story.

In my 16+ years as a marketer and copywriter, I’ve used stories used to sell, to raise awareness, to grow an audience or shift opinions. I’ve done a lot of writing for businesses, but my passion for stories has always been elsewhere.

It’s been in the pages of a novel or the treacherous, yet hopeful writing marathon that is NaNoWriMo every November. It’s been in wandering with the gunslinger, or in feeling the cold bite of winter at the Wall.   

But the stories I really want to be involved in, the ones I want to uplift and share, are those being told about people who look like me. And who look like you. I want to read more about people whose narratives mesh more with my own understandings and experiences of the world, even when their worlds are nothing like my own.

With the creation of Sanguine Press and this first anthology, Transitions and Awakenings, I hope you’ll join me in sharing the magic of these stories with the world and rewarding the authors who create them.

This is about choice. It’s about representation. But most important of all, it’s about the magic of stories and the journeys we take within them.

We’ve already gotten the initial anthology off the ground, and with your support, we can take it to the next level:

  • More stories
  • More artwork
  • An online magazine
  • A print magazine

Please join us in building this supportive, creative community from the ground up, and in the process support these stories that speak our narratives in ways that are both personal and profound.

What We Need & What You Get

Here’s what we have budgeted so far:

  • Roughly $3,700.00 for writers’ payments –  $1,562.00 has been paid so far to accepted authors, with additional acceptances on the way in the next two weeks.
  • $400 for the cover and formatting – digital and print
  • $500 for initial social media advertising for the anthology
  • $100 in promos (We ran a little ‘win a Kindle’ contest for submitting authors, and will do a few other fun things going forward.)
  • $900 in business costs – ISBN block, web hosting, our submissions management platform, etc.

All of the funds listed above have come from me, personally. Not because I am rich (so far from it) but because I decided early on that if I was going to do this, I was going to go all in. I thought we’d get roughly 50 or so submissions because we were new, and I’d get to pick the best 10 and make a great little anthology.

Instead, we got over 250 submissions, and I am still picking my jaw up off the floor from the amount of awesome that was sent our way. We want to be able to add more stories to this anthology, but to do that we need your help!

Here’s what we need:

  • $1,000 – this lets me pay my editors who are knocking this out of the park
  • $2000 – I get to pay my editors and add a couple more stories to the anthology
  • $5,000 – double the number of stories we add to the anthology, and pay the editors
  • $8,500 – double the stories, editors paid, and we set up the first issue of the online mag
  • $10,000 – all of the above plus a lot more artwork
  • $20,000+ – I burst into tears of disbelief and we fund the next anthology (not kidding, ya’ll, real tears)

Here’s what you get:

When you contribute at the $10 level and above, you’ll get the digital version of the anthology, plus your name listed on our Wall of Honor on the website. Those of you who contribute $25 or more will get the print version, plus the digital. If you’d like to order multiple copies of either the print or the digital versions, choose the bundles!

The Impact

When I first had the idea to publish an anthology featuring people of color, I will admit that my goals were modest. I didn’t know if there would be anyone interested in writing for this anthology, much less reading it. And with everything happening in our world right now, it seemed almost trite to work on something as “frivolous” as an anthology when there are so many others doing real work out there to make things better.

Ultimately, what changed my mind was a show called This Week in Blackness and in particular, the way it made me feel when I watched it.

I felt at home.

Not in the sense that I knew these people – I don’t, and I’m pretty sure I’d devolve into incoherent gibberish if any of the hosts deigned to speak to me in person – but in the sense that these were reasoned, intelligent people who looked like me, felt many of the things that I felt, and held a perspective of the world that traditional media had more or less disregarded.

I felt understood. I felt empathized with. I laughed with these people, and I got angry around the same things and slowly but surely I found myself tuning in more and more. Hanging out in the community. Finding a place.

Finding a place that “feels right” is important. And watching Elon, Imani, Aaron, and the others work so hard (but with such joy) to build that place for themselves and for all of us was so inspiring that I took the leap, with the goal of building my own community focused on really great fiction with characters that don't fit the standard narrative.

And so here we are.

We have a great foundation here. Soon we'll be posting samples from each of the chosen stories so far so you can judge for yourself, but as someone who has spent the last eight months alongside my editors reading through literally hundreds of stories and thousands of pages, I can say without reservation that each and every story we've chosen is one that I would happily see spun off into a series or even a novel in the same world. 

With so many places to visit and new characters to meet, I hope you find a place that feels right in these stories, just like I have. And with any luck, there will be many more to come as we build our community of authors, artists, subscribers and fans. 

Risks & Challenges

Like any publishing house with a small staff, our biggest challenge is hitting our timelines for production and publication. The project itself is funded and moving in the right direction, and we’ll keep our lines of communication open so you know exactly where we are in the process.

We originally had a long list of possible perks for this, everything from bookmarks to art books and audiobooks. (Don’t ya’ll want to hear my southern drawl explain the intricate rituals of summoning from the fourth gate?)

In the end, we decided that these could impact our timeline too much, and so have kept it simple. But you tell me – if you want additional perks, send some ideas our way and we’ll open up a poll or something to pick the most popular ones.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can’t afford to contribute, we want you as part of our community!

  • Join our Facebook group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/1833672850202622/
  • Share this campaign with your friends and family!
  • If you’re an artist, submit your portfolio: http://www.sanguine.press/portfolio-submissions/
  • If you’re a writer, get on our mailing list for new submissions: https://www.getrevue.co/profile/SanguinePress

I can’t wait to see what we create together. Thank you!
