story:
2 years in the Making

Getting our story from concept to hardcover started with nothing but closed doors, challenges and setbacks.  The struggles of the character Jacob in the book ironically mirrored our struggles along the way.  But we didn’t give up.  We believed enough in our project that we put our heart, soul, money and even our house on the line when we decided to self publish. Here we stand today with the first run of hardcover books ready for shipment in November.

  • We wish to continue the Journey of Jacob in his second story plus we have several other great books already started. It takes a lot of time, funds, and fans to bring a project to life. We have great perks for donations including volume discounts for giving books to others or your favorite charities. Your help will allow us to help others.
  • Our goal is to create fun engaging books that kids want to read.  It all starts with you and Operation Hula Hoop. Every time you see a child exercising with a  hula hoop, you will think, “I was a part of that.”

 

Jacob the Caterpillar wins you over in this fun, exciting, rhyming, counting, picture book that will make you want to get up and hula hoop! In this motivational story you will share the day with young Jacob while he struggles with a roller coaster of emotions all because he steps out of his comfort zone to learn how to Hula Hoop! He finds out that he does not have to follow the crowd to fit in. With some kind words of advice from one of his elders, a passing butterfly, Jacob discovers the power of intention, practice makes perfect and never give up on your dreams.  

The day dreaming young caterpillar wins over the admiration of his friends. Children learn their numbers with fun rhymes as they count to twenty while discovering some of life's greatest lessons. At the end of the inspirational story adults are encouraged to teach kids to count higher and that hooping is fun exercise while Jacob keeps swishing that hoop until the sun goes down.

  • Hi! We are Kym & Stan the Authors & Co-Creators of The Caterpillar and the Hula Hoop Picture Book. We are a husband and wife team chasing our dream. We work extremely well together and so chose to use the pen name Festa Pfannkuch combining our names and representing ourselves as one entity. We write and create art together as a unified creative team bouncing ideas back and forth until the project is complete as if we had one mind. 
  • The beautiful Illustrations in this book were created by Kym who is a professionally trained illustrator and every stroke of color in the artwork was considered as important to our readers as every written word in the story. We created this book with nothing but the highest quality and best intention for the final product to sit on the shelf alongside other best sellers. We Just need a little help from our friends.

 

According to his accounts Dr. Suess was rejected by 20 to 43 publishers. He was about to burn his manuscript when a chance encounter with an old classmate led him to get his 1st children’s book published. In 1937 Suess forever changed the world of children’s books.

You, our fans, our online community are our chance to get our story heard.

Breakdown of budget                                                             

  • Professionally Rendered Illustrations
  • Art direction and Layout Design
  • Cover Design
  • Printing Hard Cover Books (Printed in USA)
  • Marketing Costs (Where to begin...95% of publishing a book is marketing)
  • Market Testing
  • Book and Incentives- Cost & Distribution
  • Shipping & Packaging
  • Indiegogo Fees + Credit Card and PayPal Fees
  • Misc (ei. Editing,Copyright, ISNB, LLC Formation and more)

We have invested approximately $30,000 of our money to get this far plus countless hours of our time have been taken away from our paid work. We are 100 percent determined to make our first book a hit, but we still need your help. We are not asking for $30,000, although that would be nice. Spread the word of #operationhulahoop. Join us by choosing a donation package now. 

Books are due to ship Nov 2016 just in time for the Gift Giving Season so check out the bulk discount packages.

 

HOW YOU CAN HELP

  • Spread the word. The more people who know about the campaign, the better. Please SHARE this campaign through email, FaceBook and other social media. You can share this URL or this link http://www.festaville.com/books  
  • Contribute money to the campaign. Money is needed! Smaller amounts will win our love and gratitude. Larger amounts will get you that, plus some pretty nice perks.
  • Leave a comment here. Please cheer us on and let us know what you think! It may sound silly, but it would really mean a lot. Like us on FaceBook  https://www.facebook.com/festaville

Support Operation Hula Hoop AND Inspire children to Learn, Exercise and Believe in themselves!

Youth Sizes- YXS, YS, YM, YL, YXL
Adult Unisex Sizes - S, M, L, XL, 2XL, 3XL
If you choose a package with a T-Shirt, we will send you a form where you choose the size(s) & color when the campaign is over in early November.

story:
I am a writer.  While it can be lonely, it can be amazingly rewarding.

Not just selling books, though that is part of why I publish, but discovering new readers and fans and communing with book lovers; discovering what they like and why, finding authors in common as well as new writers with whom I may not be familiar.  

And yes, selling books.

That's what this campaign is all about.  I want to reach as many people as possible with a tour of my second Jace Salome novel, East of the Sun.  On the last tour, I visited Texas and selected bits of Oklahoma.  This time, I want to have more Texas and Oklahoma events, as well as events in Colorado, Iowa, Illinois, Tennessee, and Georgia.

My books come from small publishers who generally can't afford to send their authors on book tours.  So to reach that community, to grow the number of people who've discovered and read my work, I need to tour but I have to cover costs myself.  

Therefore, I have a goal of $5,000, which will cover airfare, car rental and gas, meals, and inexpensive hotels (a rarity as I mostly stay with friends and fans).  I have the entire budget planned out and can email it to anyone who wants to see it!

But my reading tours aren't just readings. Last time, I presented a cold case-an unsolved homicide from my day job.  This time, it's the Crime Scene In A Box.  We'll cover how crime scenes are processed and then we'll take some prints, maybe do some blood spatter and even crime scene photography. I'll do it at libraries, schools, hosted readings, anywhere people want to have some fun and learn about crime scene basics.

So anyone who helps this campaign is helping not only me tour my newest three books, but also helping other people have some fun.

And for those who help, there is quite a bit of swag: copies of the books, shirts and hats, complete Trey R. Barker libraries, wanted posters, even multiple chances to be a character in one of the upcoming Jace Salome novels.

There are also ways to help that don't include donations.  Get the word out to everyone you know who loves books and supporting authors.  Remember that Indiegogo has sharing tools so you can plant news of this campaign anywhere and everywhere.

Or volunteer to host an event!  It can be a reading or it can include the Crime Scene In A Box.  At your house or your favorite bar; on your back deck or in your front yard.  They've been held at churches and writers'/artists' enclaves, at schools and high school reunions.  Hosting an event gets you in on the swag and free books, too.

FYI...I plan to use all the funds, whether I reach the full goal or something less.  Every cent will go to help offset the cost of the tour.

I believe East of the Sun can be my most successful book and event tour so far.  And I believe we can get that done together.  So do what you can and I'll see you next February or March!
story_txt: I am a writer.  While it can be lonely, it can be amazingly rewarding.Not just selling books, though that is part of why I publish, but discovering new readers and fans and communing with book lovers; discovering what they like and why, finding authors in common as well as new writers with whom I may not be familiar.  And yes, selling books.That's what this campaign is all about.  I want to reach as many people as possible with a tour of my second Jace Salome novel, East of the Sun.  On the last tour, I visited Texas and selected bits of Oklahoma.  This time, I want to have more Texas and Oklahoma events, as well as events in Colorado, Iowa, Illinois, Tennessee, and Georgia.My books come from small publishers who generally can't afford to send their authors on book tours.  So to reach that community, to grow the number of people who've discovered and read my work, I need to tour but I have to cover costs myself.  Therefore, I have a goal of $5,000, which will cover airfare, car rental and gas, meals, and inexpensive hotels (a rarity as I mostly stay with friends and fans).  I have the entire budget planned out and can email it to anyone who wants to see it!But my reading tours aren't just readings. story:
“Hans Jonas wrote that in order to understand Gnostic teachings, one needed something like a musical ear whereby to discern the subtleties of this worldview. Andrew Phillip Smith, in addition to his fine scholarship, possesses this musical ear.”

Stephan Hoeller, author of Gnosticism: New Light on the Ancient Tradition of Inner Knowing

I am known as the writer of several books on Gnosticism: Secret History of the Gnostics, Lost Teachings of the Cathars, A Dictionary of Gnosticism and books on The Gospel of Philip, The Lost Sayings of Jesus and Gnostic Writings on the Soul and the forthcoming John the Baptist and the Last Gnostics. I am also editor and publisher of The Gnostic: A Journal of Gnosticism, Western Esotericism and Spirituality.

Besides my books, I have over the years written several articles on Gnosticism and apocrypha. The topics range from the Muslim Gospel of Barnabas and the mysterious Secret Gospel of Mark to examinations of specific Gnostic writings, which are often very difficult to understand without a guide.

Some of these writings are dotted around the six issues of The Gnostic. Others were written for magazines like Fortean Times, New Dawn and Watkins Mind Body Spirit, or were for blogs or for promotional purposes. Gnostic Tendencies will collect together all of my articles on Gnosticism and apocrypha, along with new pieces written specially for this collection. The result will be a unique collection that includes an introduction to Gnosticism for new readers, articles on several individual Gnostic scriptures, material written from a more personal approach and much more.

More Than a Collection

What began as a simple collection of already-published materials has turned into a real book. As I was looking over the material I found myself wanting to revise, polish and update the published articles. I also found myself wanting to revisit some of my earlier themes, such as the distinction between soul and spirit. In my books I have tried to make Gnosticism understandable and approachable, while also including information that does not appear in in books for the general reader. A collection like this allows me to pick out individual themes. Sometimes my approach here is more personal than in my book-length studies. The book will have introductory material so it can be read by new readers as well as by the hardcore Gnostic.

As well as setup fees, design and editing services and so on, I need to buy myself time to work on this and, as ever, purchase extra research materials. The result will be a solid volume that, along with Secret history of the Gnostics, Lost Teachings of the Cathars, A Dictionary of Gnosticism and my others books will sum up my research into Gnosticism, apocrypha and lost gospels over the past 15-20 years.

Perks and Rewards

The main reward is the book itself in eBook and paperback editions. As an established author and small publisher I am able to offer signed copies of earlier books and eBook editions of The Gnostic. I will even write to order for you.

Risks and Challenges

Getting the new essays finished and so on. I respond well to deadlines and I'm much more productive when I have to meet them. If the campaign doesn't reach its target the book will still go ahead, but in a more limited form. All the perks or rewards will be honoured.

Preliminary Table of Contents

Introduction: Why I Write About Gnosticism

A Whirlwind Tour

Reading the Gnostics

Gnostic Scripture

The Gospel of Thomas: Translatyion and Esoteric Interpretation

The Hard choice: Authoritative Discourse

Obnoxious Gnostics: The Apocalypse of Peter

14 Gnostic Christmases: The Apocalypse of Adam

Aeons That Are Ages and Entities: The Concept of Our Great Power

Symbols and Sacraments: Revisiting the Gospel of Philip

Down Into Egypt: Revisiting the Hymn of the Pearl

Revisiting the Exegesis on the Soul

'From That Blood the First Rose Sprouted' – On the Origin of the World

Soul and Spirit, Colour and Light

Testing the Cathars

The Alternative Judas

Alexandria, at the Conjunction of the Whole world

Gospels that Were Never Lost

The Mischievous Secret Gospel of Mark

Leaden Codices

The Gospel of Barnabas

Romanticizing the Gnostics

Blasphemy

One Two three

Myths Aren’t True, Neither Is History

Elitism

Sin

Ignorant Design

Glossary


What people have said about my other books:-

John the Baptist and the Last Gnostics

"A fascinating and well-researched study into a vanishing religion and how it connects us with 2000 years of religious history."
--Richard Smoley, author of Forbidden Faith: The Secret History of Gnosticism

A stunning intellectual achievement and an essential work for anybody interested in the lesser-known aspects of Gnostic beliefs, both ancient and modern."

Anthony Peake.

A Dictionary of Gnosticism

‘A long-awaited and indispensable grammar of classical Gnosticism – essential

for any serious student, and a practical gem for the curious.’

—Jordan Stratford, author of Living Gnosticism

‘A Dictionary of Gnosticism is a valuable resource for any student of Gnosis. If you need a helpful translator of the language, or a sympathetic guide to the beliefs of these extraordinary women and men who lived a long time ago, in a world far, far away, then this is the book for you. Think of it as the ‘Lonely Cosmos Guide to Gnosis’, and always pack a copy when you are setting out for that strange and exciting country. Have a great trip!’

—Timothy Freke and Peter Gandy, authors of The Jesus Mysteries and The Gospel of the Second Coming

The Gospel of Philip

‘Provides us with a wealth of insightful annotations, and the translation is the

most accessible to date. All of those with an interest in Gnostic tradition and its

sacraments will be happy to receive this splendid work!’

—Stephan A. Hoeller, author of Jung and The Lost Gospels and The Gnostic Jung

‘How refreshing to move from our contemporary culture of Christian literalism

to a spiritual world alive with symbol, metaphor and the poetry of the Divine.’

—Ron Miller, Religion Department chair, Lake Forest College, author of

The Gospel of Thomas: A Guidebook for Spiritual Practice

The Lost Sayings of Jesus

‘If the gospels represent the tip [of Jesus’s sayings], Andrew Phillip Smith has

provided the rest of the iceberg. Here is proof that [Jesus’s] voice has never

fallen silent.’

—Robert M. Price, professor of scriptural studies, Johnnie Colemon

Theological Seminary

‘Marvellous ... Will provide spiritual seekers, committed Christians, and

academic scholars [insight into] sayings attributed to Jesus that they may not

know existed. A valuable sourcebook and significant contribution to the study

of the history of Christian ideas.’ —Stevan Davies, professor emeritus of religious studies, College Misericordia and author of The Gospel of Thomas: Annotated & Explained

Gnostic Writings on the Soul

‘Artful and erudite ... brings these allegories into three-dimensional relief,

making them more memorable, accessible, and significant.’

—Rabbi Elie Kaplan Spitz, author of Does the Soul Survive?

story:
Short Summary

We live in a world where discrimination exists in many forms. We believe that many people who discriminate against others do so out of their ignorance. Education plays a big part in educating people to stop discrimination and encourage empathy towards people with needs that differ from ours. 

Our project is starting off with a single picture book that forms a series of 5 books featuring the inner thoughts of children with special needs. 

We hope to publish these books and have parents, teachers (or simply anybody) read and discuss what our characters go through. We hope our writing and illustrations can help people (and especially children) understand that people with special needs are precious human beings just like us. 


Through understanding why people with special needs may act differently, we hope that our readers can help others show more care towards people who may have special needs or who are just different!


3 REASONS TO SUPPORT OUR PROJECT

  • You’ll help us fund, illustrate, edit, design, print and publish the first of 5 books in the series
  • By helping us launch the series, we can change a generation of people and children to understand and care for people with special needs
    •

  • You can be the first to get a copy of our books (and eventually the entire series)

Where will funds go?

We are in the process of writing, editing and illustrating the book and funds are required for these. The rest will be channeled to printing, shipping and marketing expenses. A simple list of expenditure the USD $30,000 will be used for.

  • Production of the story/illustrations
  • Scanning and digital processing of illustrations 
  • Interior book design, layout, and finishing touches
  • Marketing/Advertising (incl. IndieGogo fees)
  • Distribution costs
  • Mailing/Shipping fees
  • Printing

Risks & Challenges

Our challenge is to get our message out there for sufficient people to know and support our project. We plan to share our work through several social media platforms and share this project as widely as possible.


HOW YOU CAN HELP

  • Help fund our project!

  • Share this page/link on social media (www.thereadingband.com) and spread the word.

  • Encourage us by posting your comments :)

Estamos buscando diversificar el tipo de material que producimos, mejorar la calidad del mismo y expandir el alcance de nuestra plataforma. Necesitamos de sus donaciones para gastos de gasolina, pagar 'ads' en las redes, comprar mejores equipos y programas de edición de vídeos, entre otras cosas. Es importante que este tipo de iniciativa independiente se sostenga del apoyo solidario de quienes ven su pertinencia. Cualquier tipo de donación será bienvenida y agradecida. Con tu ayuda esperamos seguir siendo un espacio de difusión de información sobre lo que acontece políticamente en nuestro país.

We are looking forward to diversifying the type of material that we produce, better the quality of our products and expand the operations of our platform. story:
Winter Palace Research (Зимний дворец)

The Winter Palace in St. Petersburg has been waiting to share its intimate details in English.

My book is a story of a palace of immense size and of an Imperial family of immense wealth. It is a story of the daily public and intimate life in the palace; a palace that was loved and disdained and withstood decades of changes.

I am indebted to Russian researchers and authors. I have assisted and shared a wide range of research material with members on discussion forums, with English and Russian authors/historians and with the Windsor Royal Collection.

I have created a platform with research excerpts at http://winterpalaceresearch.blogspot.ca/

My goal is to raise funds to finalize research with original documents, plans and photographs in St. Petersburg and in Europe for my book and subsequent projects.

With perks, I will be able to share my research of paintings, photographs and plans of the individual rooms and my English translations of fourteen Russian books.

My heartfelt gratitude and profound thanks for supporting my campaign and joining with me on our tour through the Winter Palace.

USB stick – 3 floors (plans 1840s, 1900s, 1930s; old & current photographs of the rooms; paintings/watercolors of the rooms; architectural & furniture designs)

List of Translated Books for Perks

Adult World of the Imperial Palaces – I. Zimin

Children’s World of the Imperial Palaces – I. Zimin

The Emperor’s Work – I. Zimin

The Emperor’s Money – I. Zimin

Courtyard of Russian Emperors Vol 1 – I. Zimin

Courtyard of Russian Emperors Vol 2 – I. Zimin

Imperial Cuisine– I. Zimin

Jewelry Treasures of the Russian Imperial Court – I. Zimin & A. Sokolov

People of the Winter Palace – Household & Servants – I. Zimin

Charity of the Romanov Family – I. Zimin

Imperial Dentistry – I. Zimin

Alexander Palace – I. Zimin

A. Polovtsov Diary Volume 1

A. Polovtsov Diary Volume 2

story:
Highlighting diversity is the core of its identity. Ubikwist represents the positive and playful elements of culture, but is not afraid to seek truth in the darkness. It is not just a fashion publication. It is for people with a desire to stay informed about all aspects of popular culture, including its origin stories and its pioneers. By combining new innovative talent with unique ideas, we push boundaries and exceed expectations of what a magazine can offer with audacity and creativity.

Ubikwist seeks to be a bold leader of influence and opinions with a consistent vision, alternative writing and a strategy to harvest the fruits of its labor over the long haul.

We cater to the audience that is frustrated by the status quo by providing a luxurious, edgy, eclectic, multicultural publication. Contributors from around the world inspire meaningful dialogue in every feature.

Ubikwist is ultimately about Community and Authenticity.

We want Ubikwist to be of consistent high quality, possessing something special in every issue, and 2 magazines a year will allow us time to get the right result. 

We are currently working on our Spring Summer issue and having your support will help tremendously for ensuring the magazine’s future. Please help us spread the word out .

Your contribution will be greatly appreciated. 

Thank you for your help and support

Giannie Couji

If you have no money! How can you help?

Spread the word! People need to know about this campaign. 

Love, comment and share the news on Twitter, Instagram or Facebook.

Thank you for your help and your support!

Short Summary

My name is Matt Wingett, the one man band who runs the publishing company Life Is Amazing. I'm dedicated to promoting Portsmouth and writers around the South Coast, and that's how I got involved in two brilliant projects.

The first is Day of the Dead - a collection of stories about Death and Dying, sourced from Portsmouth Writer's Hub. The Hub is a network connecting some of the best talent in Portsmouth. Writers have produced 28 stories all around the idea of Day of the Dead. Sometimes scary, sometimes funny, sometimes poignant, it's a collection that shows of the many voices connected to the Hub.

The second is Dark City - a project that was organised through Portsmouth University. The 18 contributors and 20 stories in the book are all set in Portsmouth... but not one quite as you know it. With tales of hauntings and strange transformations, the book is a great celebration of the scary side of Pompey.

I'm publishing the book, and would love to get these writers read by as many people as possible. Your preorder will enable me to print a larger print run and get the book out to even more people.

So, if you love Pompey and great storytelling, help us to get Portsmouth writers out there!

 

What I Need & What You Get

Guys, I'm only looking to meet a modest target that will fund the print runs of these books. Of course, the more I get, the bigger the print run and distribution.

But all I'm looking for is £200, Indiegogo's minimum is £500. If I get that - it'll be great!

Here's what I'm offering. It's really simple:

1 BOOK = £9.99

ANY 2 BOOKS = 10% DISCOUNT = £18

ANY 4 BOOKS = 12.5% DISCOUNT = £35

ANY 10 BOOKS = 25% DISCOUNT = £75

This gives you the opportunity to get that book out for your friends for Christmas. What you'll need to do is tell me the combination of books you want when you order.

REMEMBER - postage within the UK will be free. I will need to get in touch with you to arrange delivery outside of the UK.

The Impact

Firstly, THANK YOU for taking the time to read this and to order. It makes a huge difference to know that there are people out there supporting and helping Portsmouth writers be read by people all over the world.

This will enable me to offer the books into shops without worrying about the print costs - because I run the whole endeavour of Life Is Amazing on a shoestring.

Your support counts!

How else you can help:

Please... spread the word. Share this campaign on social networks and tell your friends.

EVERYTHING YOU DO TO PUBLICISE THESE GREAT BOOKS HELPS!

story:
[A free translation to Spanish follows the text in English, below.] 

Hi! I'm Valerie Williams-Sanchez, author of the "Cocoa Kids Collection" of children's books. 

In my first story, Isaiah and the Chocolate Mountain©, Isaiah stormed out of the house, into adventure, and our hearts. Then, in Eddie and the Hot Cocoa Hot Rod©, Eddie never gave up until he reached the Winner's Circle.  Now, in Lorena and the Magic Mocha Mirror©, Lorena is taking on beach blanket bullies to an empowering and happy ending.  

Here's the story: Lorena's love of Magic Mocha Ice Cream makes her an easy target for body-shaming, beach bullies on her family's annual trip to Grandma Mimi's beach house. But when a trio of mermaid sisters turn the tide, and teach her that bodies come in all shapes and sizes, and to love her body in "Lorena and the Magic Mocha Mirror," it's our pint-sized heroine who comes out on top. 

This Indiegogo campaign, again, seeks financial support to publish a title that will engage those among the most underserved of young readers, multicultural and ethnic minority children, in middle childhood.

Some current data:

   U.S. Trade Books Trends in Content By and About African-Americans  

  • The total number of children's titles, 2014-2016, has hovered around 3,400 - 3,500 per year
  • African Americans make up 12.5% of the U.S. population, though
  • Children's books By African Americans totaled only 3% of all books* in 2015 and 2016, and  
  • Children's books About African Americans totaled just 8% of all books in 2015 and 2016
  • The disparity is clear!

    * All books is defined as those books submitted to CCBC for survey and tracking purposes. 

Source: The Cooperative Children’s Book Center (CCBC) is a unique examination, study and research library of the School of Education at the University of Wisconsin-Madison. 

Featuring the newest in the Cocoa Kids Collection Books' cast of multicultural characters, and the series' first female main character, "Lorena and the Magic Mocha Mirror©" includes Lorena, the real-life namesake of my own daughter in this, my third work of fiction and my initial endeavor as a book illustrator.

The last publishing campaign achieved just 11% of its financial goal. This time, won't you join in, to give and share the word to help us reach at least 100% of our funding goal, $5,000. Please support this important project and become a publishing partner!

When you do, you'll get cool perks** and acknowledgment for supporting one of traditional publishing's least represented segments - children of color.

Be part of the movement!

Thank you,

Valerie ~ 

**Please note that perks that include signed copies of the book cannot be sent out until the book has completed the publishing process. Publishing time takes a minimum of three months.

--------------------------------------------

[Una traducción libre al español, hecho por Valerie Williams-Sanchez, el dia once de junio, 2017.]

Hola! Soy Valerie, autora de la serie “La Colección de Libros de los Niños Cocoa.” 

En la primera historia del serie, “Isaiah y la Montaña de Chocolate,” Isaiah salió de casa y empezó una adventura, terminando con nuestro cariño. Luego, en la historia de "Eddie y el Coche Fantástico de Chocolate,”  Eddie nunca se renunciaba hasta que llegó al circulo de ganadores. Ahora, en la historia de "Lorena y el Espejo Magico de Mocha," Lorena se encuentra con unos joven matones playeros. Con la ayuda de unas amiga nuevas, su cuento llega al final feliz.

La historia va asi: Lorena y su apetito para helado del sabor mocha se la deja vunerable a las malas intenciones de unos jovenes matones playeros cuando ella va a visitar a su abeula Mimi en su casa cerca del mar. Pero cuando unas hermanas sirenas cambia la situación y se la enseñan de que haya cuerpos de todos tipos y que se debe apreciar lo que tiene cada uno, es nuestra pequnita hero quien sale a tope. 

Este campaña, otra vez, busca el apoyo financiero del publico y nuestros aficionados para completar la publicación de este libro nuevo que intenta llena el necesidad de los leyedores cuyos intereses literarios son lo menos servido por la industria de libros infantiles. 

Algunos datos currentes:
Tendencias por contenido pertinente sobre y por los Americanos de herencia Africana.

  • La cifra total de titulos infantiles* de los años 2014 al 2016 ha quedado cerca unos 3,400 al 3,5000 per año,
  • Aunque Americanos de herencia Africanos representan un 12,5% de la populación Americana,
  • Libros infantiles escrito por Americanos de herencia Africano numeraron a solo un 3% de todo los libros desde 2015 at 2016, y 
  • Libros infantiles escrito sobre Americanos de herencia Africano alcanzó a solo 8% de todo los libros publicado durante el mismo periodo. 
  • La disparidad es claro!

*Todo los libros es definido como todos que eran submetido al CCBA al propósito de encuesta y el mantenimiento de un record.

Source: El Centro Cooperativo de Libros Infantiles (CCBC) es un centro biblioteca unica que enfoque en el estudio, la examinación y busqueda de la escuela de educación del Universidad de Wisconsin. 

Contando con los caracteres multiculturales mas nuevo de la "Colección de Libros de los Niños Cocoa" y la primera caracter femenina en el papel principal, “Lorena y el Espejo Magico de Mocha” incluye la Lorenita, quien es nombrado tras my hija del misma nombre. Es mi tercer libro infantil de ficción y mi primera proyecto como la ilustradora.

La ultima campana de publicar gano solo 11% de su meta financiera. Esta vez, por favor de reunir con nosotros, dar y annunciar a sus amigos y associados a toman parte de este iniciativo y ayudanos obtener 100% de lo que haciamos falta, $5,000. Su apoyo de este proyecto es muy importante. Hacerse usted un companiero nuestro en publicar! 

Cuando lo hace, recibire regalos** super cool, y nuestro agradecemiento por haber apoyado uno de los segmentos menos valorado en publicar – ninos de color y herencia Africano. 

Sea parte de la revolución!

Gracias,

Valerie Williams-Sanchez 

**Favor de notar regalos que contiene el nuevo libro no se pueden mandar hasta que el titulo esta printado y el proceso a publicar esta completado. Publicar puede tarder un minimo de tres meses.

story:
Short Summary

I have always been a writer, and now I am one step closer to being an author.

The Truth About Melissa: A Soul Mate Experiment is my debut novel and explores the idea of manifesting your soul mate. It is based on a true story of meeting and marrying a man who had penned my biography four years before meeting me. Her name was Melissa.

As Maya Angelou says, "There is no greater agony than bearing an untold story inside you." Thus, my commitment to completing this tale and moving towards publication. 

However, publication costs run high these days.

What I Need & What You Get

  • The basic set up fees that I am looking to raise total about $7,500. This covers a two-pass edit and proofreading over the next 3 months by a professional editor to ensure the cleanest final copy ($2500).  It also covers a professional formatting and cover design team ($2900), galleys, copyright fees, a filed ISBN number, promotion and marketing, a book launch, eBook formatting and uploading to Amazon, copies for reviewers, book reviews and professional guidance throughout the process (@$2000).
  • With your donation, you can opt for one of many perks depending on your contribution. Any amount helps and is greatly appreciated.

The Impact

Also, for each donor, I will Pay It Forward ($1/donor) to another Indie Author embarking on their debut publishing journey when my book is published. Authors Supporting Authors.

Risks & Challenges

I have taken on the challenge of completing and publishing my debut novel not without risk. I left my full-time secondary teaching career in a great leap of faith to pursue my dream of becoming an author. This is my initial step. I believe it will be the first of many.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute with a donation, it doesn't mean you can't help. Please help me to get the word out and share with your circle of influence and social media connections: Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Pinterest, personal email contacts. This is an opportunity for avid readers to be a part of the behind-the-scenes process of bringing a book to life. An opportunity to see The Truth About Melissa: A Soul Mate Experiment on a bookshelf one day and say, "Hey, I knew that book before it was famous!" :)

story:
Short Summary

  • Collective Worx, LLC is a small publishing company dedicated to helping writers achieve their publishing goals and promoting literacy.
  • This book is our first Koi Pond feature. We are excited to have our first physical book be something that the entire family can enjoy.  
  • With your help, we can get this book published and donate books to libraries across the country.

 

What We Need & What You Get

The budget breakdown:

  • Our campaign goal is $8,000.
  • Monies collected will be used to pay for:
    • Internal art
    • Securing ISBN numbers
    • Printing 
    • Shipping
    • Advertising costs
    • Miscellaneous production costs
  • Campaign Unique perks include 
    • Having the library of your choice receive a copy in your honor
    •  Having your name or organization listed in the special Thank You section of the book
    • Receiving a one of a kind manuscript of the book that includes a customized alternate ending designed by Alan Jason Vadell just for you.  
  • If we are unable to reach our goal, we will use whatever is collected to go towards creating the final product while working on another funding project. 

The Impact

 

  • This project will have a major impact on our ability to fund our other worx in progress and reach out to new writers and artists.
  • Collective Worx, LLC strives to make publishing accessible to all writers. 
  • We are hoping that the massive appeal of Time to Say Goodnight will translate into a highly successful publication for our company.
  • By helping us publish this book, you are also helping us publish new writers - share more stories - and increase literacy among all age groups.

Risks & Challenges

 

  • Many small companies lack the financial backing and manpower of their larger counterparts.  As a publishing company, Collective Worx is a small fish in a BIG ocean. 
  • We may not be able to offer our writers and artists large contracts like the leaders in our industry but we do have intuition, imagination, innovation and tenacity. 
  • This project will help us by paving the way for more resources for our writers. 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

  • You can follow us on social media!
    • Retweet @utsuriworx on Twitter
    • Pin UtsuriWorx on Pinterest
    • Follow collectiveworx on Instagram
    • Become a Patron of Collective Worx on Patreon
    • Subscribe to Worx In Progress on YouTube
    • and follow Utsuri's blog on www.collectiveworx.com 
  • And please use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
A l'annonce de ce projet sur FaceBook, vous avez été nombreux à vouloir me soutenir et c'est grâce à vous que je me suis lancée dans l'aventure du crowdfunding ! 

Alors, je vous dit : " Merci, le simple fait de créer et de mettre en place CECI est déjà une belle aventure, un travail sur moi même, mes objectifs avec tout ce que cela engage comme peurs & désirs, un défi , un dépassement.

  •  Humaine, femme, maman, épouse, starter, étudiante, professeur aimant la vie et l'étincelle en chaque humain. Durant plusieurs années j'ai cherché, à travers différentes formations une VOIE, la voie qui me permettrait d'englober toutes les facettes de notre être: physique, mentale, émotionnelle, physiologique, spirituelle; HOLISTIQUE. Le YOGA m'apporte, m'ouvre les portes à tout cela ! 

      "  soit le changement que tu veux voir dans le monde"

Mahatma Gandhi

  • Certains doivent se poser la question de: POURQUOI m'aider à concrétiser ce voyage en Inde ?

Sincèrement: si j'étais fortunée je ne solliciterai pas d'aide, ce crowdfunding est la seule solution actuelle de financement à la continuité de mon étude.

Cet été, grâce à une bourse, j'ai pu intégrer la 1ère formation européenne de Yogathérapie transmise par Kausthub Desikachar héritier de la lignée de T. Krishnamacharya et TKV Desikachar.

Cette formation holistique est une aventure de 3 ans et pour moi, dans la continuité des 4 premières années de formation de professeur de Yoga que j'ai suivie auprès de Frans Moors.

Et ceci n'est que le départ d'un parcours d'étude et de transmission, ceci est ma voie et mon chemin: recevoir & partager.  

J'ai donc décider de me consacrer à l'étude du Yoga et de quitter toute autre activité afin de vous transmettre au mieux, de vous apporter des moments de bien-être, et de vous initier à cette philosophie dans la liberté de recherche de chacun.

story:
PLEASE NOTE THAT WE HAVE RELAUNCHED OUR CAMPAIGN! 

The Contest and Other Stories, Phase II

THE STORY BEHIND THE STORY

The Contest and Other Stories, a connected collection of Young Adult and New Adult speculative fiction inspired by artwork (written by authors Joe DiBuduo and Kate Robinson and  edited by Starstone Lit Services) will be released Spring 2017 by Tootie-Do Press . The publication requires funding due to color inserts of well-known (and some not so well-known) paintings by international artists that inspired each story, and because of additional professional production costs. The volume will be available in full-color hardcover, full-color softcover, BW interior softcover, and in e-book formats.

THE NOVELLA

Peter John Rizzo, 1960 graduate of Yale University’s journalism program and an emerging creative writer, inherits Classic Art Exposé, an established but floundering art journal, from his uncle, John Rizzo.

Pete’s father, Peter Rizzo, is a banker who despises his late brother, scornful of his career in the Arts and Humanities, and jealous of his sibling’s influential relationship with his wife and son.

Jason, Uncle John’s devoted but unorthodox editorial assistant, and two local English student interns, sisters Shirley and Evie, help Pete start a monthly short story contest with artwork prompts, hoping to increase Classic Art Exposé’s readership and settle its debt.

As the four friends review and publish the winning short stories over the following eighteen months, Pete discovers a sordid family secret while he battles his father’s nefarious attempts to bankrupt his business and ruin his reputation.

THE STORIES & THE ARTWORK

"Night Café" - Le Café de Nuit - Vincent van Gogh, 1888

"Vasily" - The Bachelor Guitarist - Vasily Gregorivich Perov, 1865

"Hero" - The Accolade - Sir Edmund Blair Leighton, 1901

"Praise Neptune" - The Abduction of the Sabine Women - Nicolas Poussin, 1635

"The Conquistadors’ Surprise" - Emperor Charles V at Muhlberg - Titian, 1548

"Lost Memories" - The Gallery of H.M.S. Calcutta-Portsmouth - James Jacques Joseph Tissot, 1877

"The Snow Globe" - The Horse-Race - Jean-Louis Forain, 1890

"A Life in Flowers" - Le Chevalier aux Fleurs - Georges-Antoine Rochegrosse, 1894

"A Twisted Garden" - Jardin des Peupliers - Vincent van Gogh, 1889

"The Island" - New York Harbor - Alfred Thompson Bricher, 1877

"Nicor" - Morning by the Stream - T.C. Steele, 1893

"Masterpiece" - The Knife Grinder (Principle of Scintillation) - Kasimir Malevich, 1912

"Looking Out for Harry"-Avenue de Clichy: Five o’Clock - Louis Anquetin, 1887

"The Imposter" - Napoleon On Board the Bellerophon - Sir Wlm. Q. Orchardson, 1880

"Alone" - Snow at Louevciennes - Alfred Sisley, 1878

"Cheater" - The Cowboy - Frederick Remington, 1902

"Success" - Dance at Bougival - Pierre-Auguste Renoir, 1882

"The Jonah" - Y une place Animee a Paris - Joaquin Pallares Y Allustante, 1898

"Heaven or Hell?" - Dante & Virgil in Hell - William-Adolphe Bougereau, 1850

::~Acknowledgments~::  
 
“Cheater” first appeared in Western Weird, Volume 4, Manifest West Series, (Western Press Books - Western State Colorado University, 2015).
 
“Night Café” won the quarterly New Short Fiction Award (Jerry Jazz Musician, 2012).
 
“Lost Memories” first appeared in The Memory Eaters anthology (CP Anthologies, 2012).
 
“A Twisted Garden” first appeared as “The Yellow House” in Say Goodnight to the Bad Guy (May December Publications, 2011).
 
“The Snow Globe” first appeared in Best Served Cold: An Eye for an Eye (Runewright LLC, 2011).

REVIEWS

"'Yellow House' [now titled 'A Twisted Garden' ] - by Joe DiBuduo and Kate Robinson - Historical horror with a new spin on a complex artist. I was intrigued the way the writers tied the painting to the story." 

~ Chantal Boudreau, (Author, Nova Scotia), 2011, [Featured in Say Goodnight to the Bad Guy]

AUTHORS' BIOS

On a dull, cold day in February 2011,  authors Joe DiBuduo and Kate Robinson decided to have fun with some story collaborations. Joe sports the vivid imagination and Kate wields the detail toolbox and the word-whacking polish.

Separately, they've authored a variety of adult, young adult, middle-grade, and children’s fiction, nonfiction, and poetry in online and print journals and anthologies, including publications with Kearney Street Press, Southport Press, Rainstorm Press, Blood Bound Books, Elastic Press, Jerry Jazz Musician, Kaleidoscope, Literary Mama, Long Story Short, Raven Chronicles, The Whirlwind Review, June Cotner anthologies, Western Press Books, and others.

Joe DiBuduo is a retired housepainter with a wild bucket list. He also fills his front yard with giant sculptures, and earned a certificate in creative writing from Yavapai College in Prescott, Arizona (2009). Bookwise, he's the author of two mixed genre paranormal novels, The Mountain Will Cover You  & Cryonic Man: A Paranormal Affair (JD Books, 2016 and Tootie-Do Press, 2015); a connected collection of short stories: Story Time @ The Chicagoua Cafe (JD Books 2016), a historically relevant memoir, Death by Electric Chair & Other Boyhood Pursuits (Jaded Ibis Productions, 2015), a popular nonfiction narrative, A Penis Manologue: One Man's Response to The Vagina Monologues (JD Books, 2009, 2013), Out of This World Sci-fi Poetry (JD Books, 2010), a children's e-book, and miscellaneous collections of quirky flash fiction and “flash fiction poetry.”

Kate earned an MA in Creative Writing from Aberystwyth University, Wales (2010) and is the wordwhacking specialist at Starstone Lit Services and Tootie-Do Press near Los Angeles. Bookwise, she’s the author of a metaphysical sci-fi novel, Heart of Desire: 11.11.11 Redux (Tootie-Do Press, 2014), and two history books for middle-graders, The National Mall and Lewis and Clark: Exploring the American West (Enslow, Inc., 2005 and 2010). Loop, her MA program fantasy novella created entirely from dreams shortlisted in the Texas Review Press Novella competition in 2010, and was recently revised and updated while she enjoyed the lake district at the Arteles Creative Center during the November 2016 Silence Awareness Existence residency in Finland. Her work in progress also includes a memoir, nature essays, a poetry collection, retold folktales and picture book fiction. She's also dreaming up quirky sequels to her novel and novella, which she would love to write in a galaxy far away. She promises to dance always with paradox and absurdity.

THE PRESS

Tootie-Do Press publishes intelligent speculative fiction with a romantic twist. The Contest and Other Stories is the third press publication and first Young Adult / New Adult title!

Previous Tootie-Do Press publications are Heart of Desire: 11.11.11 Redux, a metaphysical sci-fi novel by Kate Robinson, and Cryonic Man: A Paranormal Affair, a mixed genre paranormal romance by Joe DiBuduo.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Have a minute and a few clicks to spare? We'd be grateful for any social media support for our fundraising campaign. Please tweet, blog, and share links to our campaign for The Contest and Other Stories. Share with #TheContest, #TootieDoPress, #YA (or other appropriate hashtag) at Twitter, Facebook, Pinterest, Tumblr, Google+, Instagram (or any social media platform serving authors and readers). Add The Contest to as a to-read on Goodreads after final publication! You can also use the buttons here on Indiegogo to share this fundraiser with your friends and contacts. When the book cover is complete in late July 2017, Indiegogo backers will get the first reveal.

And those of you who have pre-ordered the full-color early release PDF may share copies of it with family and friends. Please direct any interested readers to our fundraiser - some who read the PDF may also want to order print or e-book versions of The Contest & Other Stories.

Become an investor in our collective literary future!  9Bridges.org, a not-for-profit organization of writers helping writers, believes every voice matters.  In one of our current projects, we are creating an anthology of our members' best poetry.  We seek funding to defray  publication costs.


Quality publishing comes at a price.  As a volunteer organization providing support services free of charge, we need help in giving our members an audience for their voices.  In these days of continually shrinking federal and state funding, it is more important than ever for people who enjoy the literary arts to be generous with their financial support.  With your help in bringing our writers' dreams to fruition, we can inspire minds and touch hearts together.


Writing is a solitary art, but writers need not exist in solitude.  Alone, we can only do so much to help dedicated writers master their craft.  With your financial accompaniment, we change people's lives and so too the world.

story:
After writing my first children's book, Tinko, I knew that the world needed to hear one of the most poetic stories of the bible. Beautiful Name is about God's love for us explored through the eyes of a spunky, imaginative girl, Mo (Tinko's sister), who asks God about what his name is and what it means.  It is decorated with amazing illustrations by Maheen Sana that seek to inspire parents and children alike.

"The illustrations are fanciful...the writing is calming & soothing,"

--The Children's Book Review

After a year of word and illustration development, I couldn't be more excited to bring this beautifully produced children's book to life. Your investment will not only earn you a tangible item, it will be used to create a high-quality, hardcover book. The story deserves that craftsmanship and durability. 

"A simple message we can all share," The Slanted

Outside of my promise of quality and inspiration is my commitment to keep in touch with you throughout this ride. Over the past year, I have had the privilege of visiting schools and stores to speak to children and parents. There is one I have learned that people can't hear enough of, and that is, that they have been created with a great purpose by a God who is Crazy About Them!  

Thanks for helping to make this story come to life.

Take a look at each of the Perks you can invest in on the right-hand side of the page. 

"Tinko uses beautiful words to deliver a beautiful message," 

--Jim DeFilippi, author of Mules of Monte Casino and Merka

story:
Hi everyone!

 

My name is Savelev Vladimir. In 2016, I wrote a book called “Stats in Cats”. Many students find statistics to be frightening, so I tried to describe the basics of data analysis in a simple way and illustrated everything with examples from the lives of cute, fluffy cats.

 

The book was as great success - I managed to publish two editions with the money gained from crowdfunding. The third edition was supported by the AST publishing house and became a bestseller in Russian online stores. The 4th edition is currently in progress.

 

Recently, Polina Krivykh offered to translate “Stats in Cats” into English. She’s a popular science lecturer of the Evolution Fund, a young scientist, and an experienced translator. She’s translated such works as Campbell Biology ch.51, Cognitive-Behavioral Therapy in Groups, and the Atlas of Functional Neuroanatomy.

 

We want to finish this translation by the end of May, because Polina is currently an exchange student at the  University of Helsinki. Therefore, as the translation progresses,  she’ll have a chance to show it to international students there and receive feedback. This feedback will help us determine how to edit the book so that English speakers can better understand it.

 

So, to support our work, we are starting this crowdfunding company! The money will be spent on salaries of the translator and editor. We will be happy to provide every sponsor with a free electronic copy of the book.

See for yourself how easy and funny statistics can be!

 

You can read the first chapter here.
story_txt:
Hi everyone! My name is Savelev Vladimir. In 2016, I wrote a book called “Stats in Cats”. Many students find statistics to be frightening, so I tried to describe the basics of data analysis in a simple way and illustrated everything with examples from the lives of cute, fluffy cats. The book was as great success - I managed to publish two editions with the money gained from crowdfunding. The third edition was supported by the AST publishing house and became a bestseller in Russian online stores. The 4th edition is currently in progress. Recently, Polina Krivykh offered to translate “Stats in Cats” into English. She’s a popular science lecturer of the Evolution Fund, a young scientist, and an experienced translator. She’s translated such works as Campbell Biology ch.51, Cognitive-Behavioral Therapy in Groups, and the Atlas of Functional Neuroanatomy. We want to finish this translation by the end of May, because Polina is currently an exchange student at the  University of Helsinki. Therefore, as the translation progresses,  she’ll have a chance to show it to international students there and receive feedback. This feedback will help us determine how to edit the book so that English speakers can better understand it. So, to support our work, we are starting this crowdfunding company! The money will be spent on salaries of the translator and editor. We will be happy to provide every sponsor with a free electronic copy of the book.
See for yourself how easy and funny statistics can be! You can read the first chapter here.

story:
Welcome to the world of John T. Draper, better known as Captain Crunch, the original "Phone Phreak". From his early days of facing off against Ma Bell to his current role in public speaking and privacy advocacy, it’s hard to overstate his impact on the world of technology. Along the way, he developed some of the most influential tools of the computer revolution, from the first working word processor in the seventies to the first effective firewall in the nineties. The road hasn’t always been smooth, however, and for every success there have been setbacks and hurdles of literary proportion. Let’s just call it Draperism. 

This "warts and all" biography features Draper's own telling of stories from the past fifty years, as well as commentary and other memories from his long-time friend and collaborator. It is the story of an eccentric genius who went from being a penniless hacker to a millionaire and back again, a man so consumed by his vision that the real world around him has always played second fiddle. Featuring a foreword by Apple co-founder Steve Wozniak and cameos by the who’s who of early computing, this Kerouacian journey gives us an inside look at the birth of modern computing through the eyes of one of its most influential pioneers.

We are keeping this as simple as possible. Six tiers of backer support with six simple reward packages. There is a support level for every budget.

Pledge $15 for the 2600 perk, and you get an eBook, which will be sent out the day after campaign ends and you make final verifications. If you go for the second level perk at $25, you’re basically pre-ordering a first-edition signed paperback copy of the book.

All rewards already have domestic US shipping included. Worldwide shipping will be calculated upon checkout.

$25 each. Available here.

For those of you who don’t know who Mr Draper is: John Thomas Draper (aka Captain Crunch) was an early pioneering developer at Apple Computer, in the mid to late 1970s. Among other things he developed the 'Charlie Board', an early version of a PC modem predating the DC Hayes modem. He also wrote the first word processing program, EasyWriter, for the Apple II and beat Bill Gates to the punch when it was bundled with the first IBM PC.

In the decades that followed Mr Draper worked with various notable people. In the 1980's he worked on Advanced 3-D Graphic Design Systems at Autodesk. In the 1990's he developed a revolutionary computer security system, considered un-hackable at the time.

Before all of that, he was an outlaw. In the early 1970's he was one of the 'Phone Phreaks', a group of enthusiasts who found various ways to hack the phone company and get free calls. Mr Draper became the most infamous member, and taught a lot of other people what he knew. He introduced Steve Wozniak and Steve Jobs to the ‘Blue Box’, the device he used to perform some of his crimes. Steve Jobs is quoted as saying that without the Blue Box, there would be no Apple Computer. Mr Draper was hunted by the FBI for years, and went to prison three times.

In the last decade he has toured the world, telling his story, and speaking publicly about security flaws in telecommunications, online privacy, and encryption.
 

The Narrative

This book recounts stories from my years of knowing John T. Draper personally, interspersed with collected memories from his friends and relatives, and John’s personal history in his own words. It spans his 74 years on the planet, and my 22 years of knowing him.

I have been John's roommate several times, business partner, and close friend over the years. I have always considered him a very interesting case for character study, and an unfathomable wealth of complexities and paradoxes.

I hope to have portrayed him in an honest but affectionate light. A balanced portrait of the incredible story that is his life.

- Craig Wilson Fraser

John T. Draper & Craig Wilson Fraser, Spain, 2015


The Foreword

The foreword to the biography was written by renowned inventor, electronics engineer and programmer Steve Wozniak. Mr Wozniak, along with Steve Jobs, co-founded Apple Computer. Mr Wozniak has worked with Mr Draper a few times over the years, and has remained a long standing friend and ally.

John T. Draper & Steve Wozniak, 2004


The Excerpts
 

Childhood anecdote by brother, Ron Draper

There was this ‘mom and pop’ super market at the end of Edith St. in Petaluma, called 'The A & B market'. It had light bulbs and licorice. John wanted bulbs. PR-2’s, PR-4 flashlight bulbs, and batteries, but as usual we had no money. Our mom would not concede to John’s wishes this time (these 'wishes' turned into outright demands when he became a teen), so we resorted to theft.

I can honestly say it wasn’t my idea. We had never stolen anything up to this point. I think I was blackmailed actually, but my dim memories don’t have the details. We thought we would use my calm demeanor and appointed me to actually steal most of the stuff. So, I was the one caught by the store manager as we were walking out.

We were asked to empty our pockets. I don’t remember what John had, but my pockets were loaded. I mean really loaded. 110v light bulbs, Christmas tree light bulbs, flashlight bulbs, AA batteries for my pen light (well, I thought, while I’m at it). I remember the store clerk adding up all the charges and it came to quite an amount.

John and the Phone Phreaks

I got a phone call from someone calling himself Denny San Jose, who told me he knew about various methods of making free phone calls. He also said there was this whistle that blew the magic tone that disconnects long distance calls, and that he had a spare. He asked me if I could drive him to San Francisco so he could show me how it worked.

---

I began to realise there was more to these guys than I first thought. They were a connected and organized group, and seemed to be inviting me to join. When the discussion got around to our trip to Burlingame, we talked about what my ‘handle’ should be. Most people had just chosen their first name and city, like ‘Denny San Jose’ or ‘Bill from New York’. Well, ‘John San Jose’ was already taken, so I said ‘how about Captain Crunch?’

The first bust

I suspected the FBI knew about me even before the Esquire article was released, but I had no idea how much they wanted to collar me. Up to that point all they had was the name Captain Crunch, but no way of finding out who I actually was. Most of the blind kids didn't know my phone number, and those who did had no need to write it down, but of course eventually I made the mistake of giving my number to the wrong person.

---

I made sure that I had removed all of my 'forbidden equipment' from my car, and stashed it in my gym locker. I took a non-working Blue Box out of my locker to take home and fix, put it in the back of my car then started the drive home. I stopped at a 7-11 to get a soda. I parked in a small parking lot next to a middle school, and just as I got out of the car, four FBI agents swooped down on me, handcuffed me, and read me my rights.

Lompoc Prison

In the 70's and 80's, they called Lompoc a Country Club. It was even home to Nixon's sleazy Watergate lawyer for a while, as well as many other celebrity prisoners. Contrary to popular lore however, it did not have a swimming pool, but it did have a nice gym, tennis courts, and Volleyball courts. I’m not sure that it still has those facilities these days. Apparently the whole place was turned into a medium security prison in the 90s, with proper fences and razor wire.

---

After a few weeks I was promoted to landscaping. It mainly consisted of cleaning. My supervisor was a guy named Easton. I used to watch this guy while I was outside cleaning his windows. He had this habit of sucking on his walkie-talkie 'rubber duck' antenna. I'd giggle as I imagined him as a suckling baby pig, wiggling his ears in pure bliss. One day I was in his office emptying his trash bin, and he got called out of his office. I couldn't believe he left me in there. I went looking through his files, but didn't find anything of much worth, then I checked out his phone to see if I could access anything outside of the prison.

John Thomas Draper - Co-author

Mr Draper is a computer pioneer, privacy advocate, and public speaker. He rose to prominence in the early phone phreaking movement of the 1970's before working on some of the most ground-breaking projects of the emerging computer era. He has lived in several US states and travelled extensively, often for months at a time. He currently lives in Las Vegas, Nevada, and is involved with various projects concerning privacy, piracy, and security.

Craig Wilson Fraser - Co-author and editor

Mr Fraser is an author, artist and graphic designer. He has been close friends with Mr Draper for twenty five years, and they have shared many an adventure. Originally from the United Kingdom, he spent several years in the United States and currently lives with his family in southern Spain.

Your money will be spent completing your orders, creating new exclusive merchandise for this campaign and to ship your rewards to you.


 

Reward Fulfilment, Project Timeline, & Shipping
 

We learned a lot from our kickstarter campaign and we are keeping this simple.

Ebooks will be sent out as soon as the campaign ends and you have completed all necessary verifications to finalize your support.

We are fulfilling ourselves this time, and we will start shipping out, in alphabetical order, as you complete verification of support levels within two weeks of the campaign ending.  Most items are already in the warehouse, giving us the unique opportunity to fufill most level immediately.

DOMESTIC SHIPPING:

Included in all levels. We will use either USPS or UPS and each order will have a tracking number.

INTERNATIONAL SHIPPING:

There will be a charge calculated by Indiegogo upon final check out. Any taxes or VAT or freight charges on large orders will be your responsibility.

All rewards will be shipped using USPS as the carrier, sent Priority Mail, will arrive within 6-10 business days, no tracking number or insurance provided.

REFUNDS, RETURNS, WARRANTY

We do not offer refunds or returns on any items that are received as a reward.  However, we will address concerns on a case by case basis, as your satisfaction is important to us.  We know you understand.

story:
__________

"What are you giggling about?"
"I just had an idea of writing a story about a slightly clumsy elephant with a not-so-great memory...a forgetful elephant.'

          It was winter 2016 and the 1st seed of what would fatefully become 'Oopsie' Daisy, the forgetful elephant had been planted.  The first steps however occurred long before that, in 2014, as artist/creator LaLita Olivia King, and her husband and co-creator/writer Steven A. King awaited the arrival of their first child.  It was then that Steven dreamed up an idea and wrote the first draft of a story to be illustrated by his wife that would retell their courtship as a gift to one day be presented to their future children.  That endeavor sparked a realization that creating illustrated books aimed at children together was a perfect blend of their passions and love. 

          Oopsie Daisy is a lovably adorable, clumsy, and forgetful, toddler elephant, who is loved by her parents no matter what she does.  The character of 'Oopsie' Daisy and the very first story of her adventures was partially inspired by Aurora, the King's own daughter.  When she, as most energetic, intelligent, children of two years of age do, was spilling, dropping, and soiling everything in sight, it was important to consciously make an effort to let her know that we all make mistakes and have little accidents every now and then...that it not only was not her fault, but that these things are a part of life; of how we learn and grow as human beings.  "Our Perfect Little Child' is in part the physical representation of that effort.

6x9 Format 36 Pages (16 Illustrations)

           

          Out of their experience as first time parents, was borne the idea of using the character of Oopsie Daisy to relay stories for small children and parents concerning life as a family along with  other valuable lessons such as compassion, good manners, safety, and caring for our communities and the environment.  That last point is also why a charitable component that benefits the aid and rescue of elephants will be a part of every book produced under the King Family books banner with a portion of each sale in the 'Oopsie' Daisy series specifically being donated to the Wildlife Friends Foundation of Thailand (WFFT).  To that end, FIFTY CENTS of each softcover and ONE DOLLAR of each hardcover sold will be donated to the Thai Elephant rescue arm of the WFFT.

__________

          We all need to receive the message of love of self and unconditional love for others--and the earlier we receive it, the better!  Hence, these are common threads sewn throughout the Oopsie Daisy book series.  The benefits of these messages for parents and children alike have been witnessed firsthand by the Kings as their daughter, Aurora, now three years of age, has listened to "Our Perfect Little Child," and other stories being crafted in the series, for the past year.

  

          We are mindful to include messages and helpful tips for children and parents alike as we craft each story in the Oopsie Daisy series.  Our planned follow-up, The Bedtime List (already completed by the way) contains messages of love and patience, while being chock full of tips on how to ensure that bedtime is a relaxing experience rather than a chore or battle with the kids.  Stories centered around etiquette, the importance of good manners, respect for others and the environment are some of the other completed stories we will be delivering to you over the next year.

Completed images of Oopsie Daisy in her 2nd book "The Bedtime List"

__________

          The creation of "Our Perfect Little Child" is truly a self-publishing venture from beginning to end.  Not a single thing except for the eventual creation of the physical books has been outsourced.  The writing, art, layout, formatting, cover, promotional website, campaign has all been painstakingly executed by LaLita Olivia & Steven A. King.  Special thanks to all those creators who have freely shared their knowledge via web tutorials and internet forums/videos of how to format books and utilize programs such as Adobe Indesign, Photoshop and more. What does this mean?  It means the cost of each book and perk is not ridiculously inflated or full of bloat.

__________

The perks we are offering our backers are both truly unique and opportunities for investment.

Some of those perks include: 

  • one of a kind original art used in the creation of Our Perfect Little Child (a perk we very well expect to far exceed their costs one day)
  • prints of the original art from the book
  • personalized signatures and hand drawn original sketches by the artist 

AND MORE...

          Each and every one of our supporters who decide to embark on the King Family Books venture by putting their money behind this launch campaign are guaranteed to receive whatever is promised them in their package purchase.

__________

          While a look at the website, A Mighty Girl, a database of empowering children’s fiction started by Carolyn Danckaert and her partner reveals nearly 3,000 books in which girls are the central characters, recent studies suggest that number is appallingly low when compared to books featuring male characters.  

          A 2011 Florida State University study found that just 7.5 percent of nearly 6,000 picture books published between 1900 and 2000 depict female animal protagonists; male animals were the central characters in more than 23 percent each year.  Another 2011 study by Janice McCabe, at Dartmouth College, also found a huge gender imbalance with male characters playing a central role in 57% of children’s books compared to female characters being featured in a central role in only 31% of children's books.  While making the star of our series a female character was an organic decision, these studies and a lack of easily accessible stories crafted around female protagonists across reinforced that decision.   We're overjoyed to present our fun little girl, Daisy, to the world, and to not only do our part to add to the new wave of books helping to close the  gap in gender representation found in children's books.

          Additionally, as caring parents concerned with the well being of all creatures and the state of the world which we are leaving for our children, having chosen an elephant as the star of our tales, we had a strong desire to help real life elephants in their struggle to live peacefully in the wild.  Therefore, to reiterate, a portion of all book profits--FIFTY CENTS of each softcover and ONE DOLLAR of each hardcover sold--will go to Thai Elephant Refuge organization, a non-profit involved with actively helping to ease that struggle.  The Elephant Refuge is a sanctuary located about 160 kilometers southwest of Bangkok.  Authorities believe that nearly 97% of all Thai elephants at this point are gone from the face of the Earth.  We urge anyone concerned with the well being of elephants and with all wildlife to visit their website or facebook page in order to learn more.

__________

The Team

 

LALITA OLIVIA KING is an artist, illustrator and creator with a BFA from Parsons School of Design.  Her work has been featured in galleries in both the United States and Puerto Rico, as well as local and national publications such as ‘Mugshot’ and ‘Instyle.’  Having launched a successful business in 2014 focused around hand-painted clothing for babies, toddlers, and adults, as well as fine art paintings, under the name ByLaLita, as that has been placed on the back burner, she prepares to see even greater success as a children's book author and illustrator.

 

__________

 

You can help us in many different ways

One of the best ways you could lend a hand in making this campaign a rousing success, is talk about us and this project on your Facebook page, Twitter, and/or Instagram. Share our updates and point us to the friends you think may be interested in this project.  Not only does it not cost you anything, but soon, you can earn rewards by doing so using the official IndieGoGo share tools.

Please be a part of our community.  It means everything to us -- we seriously cannot do it without you.

We promise...

To update you.
To listen to your input and feedback.
To prioritize addressing any questions or concerns throughout the campaign through to delivery.
To provide you with exceptional customer service.
story_txt:
__________

"What are you giggling about?""I just had an idea of writing a story about a slightly clumsy elephant with a not-so-great memory...a forgetful elephant.'
          It was winter 2016 and the 1st seed of what would fatefully become 'Oopsie' Daisy, the forgetful elephant had been planted.  The first steps however occurred long before that, in 2014, as artist/creator LaLita Olivia King, and her husband and co-creator/writer Steven A. King awaited the arrival of their first child.  It was then that Steven dreamed up an idea and wrote the first draft of a story to be illustrated by his wife that would retell their courtship as a gift to one day be presented to their future children.  That endeavor sparked a realization that creating illustrated books aimed at children together was a perfect blend of their passions and love. 

          Oopsie Daisy is a lovably adorable, clumsy, and forgetful, toddler elephant, who is loved by her parents no matter what she does.  The character of 'Oopsie' Daisy and the very first story of her adventures was partially inspired by Aurora, the King's own daughter.  When she, as most energetic, intelligent, children of two years of age do, was spilling, dropping, and soiling everything in sight, it was important to consciously make an effort to let her know that we all make mistakes and have little accidents every now and then...that it not only was not her fault, but that these things are a part of life; of how we learn and grow as human beings.  "Our Perfect Little Child' is in part the physical representation of that effort.

6x9 Format 36 Pages (16 Illustrations)
            

          Out of their experience as first time parents, was borne the idea of using the character of Oopsie Daisy to relay stories for small children and parents concerning life as a family along with  other valuable lessons such as compassion, good manners, safety, and caring for our communities and the environment.  That last point is also why a charitable component that benefits the aid and rescue of elephants will be a part of every book produced under the King Family books banner with a portion of each sale in the 'Oopsie' Daisy series specifically being donated to the Wildlife Friends Foundation of Thailand (WFFT).  To that end, FIFTY CENTS of each softcover and ONE DOLLAR of each hardcover sold will be donated to the Thai Elephant rescue arm of the WFFT.

__________

          We all need to receive the message of love of self and unconditional love for others--and the earlier we receive it, the better!  Hence, these are common threads sewn throughout the Oopsie Daisy book series.  The benefits of these messages for parents and children alike have been witnessed firsthand by the Kings as their daughter, Aurora, now three years of age, has listened to "Our Perfect Little Child," and other stories being crafted in the series, for the past year.
  
          We are mindful to include messages and helpful tips for children and parents alike as we craft each story in the Oopsie Daisy series.  Our planned follow-up, The Bedtime List (already completed by the way) contains messages of love and patience, while being chock full of tips on how to ensure that bedtime is a relaxing experience rather than a chore or battle with the kids.  Stories centered around etiquette, the importance of good manners, respect for others and the environment are some of the other completed stories we will be delivering to you over the next year.Completed images of Oopsie Daisy in her 2nd book "The Bedtime List"__________          The creation of "Our Perfect Little Child" is truly a self-publishing venture from beginning to end.  Not a single thing except for the eventual creation of the physical books has been outsourced.  The writing, art, layout, formatting, cover, promotional website, campaign has all been painstakingly executed by LaLita Olivia & Steven A. King.  Special thanks to all those creators who have freely shared their knowledge via web tutorials and internet forums/videos of how to format books and utilize programs such as Adobe Indesign, Photoshop and more. What does this mean?  It means the cost of each book and perk is not ridiculously inflated or full of bloat.__________The perks we are offering our backers are both truly unique and opportunities for investment.Some of those perks include: 
one of a kind original art used in the creation of Our Perfect Little Child (a perk we very well expect to far exceed their costs one day)
prints of the original art from the book
personalized signatures and hand drawn original sketches by the artist 
AND MORE...          Each and every one of our supporters who decide to embark on the King Family Books venture by putting their money behind this launch campaign are guaranteed to receive whatever is promised them in their package purchase.__________

          While a look at the website, A Mighty Girl, a database of empowering children’s fiction started by Carolyn Danckaert and her partner reveals nearly 3,000 books in which girls are the central characters, recent studies suggest that number is appallingly low when compared to books featuring male characters.  
          A 2011 Florida State University study found that just 7.5 percent of nearly 6,000 picture books published between 1900 and 2000 depict female animal protagonists; male animals were the central characters in more than 23 percent each year.  Another 2011 study by Janice McCabe, at Dartmouth College, also found a huge gender imbalance with male characters playing a central role in 57% of children’s books compared to female characters being featured in a central role in only 31% of children's books.  While making the star of our series a female character was an organic decision, these studies and a lack of easily accessible stories crafted around female protagonists across reinforced that decision.   We're overjoyed to present our fun little girl, Daisy, to the world, and to not only do our part to add to the new wave of books helping to close the  gap in gender representation found in children's books.
          Additionally, as caring parents concerned with the well being of all creatures and the state of the world which we are leaving for our children, having chosen an elephant as the star of our tales, we had a strong desire to help real life elephants in their struggle to live peacefully in the wild.  Therefore, to reiterate, a portion of all book profits--FIFTY CENTS of each softcover and ONE DOLLAR of each hardcover sold--will go to Thai Elephant Refuge organization, a non-profit involved with actively helping to ease that struggle.  The Elephant Refuge is a sanctuary located about 160 kilometers southwest of Bangkok.  Authorities believe that nearly 97% of all Thai elephants at this point are gone from the face of the Earth.  We urge anyone concerned with the well being of elephants and with all wildlife to visit their website or facebook page in order to learn more.
__________
The Team
 

LALITA OLIVIA KING is an artist, illustrator and creator with a BFA from Parsons School of Design.  Her work has been featured in galleries in both the United States and Puerto Rico, as well as local and national publications such as ‘Mugshot’ and ‘Instyle.’  Having launched a successful business in 2014 focused around hand-painted clothing for babies, toddlers, and adults, as well as fine art paintings, under the name ByLaLita, as that has been placed on the back burner, she prepares to see even greater success as a children's book author and illustrator.
