story:
New Perk 


I am proud to present  you my new perk  - my poem Those Hours. I also remind you, that you can enjoy me works which will be on my first book free until the end of the campaign  - https://www.dropbox.com/sh/vram69ei61mcg44/AACPT_BD41AonZ7hxXKlnU4-a?dl=0 .

 Introduction  

       Hello everyone! As I have mentioned my name is Stoyko Rusev and I have been a writer for a while now. In the next few lines I will give you some more details about my work until now and my plans for the future.

The main goal of my campaign is to show my first book Blades and Vicious Smiles to the world and gather money for the translation and editing of the first 46 pages of my comic fantasy novel The Pyramid: A Prophecy and my anti-utopian short stories based on diseases. For me it is very important to receive feedback for my novel at this early stage of the creation process, so I can upgrade it and eventually fulfill my dream to continue the legacy of Terry Pratchett’s and Douglas Adams’ work.

The other project that I want to create is about my anti-utopian short stories, and the main reason I want to bring them to the world is because they, in my opinion, are a unique interpretation of our world and have the potential to become a new branch of a very meaningful genre in literature.

Your help will allow me show my projects to the world and continue making good and meaningful works.


Where will your money go?


I will give you a brief description of the expenses for which your donations will go:

1)  Translation – The translation of the first 46 pages of my comic fantasy novel and of my  anti-utopian short stories (11 pages) will cost me 786$ (152$ for the short stories and 634$ for the novel.)

2)  Editing – Their editing will cost me 114$ (22$ for the short stories and 92$ for the novel.)

3)  Fees – A 4% indiegogo fee (40$ approximately),  3,5% (35 $ approximately) for Paypal fees, 25$ single fee for the transfer of the donated founds from credit cards to my bank account after the end of the campaign.


 Perks!


I am giving my first book Blades and Vicious smiles away trough the campaign. I want everyone to be able to see what I am capable of and then decide if they wants to be a part my dream.

If I complete my goal everyone will be able to enjoy and download my works for 2 months.

I have a vision that every supporter should get a reward for his help and I would implement it in my perks. I have observed many indiegogo campaigns and I decided to make a little change in the system, so in my perks you will see two differences:

1)  I have a perks for every 10% progress of my goal to all people who had given me their support.

2)  If my campaign reaches it’s goal I will upload my works for 60 days on my dropbox so everyone will be able to enjoy them, not only the big contributors.


When will I be able to deliver perks?


1)  I will need 5 to 7 days to send the “introduction to the universe” perk.

2)  For the “recite a miniature for you” perk I will need 10 days to be able to give you the best experience possible and your choice of a miniature.

3)  For the unique short story for you I will need 10-15 days depending on how fast my translator and editor will be able to do their job.

4)  The collective perk “thank you for your support” will be delivered 3 days after the first vote, one day for the gathering of your votes and 2 days for my preparation for each  perk performance.

If I reach my goal I will upload the promised works in 30 days after the end of the campaign.

If I reach it earlier I will give my best to provide the works as fast as I can.

 After I finish the novel and if the anti-utopias develop into novellas or a novel, I will upload them for free in Amazon for the first week after I self-publish them.

 

  When will I be able to deliver the perks and what will I be able to deliver if my campaign doesn’t reach it’s goal?

 

If I don’t reach my goal I will do my best to give back to you as much as possible, for example for approximately 32$ I will be able to translate and edit one of my short stories and upload it (for 174$ I will be able upload all of my  anti-utopian short stories). Beyond that mark I will be able to deliver you a page for approximately every 16$.

Other goals I think I can achieve with my works:

I believe with my work I will not only be able to show my work to the world, but inspire many other writers to give their works a chance and follow my example showing them to the world. I have also ideas to help other writers show their work to the world if I my campaign is successful.

I also want to be one of the reasons for more young adults to grow a passion for reading.


Future plans


After the end of the campaign I will start sending my works to literature magazines and publishing houses. I will also self-publish Blades and Vicious Smiles in Amazon.

I will give my best to make the villain in my novel as consistent as possible with modern physics and my anti-utopian short stories feasible regarding the real diseases which had inspired them, because I want to deliver a realistic reading experience.


Other ways to help me


If you want to contribute, but don’t have the resources, don’t worry, you can spread the word about my campaign, or just share with me what had touched you, or which feeling I had described best and how you felt understood after reading some of my works. You can also vote for the collective perks for every 10% achieved of my goal and share why exactly do you want me to recite a poem and what is its meaning for you. You can also share my campaign with your family and friends.

story:
The pitch...

My name is Matt Herring (or Matman to my friends) and I'm the co-host of the long running Secret Identity Podcast, a weekly show that covers the world of comic books, gaming, movies, television and music.  

Last year I released my third book, THE UNOFFICIAL DOCTOR WHO COMPANION and have had an incredibly busy and fruitful 2014.  As I planned my next project I found myself thinking about Sea Monkeys, my awesome childhood and the fun of living and learning in small town, USA.

The story deals with life in 1978 when Sea Monkeys rise up from the depths and begin to take over the world.  Only a ten year old Matt Herring; with the help of friends and items found in the back of comic books can save the world!

story:
Thanks for joining me and taking a look at The Menu:  An Alcrest Mystery.  

My name is Lorne Oliver and I'm proud to say I'm an Indie Author.  Mysteries have always been what I go back to and are what I want to read and write.  

I have 2 novels out there in my Sgt. Reid Series - Red Island and Red Serge.  Both were written with a lot of help from RCMP officers to get the facts right.  These are Canadian thrillers about Canadian heros.

The Cistern is the first novel in The Alcrest Mysteries.  It puts my love of mysteries together with my career of working as a chef in restaurants.  

As an author you often feel like you are alone in your own little world, so it is amazing to have this forum to reach out and find other people who are interested in taking a walk on your side of the fence.  None of my books would have ever come to light without the help of family, friends and fans of my writing.


THE MENU - What's the book about?

Chrys and Spencer are asked to find a former foster child, Luke Weston, a young man who basically seemed to have walked off the earth.  When the body of a young woman is found beaten to death in an alley Luke’s secret life comes to the surface.  A young man who always thought he should have been a woman.  Chrys will not stop until she finds out who ended his life and why.  Hate groups, drag queens, terrorists, gang-bangers and the Irish Mafia...she will challenge them all as her brother tries to save the family business.


What I Need & What You Get

I am a writer.  I'm not a graphic designer or editor, publisher or promoter.  I come up with the ideas and I write.  Okay, to be honest  I come up with the ideas and then the characters and story take me on a journey, but in the final product I am still listed as author.

Editing costs money and being a dad of 2 teenagers I don't have as much as I would like.  I've been getting by on my other books, but the time has come to not just get by.

Everyone tells you as you grow up not to judge a book by its cover.  We all do it though and lets face it, whether buying an ebook or picking up a novel in a store, the cover is the first thing we see and a good percentage of how we decide what we want.  If it doesn't look professional we are probably going to the next book on the shelf.  Yes, graphic artists have made my other 3 covers, but again there comes a time when you have to start paying for that professional job.

Finally, after the story is written...all of the typos are gone...the cover is amazing....comes the printing and marketing.  I'll be honest - I don't know if the $1000 I'm hoping to raise will even get that far.  I just want to write a damn good novel and get it out there.  

What do you get???

Hugs and kisses!  Not good enough?  What about pens and bookmarks?  Signed paperbacks?  We're talking all of my books baby.  What about naming a character? I have named many a character after people I know and love.  There are also exclusive hats and aprons. 



The Alcrest Mysteries

The Alcrest Mysteries is a mystery novel series that takes place in the Canadian city of Middleton (which is basically a compilation of everywhere I have ever lived across this great country)  Spencer Alcrest, owner and chef of The Alcrest Gastropub, and his foster sister Chrys Alcrest find themselves involved in a lot of mysteries.

Chrys Alcrest - A beautiful young Native-Canadian.  Her mother disappeared when she was only 3, but Chrys was lucky to be taken in by a wonderful foster-family who raised her as their own and she was honoured to take their last name.  She can be a little wild and free-spirited.  She's the type who will jump in first and deal with the consequences later. - The picture below is Chrys Alcrest as depicted by PEI artist Jackie VanderZwaag and the actress Elizabeth Frances the inspiration for the character.

Spencer Alcrest - Unlike his younger foster-sister (he never uses the foster) Spencer is more focused and often thinks things through.  He is the owner and executive chef at The Alcrest Gastropub (formerly The Alcrest Pub when his parents owned it). - The picture below is a drawing of Spencer Alcrest by PEI artist Jackie VanderZwaag

The Alcrest Gastropub - Being a professional chef myself I have to include the restaurant as a main character.  Spencer and Chrys live upstairs with their 2 dogs and with him as the chef and she serving tables (when she can't find any other way to avoid work) things can get tense between them.  The restaurant is unique in that the kitchen is actually in the dining room.  The Alcrest's have always been huge supporters of local artists, so there is a stage for singer/songwriters to showcase their talent, local works of art hang on the wall and groups including a writing one use The Alcrest as a meeting area.  This would be my dream restaurant.  The fact that mysteries always seem to find their way there is just bonus.

The Alcrest Gastropub hat and Apron (When I am cooking you never know who(what) is on The Menu)

The Cistern

The Cistern is the first book in The Alcrest Mystery series.  I personally like to think of this and my other series as individual novels that happen to have the same characters who's lives grow and evolve from one book to the next.

In The Cistern Chrys pulls her brother along to clean-out a house that has been abandoned for a year after the bank took it back from the previous owners.  What they find in the basement puts them into a race of life and death.  The only question is - who's death.

It has received some great reviews so far.

5 stars - I bought this yesterday and read it non-stop...This book has everything that a mystery/thriller should; heart-pounding fear, mystery, intrigue, deception...

5 stars - loved this book.  Started off fast and didn't slow don until the end!

5 stars - Oliver drove me nuts with the way he kept me freaked out and enthralled...Throw in a good cast, clues and threads leading somewhere, or nowhere, and some interesting behind the scenes look at restaurants and chefs made this a book that caused me to disregard other duties just because I couldn't quit it...Get this book.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can contribute a little something SHINY!!  If you can't please tell your friends about it.  Go on social media and share like everyone needs to see it or else!

And of course Thank You for the support and help.

The Alcrest Gastropub - Being a professional chef myself I have to include the restaurant as a main character.  Spencer and Chrys live upstairs with their 2 dogs and with him as the chef and she serving tables (when she can't find any other way to avoid work) things can get tense between them.  The restaurant is unique in that the kitchen is actually in the dining room.  The Alcrest's have always been huge supporters of local artists, so there is a stage for singer/songwriters to showcase their talent, local works of art hang on the wall and groups including a writing one use The Alcrest as a meeting area.  This would be my dream restaurant.  The fact that mysteries always seem to find their way there is just bonus.

The Alcrest Gastropub hat and Apron (When I am cooking you never know who(what) is on The Menu)  
The Cistern
The Cistern is the first book in The Alcrest Mystery series.  I personally like to think of this and my other series as individual novels that happen to have the same characters who's lives grow and evolve from one book to the next.
In The Cistern Chrys pulls her brother along to clean-out a house that has been abandoned for a year after the bank took it back from the previous owners.  What they find in the basement puts them into a race of life and death.  The only question is - who's death.
It has received some great reviews so far.
5 stars - I bought this yesterday and read it non-stop...This book has everything that a mystery/thriller should; heart-pounding fear, mystery, intrigue, deception...
5 stars - loved this book.  Started off fast and didn't slow don until the end!
5 stars - Oliver drove me nuts with the way he kept me freaked out and enthralled...Throw in a good cast, clues and threads leading somewhere, or nowhere, and some interesting behind the scenes look at restaurants and chefs made this a book that caused me to disregard other duties just because I couldn't quit it...Get this book.



    Other Ways You Can Help If you can contribute a little something SHINY!!  If you can't please tell your friends about it.  Go on social media and share like everyone needs to see it or else!
And of course Thank You for the support and help.

story:
Short Summary

Mount of Transfiguration C-H-A-M-P-S Youth Ministry is located in Opelika, Alabama. The Youth Ministry began October 6th, 2013 when we saw a need to empower the youth on their own personalized level. It has been progressing along with the church as a whole. Each year we have grown in the number of events we have, the number of auxiliaries available, as well as the number of services that can be offered to the youth to cater to their needs. We are sowing into our next generation, so they will be able to be catalyst and be impactful on this Earth.

1 Timothy 4:12- Don't let anyone look down on you because you are young, but set an example for the believers in speech, in conduct, in love, in faith and in purity.

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

As you venture through the page you will see that we have some perks available! We don't mind saying thanks and sowing back into those who have sown into us. The contributions will strictly go towards resources that the youth need. We have events throughout the year that help sow into the youth. From back to school give aways, teaching, and giving back to the community, the resources that we receive will help push our overall mission in impacting the youth.

 

The Impact

 

There is a great impact in contributing into the next generation. One of the ways in which we can have the accessible  resources for the youth is to be sound financially. We want to have as many resources available to the youth as possible and to create events that will help them have an avenue to resist the temptations that are out there in this world. By your contribution, it will enable us to take steps in empowering our youth.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If  by chance  you are not able to contribute, definitely get the word out! Prayers will also be appreciated! Thanks to all of those who are supporting in advance! We pray many blessings for you!

story:
More Details:

My name is Chuck McKay, and I am a licensed clinical mental health counselor and recovering depressed person and Agnostic.  In my career I have helped many people overcome various mental health problems and watched / participated in their spiritual growth along the way.

When I stopped using agnosticism as an excuse to avoid spirituality, my own recovery took off.  In my book I pass the lessons of this journey along to others.  I use irreverent humor to show people that taking things too seriously hinders spiritual growth.  Awe and reverence are only part of the picture.  We do not need to demean ourselves to be humble.  As one of my clients likes to say, "A lot of beautiful stuff grows from shit."

My humor writing has won various awards and prizes.  Trust me - I'm funny.  Making people laugh is one of my passions and passions are way more fun when we share them.  Preferably in retail outlets.

In order to publish this book, I need to raise $1500 for editing and self-publishing.  With your help, I will hire an editor to refine the text and a publisher to print, distribute, and market the book.  If I only raise part of the goal, I will use whatever money I can for editing help and continue to send the book to publishers.

Your donation will help young people gain access to a tool that can help them live fuller, healthier, and funnier lives.

Thank you for your consideration.

story:
What Brings Us Here

"When I was born, the doctor said I was a girl and my parents named me Maya. 

They put bows in my hair and dressed me in dresses. Everyone said what a pretty girl I was.

But as I got older, something didn’t feel right. I didn’t like being called a girl, but I knew I wasn’t a boy either..."

Being Raven is a labor of love crafted by myself, M. J. Davis, and my nonbinary child, Raven Davis. We want to share Raven's story with the world to show kids that not only is it ok to fall outside the binary, but that there's no wrong way to do so. Nina Enagonio, our talented illustrator, will be bringing Raven's story to life with her beautiful artwork.

Accessibility and representation are important to us, so the manuscript for Being Raven has been run by a number of nonbinary and genderqueer adults to ensure they feel it really represents the community. We also ensure that our text is in an easily readable font with adequate contrast so those with learning disabilities will be able to enjoy our books, too.

Below is an illustration featuring Raven from our previous book, Kaylee's Bucket List, and a sketch of an illustration for Being Raven, which Nina's already hard at work on!

What We Need From You

As with any project, funding is an important detail. Taking a children's book from being just a dream to a high quality product is an expensive process. Our goal for Being Raven is $7500, which includes but doesn't fully cover...

  • $5000 to pay our fantastically amazing illustrator, Nina Enagonio, Her art brings stories to life like no other, and I'm so pleased to be working with her for the second time. 
  • $2500-$3500 to print the books for backers
  • $1750-$3500 for shipping supplies and shipping costs for sending out books
  • $500-$1500 to cover other rewards offered 
  • $600+ in IndieGoGo platform costs, plus processing fees

This brings our total costs to $9750-$13500. We'll be making up the difference by investing any profits from Kaylee's Bucket List toward producing Being Raven. To entice you, we've created a wide range of rewards, but if you can think of a reward combination that you don't see listed, please contact me and I can add it!

Risks & Challenges

Every project has risks. Here are ours:

  • Printing delays - If our contracted printer has a delay, delivery may be delayed.
  • Health issues - If there were to be any major health issues with me, my family, or Nina, production could be slowed down. Unfortunately, this isn't avoidable, but we would work to keep all backers updated on progress.

Thank you!

Thank you so much for your support! Your pledges mean the world to me. If you love our project as much as we do and cannot financially contribute, please share our campaign with others.

story:
Povestea mea 

Sunt Stela Moldovanu și mă aflu mereu în căutarea frumuseții. Tot ce fac în activitatea mea zilnică este să caut și să promovez oamenii și lucrurile frumoase din țara mea. De câțiva ani am o relație specială cu IA. M-am îndrăgostit de ea pentru că i-am aflat rostul. Am început să o studiez și să o cos cu nesaț.

Expoziția MăiestrIA pe care am organizat-o în Chișinău doi ani la rând a adus în fața publicului IA autentică, cea care nu este un simplu veșmânt, ci o armură de protecție în fața relelor. 

Am creat acum câteva luni grupul MăiestrIA pe Facebook, în care comunicăm ușor cu sute de femei pasionate din Republica Moldova și România, iar recent am lansat și cursuri de cusut ie în Clubul MăiestrIA în acțiune. 

Trăiesc acum într-o lume aparte de simboluri și forțe neștiute, pe care le-au avut străbunicile noastre. M-am pătruns de puterea lor miraculoasă și nu mai pot avea  liniște până nu-mi realizez visul de a aduna totul într-o carte. 

Ce îmi doresc?

Visez să editez un album dedicat în totalitate iei, așa cum nu a mai existat până acum. 

Va fi un album de frumusete, imagini cu ii autentice cusute în zilele noastre, de femei active, cu familie si cariera, care se pot dedica pasiunii lor doar noaptea târziu sau dimineața la răsăritul soarelui.

Te asigur că acesta va putea fi și un cadou prețios pentru oricine vrea să-și potolească dorul de casă și de rădăcini.

Dincolo de partea estetică, îmi doresc ca această carte să fie și utilă. Vom descifra semnele și pașii pe care să-i faci dacă vrei și tu să începi a coase. Pentru că doar cu o ie cusută de mâna ta te poți mândri cu adevărat și o poți lăsa moștenire.

Ia te transformă în creator. Te învață să meditezi, te vindecă și te schimbă pentru totdeauna. 

 

De ce am nevoie de ajutor? 

Acest proiect nu poate fi realizat cu forțele mele proprii. Ca să fie exact așa cum imi doresc, voi lucra la concept, design, texte, machetare, editarea imaginilor, cu un om de o sensibilitate deosebită - Ana Popenco.  Visez să realizăm împreună un album de o subtilitate și o energie aparte: cu imagini gustoase și descifrarea ornamentelor, momente prinse în zbor în procesul de lucru la o ie și gândurile femeilor care au intrat în această pasiune, toate tipărite pe o hârtie specială, pentru a putea savura cartea și peste o sută de ani!

Pentru sesiuni foto interesante,  la care vom invita mai mulți fotografi profesioniști, preselecții de ii cusute în zilele noastre, texte care să te molipsească de frumos, modele care să simtă fiorul poveștii MăiestrIA, pentru idei proaspete și inedite avem nevoie de resurse finaciare. De aceea apelez la susținerea ta. 

 

Cauza proiectului 

Prin cartea MăiestrIA - povestea cusută a iei îmi doresc să contribui la descifrarea  pe înțelesul tuturor a esenței cămășii tradiționale românești, pentru a fi apreciată adevărata ei valoare, pentru a o scoate din zona modei, în zona culturii. De asemenea, îmi doresc să molipsesc în continuare femeile  să-și coase ia cu mâna lor, nu să o caute prin târguri.

IA este unul din cele mai frumoase și durabile elemente ale identității noastre.  Acest album va fi o dedicație pentru creatoarele din trecut care ne-au lăsat o moștenire neprețuită, dar și pentru creatoarele din prezent, care duc tradiția mai departe. Va fi o carte Poveste. 

Te invit să faci parte și tu din această nebunie, printr-o donație. Totul abia începe!

 

Termeni de realizare și buget

Intenționez să lansez cartea MăiestrIA - povestea cusută a iei pe 24 iunie 2019, de Ziua Universală a Iei. Ediția va fi tipărită în 500 de exemplare.

                  

În cazul în care nu voi reuși să adun bugetul prin această campanie, realizarea proiectului se va amâna pe un termen nelimitat, dar nu voi renunța la el. Este visul și misiunea mea pentru care voi depune tot efortul spre a-l finaliza cu succes. 

Dacă ai descoperit măcar un motiv pentru care dorești să contribui, îți mulțumesc și te invit să vezi lista de recompense. 

 

Cum mă mai poți ajuta? 

Chiar dacă nu ești gata să faci acum o donație, te invit să distribui această campanie printre prietenii tăi. Îți voi fi recunoscătoare pentru că îți pasă. De asemenea, mă poți urmări pe Facebook pentru a vedea cum se derulează proiectul și care sunt alte activități în care sunt implicată.

 

My Story

I am Stela Moldovanu and everywhere I go I am looking for beauty. Since I have discovered the meaning of the traditional Romanian blouse (named originally “IA”),  I fell in love with it. I have initiated the project MăiestrIA (”artistry”), the community that promotes the power of this artefact and its creators.

My project

Now, I am dreaming about a book, dedicated to IA. It is going to be the album of beauty, that will pass further into future the story and the craft that connects women and transforms them from consumers to creators.

I want it to be an exclusive, unique and collectible book. I see it full of stunning pictures and personal reflections of people that follow the tradition of sewing nowadays.

To make all this happen  I need your support. You can be a part of my dream by donating for this project. You can also share the campaign on social media and spread the word to your friends.

Follow me on Facebook to see all my activity.

story:
Our mission is to “Present to the Public amazing Artists, and present to the Artists an amazing Public”. That’s where you come in!

This publication is part of an initiative that supports artists and promotes them globally.

Other initiatives include:
• A dynamic Art portal (www.artgalaxie.com) where artists are given their own profile page, with unlimited photos, videos and other info
• Constant Art Marketing
• Multimedia Advertising Campaigns
•Professional Videos and Animations

We do this completely free of costs for the members of our community.
Around 300 Artists!

 

 


To date we have already published the work of almost 200 artists and over 1000 artworks. We now want you to be part of bringing the next edition to life: 
Masters of Contemporary Fine Art – Volume 3
 

 


 


 

Creative essays, by Pedro Boaventura, accompany the artworks and tell a universe of stories that help understand artworks and some meanings behind them.

This book is a powerful tool that will help develop several techniques of observation and allow for better understanding of the Visual Arts.

Some of participating Artists include:

Adam Martinakis                                   James Bullough                                          Nourelhadi Awad 
Alejandro Dini                                         Jaroslaw Jasnikowski                               Oceana Rain Stuart  
Billy Reynolds                                         Jaya Su Berg                                               Redmer Hoekstra
Bruno Pontiroli                                       João de Carvalho                                       Ronit Baranga
Carl Krull                                                  John Lopez                                                  Samuel Gomez
Duarte Vitoria                                         Kristine Poole                                             Sergey Tyukanov 
Gaelle Weissberg                                   Marco Battaglini                                        Sergio Barrale
Henrik Moses                                          Nikolina Petolas                                        Sergiy Hrapov                                    
                                                                       
                                        
                                                                       
                                
                                                

 

 


The projects we have developed over the last 5 years have been completely free for artists. Pedro has supported all related costs and also invests a lot of his time. However, to continue developing projects and have some sort of future, Art Galaxie needs to be auto-sustainable, or its existence will be compromised.

We are asking for you to help us maintain this project, and also keep growing, starting off by bringing this next book to life.

We have been giving to artists all this time, and now it is us that need your help so we can continue giving. Your contribution is not to us, but through us.

 

 


By contributing towards this fund, you are helping us promote not only these artists but also others that are part of our community. We will be able to produce the book, and distribute it at a lower price, which will allow us to keep investing in more initiatives like this.

Fund distribution:



These are the minimum values in order to produce this book. Marketing and Advertising deserve a larger portion, because it's where we have the opportunity to sell the book.

If we exceed our goal, we can invest more in Marketing and Advertising.

 

 

Besides being promoted, Artists have a profile page on the Art Galaxie portal, where they can sell their artwork or reproductions. In addition, they also have the opportunity to be part of several partnerships and programs that are profitable for them. For example, our Artists will receive 30% of sales of the book through our affiliate program.

With your help we can reduce the price of the book, meaning we can sell more at an accessible price, which in turn gives artists more income.

Here is what previous participating artists have to say:

 

 


 

Pedro is an Artist and filmmaker, currently crafting a series of documentaries on Contemporary Art. He is the Founder of Art Galaxie. He studied visual arts, video and cinema.  His long career started as a designer and making photo-manipulations for the publishing industry. After several technical positions in advertising and television, he worked as director and director of photography for several production companies of video and television.

Sylvia is also a Fine Artist with a degree from the Faculty of Fine Arts of Porto, Portugal. She originally worked as a designer in several projects, then as a general manager of an Art school with 1500 students. Currently, she is the General Manager and Art Director in several projects that Art Galaxie develops.
 

What makes us fit for the job?

Pedro not only gathers all his great passions, but also all the areas in which he has been working for over 30 years, from publishing to advertising, video, fine arts, and even the merge of art with cinema through animation and 3D.

Sylvia is an art director and coordinates the whole process of design and publishing. Above all, it is their passion for the Arts that makes them want to keep Art Galaxie growing to support artists in the way they know best.

 

 


We want to dedicate this project to all those who identify themselves with it.

May your energy be part of this community of Artists and Art Lovers, in order to broaden its legion of fans and evangelists. Most times, it's the smallest gesture that has the greatest impact. And this is one of them.

Please share this campaign.
Any gesture towards our mission is greatly appreciated.

Thank you!

story:
The Background

Going into hospital can be scary - especially for kids! But children's wards are full of real life superheroes: kids (and medical staff) who manage to stay strong and think positive no matter the challenges they face. That’s where the idea for this project came from...

The Book

‘Superhero Hospital’ is a fun rhyming children’s book created to help kids and their families feel a little less scared about arriving in hospital, and to help them get through the inevitable boredom they'll face whilst on the ward.

In our book, a cast of poorly superheroes ask the reader to think about their own real-life super powers and imagine how they can use them to stay positive during their stay in hospital.

I’ve teamed up with a brilliant illustrator, Kelly Lewis, to bring the characters and story to life in the brightest, most silly way possible, and now we’re ready to print!

You can view a preview of the book here.

Our Goal

When you back our campaign, you'll receive a copy of the book AND help cover the printing costs to give a free copy to a child on the wards at Royal Manchester Children's Hospital. There are 300 beds in the hospital and new patients every day - we would love to print a copy for every kid there. 

(This project is not for personal profit- any surplus funds will go towards Royal Manchester Children’s Hospital Charity, supporting more poorly children in RMCH).

The hospital's play therapy team have agreed to help distribute the books to incoming children and families on the wards. The books are ready to print, now we just need your orders!

Technical specs

The book is A5 softcover - 44 pages in full colour.

Risks and challenges

The book itself is completed and ready to be printed. The hospital staff are on-board and ready to distribute books to patients. Printing usually takes 2-3 weeks so we will aim to deliver your book(s) within 4 weeks of the campaign finishing. I don't anticipate any delays but if anything unexpected happens I will of course keep you updated. 

Thanks very much for exploring our page and we hope you have fun reading the book!

story:
Las Discípulas de Jesús hemos sido llamadas a extender el Reino y a proclamar a Jesucristo como Señor. Por eso cada una de nuestras actividades están dirigidas a buscar que Dios sea conocido, amado y glorificado en todas las cosas.

Así es como surge Llama Viva Producciones S.C., uno de los ministerios que nos ha confiado el Señor y cuyo objetivo es extender el Reino de Dios a través de la música, el teatro y la buena literatura.

En esta ocasión queremos hacerte parte de nuestro nuevo proyecto, dirigido a promover la unidad de las familias durante las fiestas decembrinas. Este es un tiempo privilegiado para dar y recibir no solo cosas materiales, sino sobre todo los bienes más importantes, que son los espirituales: amor, alegría, aliento, paz...

Con tu ayuda haremos que estas fiestas sean más alegres, llenándolas de oración, de cantos y de música, pues este libro contendrá, entre otras prácticas navideñas, la pedida de posada y levantada del Niño Dios, hermosas tradiciones mexicanas que queremos seguir fomentando en nuestro pueblo.

Además el libro irá ahora acompañado por un CD grabado por las hermanas de nuestro Ministerio de Música. Allí encontrarás los cantos propios del Adviento y los Villancicos Navideños que se sugieren para cada una de las celebraciones que vienen en el libro, por lo que tendrás un material muy completo a la hora de celebrar el Adviento y la Noche Buena en familia. Por supuesto que también será sumamente apropiado para animar estas celebraciones en las comunidades parroquiales, grupos de oración y de fe, reuniones de catequesis... en fin, de todos los que nos congregamos para celebrar con alegría el Nacimiento de nuestro Salvador.

Si es que no nos conoces, en el siguiente video puedes escuchar algo de nuestra música, precisamente el demo del CD "En Belén, a medianoche", que grabamos las Discípulas de Jesús el año pasado. (Y por supuesto, también te invitamos a visitar nuestro canal de YouTube, donde encontrarás mucho más!!!).

Para llevar a cabo este proyecto editorial necesitamos reunir la cantidad de 3.000 dólares, que serán destinados a la reedición del libro Adviento y Noche Buena y a la grabación del CD con los cantos de Adviento y Navidad que el libro contiene.

No somos una empresa con fines de lucro, razón por la cual todas las ganancias de nuestras producciones están destinadas a seguir produciendo otros proyectos para la extensión del Reino de Dios.

Agradecemos de antemano tu ayuda. Si puedes apoyarnos económicamente, a continuación puedes ver los beneficios que obtendrás según tu aportación. Si no puedes ofrecernos tu apoyo económico, también necesitamos -¡y esto es muy importante!- que nos ayudes compartiendo esta campaña entre tus amigos y contactos. Compártela en tus redes, pero principalmente de manera personal, contándole a tus familiares y amigos que creas que puedan estar interesados en apoyar este tipo de iniciativas. Cada colaboración suma, y no hay aportes pequeños. Lo importante es que se empiece a correr la voz.

Y por supuesto, siempre nos encomendamos a tu oración, ya que estamos convencidas de que esta es la mejor y más grande ayuda que podemos recibir. Con tu intercesión estamos seguras de que el Señor abrirá puertas y allanará los caminos para que este proyecto se pueda llevar a cabo según su voluntad y cumpla la misión que Él quiere. Solo Él conoce lo que hará a través de este libro y estos cantos de Adviento y Villancicos. Por eso ponemos desde ya todo este trabajo en sus manos y se lo consagramos a Él.

Por cualquier consulta no dudes en escribirnos uno de estos correos:

  • produllamaviva@hotmail.com
  • hermanasdiscipulasdejesus@gmail.com

¡Dad gloria al Señor! ¡ahora y por siempre!

story:
Hi,

I have dreamed of publishing my own novel for quite sometime now - ever since I was a little girl, if I'm being quite honest. I have been writing for years and have finally gotten the courage to self-publish my first story.

She Is In Love

Is a story about two best friends, an unrequited love, and a mental breakdown. It will accurately portray a friendship, a love, and mental illnesses.

The Impact

As someone that suffers from my own mental illness, I have been in and out of programs to keep my brain healthy. In that experience, I have learned that there in an alarmingly high rate of LGBTQ people living with mental illness. I want to make LGBTQ people with mental illnesses feel less alone with my story.

Consider Donating

Help my dream become a reality. We are in this together and you will not regret it.

Preview

I miss the sounds of the trains rolling in

Our bodies draped so casually close together

The smell of vodka on your breath,

as your chest heaves up and down

Sloppily, messily in love with your cyan eyes

Your multicolored hair stuck to your forehead, drenched in sweat

They call us names, maybe, but I don’t mind

Confirming exactly what I’m feeling in the moment

You sob into my shoulder, the stigma,

becoming much too much of a burden to bear

I whisper into your ear, softly cooing

That you will rise up to see another day,

rum buzzing on my tongue

Look in the gallery for more previews of She Is In Love.

story:
ON A MISSION TO DOCUMENT 'BLACK EXCELLENCE' 

 

'TANTV 10K' IS A NEW SERIES THAT AIMS TO DOCUMENT HOW BLACK AND MINORITY OWNED BUSINESSES ARE STAYING AFLOAT AND INNOVATING DUE TO THE CORONAVIRUS PANDEMIC. 

 

SIGN UP & BACK THIS PROJECT WITH $100 TO SHARE YOUR BLACK EXCELLENCE STORY!

WHAT HAVE  YOU BEEN DOING AS A BLACK/MULTICULTURAL BUSINESS OWNER TO STAY INNOVATIVE, TO GIVE BACK OR TO BE A CHANGE-MAKER? 

WE AIM TO DOCUMENT THE STORY OF RESILIENCE AND INNOVATION WITHIN OUR GLOBAL BLACK  COMMUNITY. 

TANTV WANTS TO HIGHLIGHT ON OUR NETWORK, MULTICULTURAL & BLACK-OWNED BUSINESSES SEEING GROWTH IN THEIR BUSINESS OR DOING SOMETHING UNIQUE / SOCIALLY IMPACTFUL REGARDLESS OF THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC.  

OUR MAIN GOAL IS TO ESPECIALLY DOCUMENT HOW YOUR BUSINESS IS INNOVATING AND HOW YOU HAVE BEEN A RESILIENT FOUNDER/CHANGE-MAKER IN THE FACE OF A PANDEMIC. 

Criteria to Get Featured: 

1. Have you had to find a new system of operations or create a new business model for yourself?

2. Have you changed your business operations significantly compared to pre covid-19? 

3. What unique outcomes have emerged from the changes you made? 

4. What is something you have done differently that you feel has a WOW factor? 

5. What will you like to share with other business owners as a lesson or advice in other to successfully pivot like you have done? 

6. Have you done something socially-impactful during this period that you will like to create awareness about?

 

If you have an interesting story of impact to share around these line of questions about how your business is growing in sales compared to before or how you have modified your business to survive and stay afloat, we would love to hear from you!

Our mission completes once we cover the 

TEN THOUSANDTH STORY!

We are covering 100 stories per campaign.

Steps  to Get Featured: 

1. Back this project with $100 

2. A journalist on the team will reach out to you to schedule an interview within 7 days of signing up. 

3. You will be profiled over a recorded zoom and we will publish a written  article with an attachment of the video on our TANTV website. This will be shared and promoted across all our platforms. 

4. After you're published, we will invited you to be a part of TANTV Business Council if you're interested in staying connected with the other business professionals who will be profiled. 

The Journalists 

Adedayo Fashanu : Founder and C.E.O of TANTV. She is a journalist, writer, TV producer and a media entrepreneur whose vision is to use media for social impact. Adedayo has a ton of published works on Huffpost and Forbes. She has covered the White House, United Nations General Assemblies, and the World Bank. . An advocate of the UN Sustainable Development Goals she is a change maker who continues to champion sustainability through media. She founded TANTV to tell socially impactful stories that will inspire others to change the world. 

 

David Gorden: A creator, writer, and sequential artist who specializes in the creation of intellectual properties. David is a cartoonist and a founding member of legendary St. Louis art crews Air Assault and later Mach One. He has written and created IP for Lion Forge Comics, Rampage Jackson, Scott Steindorff, and Nick Cannon.  His creative credits include Rampage Jackson: Street Soldier, Trimaxx, Quincredible, Sympathy for the Soul (script adaptation), Make Believe (script adaptation) and more.  David is the creator of Kwame Hightower and Quantum University.  He released his first independent OGN, Kwame Hightower and the Man with No Name in late March of 2018.   He has recently begun work on his next graphic novel Kwame Hightower and the Exiles of Kalatheaa and is actively promoting his books through touring, posts on social media, speaking engagements and teaching workshops on visual storytelling.  

For TANTV, David will be creating illustrations and portraits of each founder we profile. 

 

Cheyanne Gordon: Cheyanne is a journalist and communications strategist. A recent graduate of Morgan State University.  She has written for the Baltimore Times and The Afro Newspaper.

Cheyanne joined TANTV as a journalist right after graduating and spends most of her time developing stories, brainstorming editorial angles and connecting  with prospective contributors and other industry professionals. 

 

Mufsin Mahbub:  is a journalist who has worked on the production team of Yahoo! Build Series, written for HuffPost, BuzzFeed, International Business Times (U.S.), Comic Book Resources, Comicsverse, FilmBookquick and more. story:
Junga books are a great way to have important life-lesson discussions with children. The Junga book series aims to reduce bullying for children K-3rd grade. 

Would you like to teach children the importance of having courage, empathy, and positive self esteem?

Children with low self-esteem, anxiety, depression or similar issues are at a higher risk of suicide. The bullying of these children may be the tipping point to tragedy. According to stopbullying.gov, 160,000 students stay home from school every day to avoid bullies, 1 out of 4 children are bullied either through cyber, mental, verbal or physical methods and 64% of victims never even report the incidents. We must continue to find new ways to reach young children and give them hope and encouragement while dealing with bullying.

Children will enjoy reading the stories over and over as Junga and friends face challenges while learning valuable life lessons such as developing acceptance, bravery, and courage. The Junga book series also teaches lessons about doing the right thing, finding the good in others, having a positive self-image, and overcoming bullying.

*****BE SURE TO VIEW THE TAB FOR IMPORTANT UPDATES FOR INFORMATION ON ENDORSEMENTS AND HOW TO HAVE A CHARACTER CALL YOUR FAMILY FOR THE HOLIDAYS!

Educational Tools

Our team of Early Childhood Development Educators is creating age-appropriate Lesson Plans to assist educators and parents to help their children learn these important lessons.

With your help, we can produce and share "Junga the Dancing Yeti Meets Heidi" with children around the world and help end bullying, one child or class at a time. The first Junga the Dancing Yeti book is currently available at Amazon, Barnes & Noble and other stores and is receiving rave reviews! 

YouTube Video

Watch the Trailer video of the first Junga book here: Junga the Dancing Yeti Trailer. We brought together a professional cast of voiceover artists along with the talented 11-time Emmy Recipient James R. Alburger to create a video of Junga the Dancing Yeti on YouTube. We plan to produce a video of the new book as well and Executive and Associate Producers of this Indiegogo Campaign will receive recognition in the upcoming book and video for Junga the Dancing Yeti Meets Heidi.  Junga the Dancing Yeti Video

Children in the USA, Ireland and Scotland have enjoyed the author's live readings of how Junga overcame discrimination and bullying. The second book introduces Heidi who becomes Junga's close friend and together they find a way to end being targets of a persistent bully. Children learn a powerful lesson where the creation of new friendships can help to overcome adversary.

Here is our plan to action:

Media Coverage

Since bullying and discrimination are timely topics, author Stephen Tako has been interviewed on many talk show platforms since 2012. He was the featured speaker recently on iHeart Radio: Life Without Limits, England's Beacon of Light Radio - Over the Rainbow with host Bob Brown and a guest on Next Level by Association with Bob Donnell. Stephen is the September, 2020 guest speaker at the Santa Clarita Rotary Club and their Hometown Station KHTS interviewed Stephen in 2018. Also, while visiting his hometown in Ohio, the local paper wrote an article about his work. 

 

Why we need the Fundraiser

We've chosen Indiegogo to help raise the needed funds and here are the approximate percentages of how the funds will be used:

20% Needed for Art Direction, Design, Project Management & Production

45% Will cover the cost of first run printing

5% To cover cost of shipping & handling for post print

20% For fulfillment of campaign rewards and payment processing fees

10% For marketing and promoting the book around the United States

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Help us get the word out and make some noise about this worthy campaign.
  • Be sure to use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • When sharing the fundraiser on Social Media, please use the hashtag #JungaYeti so we can Thank You!!

 

Stretch Goals

Our initial goal is to reach $8,000. A stretch goal is a new incentive to increase pledges over the original goal, allowing us more opportunities for marketing, premium color printing and to upgrade to hard cover books, and that would be really amazing! By encouraging your friends and family to pledge, we will be able to reach the stretch goals and also unlock additional products to send to you for FREE!

$10,000 Stretch Goal - Every Junga the Dancing Yeti Meets Heidi book will be upgraded from paperback to Hardcover. All backers at $60+ level receive one child or adult-size Junga Face Mask.

$12,000 Stretch Goal - All backers at $100+ level will receive a 10-pack of Junga & Heidi Greeting Cards

$14,000 Stretch Goal - Get a Junga Book Mark & Signed Poster of Junga, Heidi and Groth with each book

 

Timeline of project:

The expected timeline for this Indiegogo project:

Early October 2020 to complete illustrations and book cover design.

Early November 2020 for publishing and printing.

All items expected to be mailed to backers by late November 2020.

Video and Educator Lesson Plans in December, 2020.
 

About the Author:

Stephen Tako is a member of the Society of Children's Book Writers and Illustrators as well as a member of SAG-AFTRA. As an anti-bullying advocate, he has interviewed children and adults on his talk show, who were victims of various types of bullying. He's interviewed therapists, sports celebrities and even former bullies, in his quest to help people overcome the negative impact of being bullied. 

"The strong desire to save children from committing suicide has grown tremendously within me. I developed Junga the Dancing Yeti to teach children about courage, acceptance and love," said Tako. "I too was a target of bullies and wrote about it in my book Motivated to Act (pub. Enchanted Forest Press 2012) in the chapter A Damaged Child."

As a Competent Toastmaster, he has spoken to thousands over the last 20 years on topics such as self-esteem improvement, overcoming limiting beliefs, anti-bullying, becoming a more effective speaker and more.  

Stephen was the producer and casting director for the Junga the Dancing Yeti video. "We had an amazing team of voiceover artists, combined with Emmy-quality editing to bring Peter Gullerud's illustrations to life" said Tako during a recent interview.

Raised in Ohio, Stephen moved to Los Angeles in 1987 to work in entertainment. His path took him in the direction of sales in various industries, including his current position as a mortgage lender. Besides mortgages, he currently host various international film festivals in Hollywood as well as publishing and producing all the Junga books and videos. He met his fiance while visiting family in Ohio and moved there briefly, before relocating to San Diego, California. 

About the Illustrator:

Peter Gullerud

Peter Gullerud’s expressive detail and technical gifts have been employed at the three top animation studios in Los Angeles: Hanna-Barbera, Disney Features and Warner Brothers Features. He rose up the chain at Disney becoming one of two prestigious visual development artists on the hit film Aladdin. After that, he remained a visual development artist on the Warner Brothers films Space Jam, Quest for Camelot and The Iron Giant.

Peter is a self taught artist who presents a captivating and unique perspective in his works. His varied subject matter includes surreal landscapes, unique buildings, animated figures and tenderly portrayed wildlife. Many of his works have a mysterious story telling quality about them which allows the viewer to go on a personal imaginary journey. He uses oils and acrylics in his canvas paintings as well as a unique mixture of media in his drawings. His works suggest an unusual mix of elements reminiscent of Edvard Munch, van Gogh, Maynard Dixon, and Roger Dean along with his own unique surreal and expressive brush strokes.

After 15 years of studio work, Gullerud began working directly with wildlife. He brings to his work the authenticity of working with Wildlife Educators and Tippi Hedren’s animals at the Shambala Preserve. He has hands-on experiences with Siberian tigers, California black bears, binturongs, pigtail macaques, African elephants, wolves and many other exotics. After Peter’s wildlife period, he began painting surrealist landscapes and continues to do that to this day. His paintings display a boundless imagination and storytelling ability that draws you into his works. As you are drawn in, you often discover surprising, hidden details within the picture that make a statement about our humanity, our planet and and the other beings we share it with. Some of the other creatures are totally original and reside solely within the surreal world of Peter’s imagination.

In addition to his paintings, Peter is an accomplished illustrator creating many imaginative and whimsical drawings in his own unique fashion using ink, pencil and other media.

Peter Gullerud was born in Wisconsin and moved to California where he has spent most of his life. He resided in the quaint village of Pine Mountain Club, CA in the Los Padres National Forest where he was introduced to author Stephen Tako and began collaborating on Junga, the Dancing Yeti. He lived there for many years where his works were displayed in local businesses and sold throughout the country. Peter now resides in Taft, CA, another quaint town. Peter displays a concern for environmental issues and a compassion for all animals as evidenced in his works. He remains a member of the Animators Guild of America.

 

REWARDS

The first Junga book in the series comes with a hardcover design. 8x10 size.

Junga T-shirts come in Youth and Adult sizes for unisex design. Ladies V-neck is also available. Colors include White, Gray and Pink

The Grandma Yeti Level offers a plate and cup (not pictured).

The Heidi Level is the only level offering a customized and framable picture of Heidi with your child's name and also signed by Heidi too!

Some Levels include a customized and framable Courage Certificate to inspire your child for making the right choices.

 

Risks and challenges

The book is completely written. The artwork will change on some of the rewards as the illustrator cleans up edges on existing artwork. Plus as the production develops, we will likely come up with a couple new images to use on some of the products used for backer rewards. The Courage Certificate and Heidi Poster shown here are only prototypes. Final designs will be announced later. Due to the timely nature of this campaign against bullying, we are confident that we will reach our funding goals. Teaming up with former Disney artist Peter Gullerud for illustrations is another guarantee that we will deliver a top-quality children's book. We will provide updates regularly along the process to all of our backers.

story:
My name is Darnell McCullough. I am a dad, entrepreneur, and storyteller who quit his job after a 12-year career in the non-profit industry specializing in youth development. After several failed business attempts, I decided to become a fully fledged entrepreneur who professionally helps individuals, entrepreneurs, teams, and organization meet their goals all while gaining peace, happiness and freedom. The 9 P's of Power is the next keynote body of work that will guide individuals and entrepreneurs alike to a greater sense of PEACE, HAPPINESS, AND FREEDOM in your life. Within its contents are the starting tools and strategies to reshape the mindset of the 95% of people we believe are not living their most fulfilled life.

 

You want to jumpstart your way to pursuing your wildest dreams? Don't live any longer without this book. The 9 P's of Power takes you up a 9-step ladder where you will learn powerful techniques, principals and practices that lead to exponential growth. This campaign will help us reach our goals of providing proactive personal power content to the game changers of humanity by helping them #GrowForwardNOW ! Get the first and only manual of its kind to get insight on creating the life you deserve.

 

The 9 P's of Power has information for the development of better professional and personal relationships, a more healthy and purposeful lifestyle.
Using research and learned life experiences , this book will engage, awake, and empower those who desire lasting change in their lives. With the support and the success of this campaign, we will be able to deliver a world class manual to a broader audience of millions globally. This book was written to help people #GrowForwardNOW by providing techniques, principals, and practices to make measurable progress of growth in reasonable time.

 

There is so much potential in the world. Unfortunately, most people lack the passion to unlock that power. This campaign can help us deliver the tools to change the world and help everyone #GrowForwardNOW. We need $17,800 to remaster this book and bring it to production. We need editors, graphic artists and publishers to assist us in producing the greatest work possible.

We have great perks available that allow us to get our book to you which allows us to help the world #GrowForwardNOW. We would like to thank each and every person that supports this campaign by personally inscribing your name in our book. We also know how difficult it can be to remain focused and motivated. We are including 2 motivational quote magnets with some of our perks. These magnets, along with creating SMART S.Y.S.T.E.M.S., can help you CRUSH your goals.

If we don't reach our goal of $17,800, there are several things we can do. For starters, we go back to the drawing board because we are NOT quitters. We will be able to reassess and refine our process and reach our goal the second time around. 

As it stands, we have promoted this campaign to family and friends but we may not have enough support to start out with. Those of you that support this campaign can promote it as well and that will send us soaring toward our goal. We believe that this book can change the lives of millions. This is the first step in helping everyone see the dream as well. 

 

We know that we are speaking to budding entrepreneurs which means money may be tight sometimes. Your support means the world to us! You can support us by re-posting our campaign if you truly believe in our ability to help the world #GrowForwardNOW. Tell a friend and share from the Indiegogo website! 

Thank you, thank you and THANK YOU!

We will be able to reassess and refine our process and reach our goal the second time around. As it stands, we have promoted this campaign to family and friends but we may not have enough support to start out with. Those of you that support this campaign can promote it as well and that will send us soaring toward our goal. We believe that this book can change the lives of millions. This is the first step in helping everyone see the dream as well.  We know that we are speaking to budding entrepreneurs which means money may be tight sometimes. Your support means the world to us! You can support us by re-posting our campaign if you truly believe in our ability to help the world #GrowForwardNOW. Tell a friend and share from the Indiegogo website! Thank you, thank you and THANK YOU!

story:
Hello,

I'm Camilla Howalt I'm a visual artist and writer..
 

T H E     S T O R Y

WE ARE TIME (Vi Er Tiden in Danish) is a philosophical fiction that examines what reality is and how, through different layers of consciousness, it puts into perspective the possibility of simultaneous existences, as well as the transition between these. It is a book that tries to take as its starting point the abstract language of the body and mind, and give ithis a form.

S T O R Y     I N S P I R A T I O N

Throughout my life I have travelled to different places in the world, and in my mind. As my writing has progressed, so have my understanding of the magic that can happen on a page. WE ARE THE TIME is an examination of this magic.

A B O U T        T H E         A R T I S T

As an artist and writer I tend to weave and map elements from external life and from the inside of what has turned out to be me. I take bits and pieces, like mental snapshots, of everything that happens around me and in the wider world, translating these intuitions and observations into my favourite materials.

These I weave around one another like figures in a myth or words in a concept - philosophical or psychoanalytical - like a caterpillar winding a silky thread around itself until fully cocooned, biding time until, without warning, the work bursts forth like a butterfly. Each piece carries beauty and integrity - its own qualities that I could not consciously impart. The work becomes as a result of leaving myself open to bridging being with doing.

 

What I Need

In order to complete WE ARE THE TIME, I need your help! WE ARE THE TIME will be printed as an 14 x 21 cm, high-quality, softcover book. Your generous contributions will go towards several aspects of the editing process, design and layout, printing, and publishing process.

 

Where the Funds Go

The publishing, printing and shipment of the first run of books

E-book and audio book conversion & design

Shipping and packaging of all perks and rewards

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't looking to contribute right now, there are still other ways to show your support! Consider sharing this campaign with your social media communities as well as friends, family and coworkers you think might love the book.

If you have a media contact, feel free to send them my way; I also welcome words of encouragement if you'd like to say hello: camillahowalt@gmail.com.


The Perks!

This campaign has just a few perks like the handwritten card of one of my own art works, a poster of this art work (50x70cm) and the book which can be pre bought - all to help WE ARE THE TIME  to come to life. All books ordered through this campaign will be signed copies!

 

Tentative Project Timeline

I've organized my timeline well and have a good understanding of the work that lies ahead. At this stage, the book is written, the story is complete and about 2/3 of the editing process is finished. Work that needs to be completed includes finishing the remaining editorial process which includes editorial readers and their comments, designing and layoutibg the printed book, formatting the e-book, recording the audio book, ordering a draft copy of the book, and finally placing first print run of final book.

 

Potential Risks

​Due to the pandemic, some shipping and printing times may be extended. At this time I have done my best to build those potential delays into my existing timeline. 

This is my first crowdfunding campaign - so if you find inconsistencies, strange videos of a woman speaking Danish (the book is still only in Danish - though I would like to translate it into English and French), please bear over with me. And send me tips on how to improve!

 

Thank you for reading, for your support, for your sharing.


Sincerely yours,

Camilla Howalt

story:
Story of My Book

They Were a Dream is a story about trauma and the devistating effects it can have on mental health, but also about healing and the fantastic things that can come from recovering.

My name is Trii Tyle, and I am the author of They Were a Dream. I wrote this book because of a traumatic situation I experienced, the denial I was in for years afterwards, the night terrors and panic induced from the trauma, the beauty of healing and therapy, as well as the fantastical aspect of astral projection and falling in love.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover the broader aspects of dreams and recovery. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to engage with nonbinary gender themes while escaping from the binds of reality and learning about trauma recovery through the eyes of someone experiencing it.


The world of this book is shown through the eyes of the protagonist, Ellery. She has incredibly vivid nightmares of the trauma that she experienced, and she has no idea how to help herself. She leans on poetry, her cat named Lion, and her best friend Samar for support as she suffers through panic and anxiety. Her life is filled with terror until she’s introduced to therapy. Ellery finds healing through talk therapy and can finally sleep peacefully again. Her nightmares fade and soon turn into something significantly more fantastical, until she experiences the most spectacular dreams of her life in the most remarkable places and with the most breathtaking person she had ever met.


FOR ALL:
You will love this book if you are seeking an escape from the anxieties of reality, tired of the gender binaries that society imprints, and are interested in the idea of multiple dimensions.

They Were a Dream speaks to the trauma survivors and the LGBTQIA+ community who want to grapple with the gray areas of society and therapeutic recovery in a new way.

Ultimately, I hope that They Were a Dream inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • How does trauma escalate in the mind when not treated?
  • What if there are more dimensions or realities than just the one we are experiencing?
  • Why does society force a distinguished difference between genders?
I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe discussing nonbinary, trauma recovery, and multiple dimensions will change us all for the better.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April, 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this spring.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!
 

About the Author

Trii Tyle is a dreamer. She uses her fantastical ideas to inspire the stories she writes and has a spiritual mindset. Because of her empathy, she feels her emotions and those of others quite strongly and makes connections that are quite intense. Trii has found peace through meditation and writing, whether that be stories or poems.

Trii was inspired to write this story because of an indescribable dream she experienced. In it, she met and traveled with the love of her life, a person she had no knowledge of in reality. Because of this sensation and future similar scenarios, she knows that she experienced astral projection. This was a story she needed to share, because the universe called to her to write it.

Trii Tyle is a sincere animal lover. With three cats, a rabbit, and living on a farm, she finds joy among the spirits of her animal companions. She enjoys yoga before meditation and always wants to hike with her girlfriend.

For more information, you can connect with Trii Tyle  @triithewriter on Instagram and at triityleauthor@gmail.com
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. While the cost of shipping in the United states is included in the purchase, international shipping requires an additional cost that will be added at checkout.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #TheyWereaDream and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Trii Tyle

story:
Hello!

I'm Shaul Behr, husband, father, software professional, Orthodox Rabbi and now science fiction author.

I've written a groundbreaking new book - Ari Barak and the Choice Paradox* - which is the first ever in the genre of Jewish Science Fiction.  It's exciting, compelling and entertaining, and best of all, it will take you on a mind trip that might revolutionize the way you see the world.

First-time authors rarely get offered traditional (no-cost) contracts, so I need to front the publishing costs myself.  I'm offering you the opportunity to take advantage of one of the sponsorship packages available here, and be a part of bringing this groundbreaking new book to market!

Even if you can't contribute money, please tell your friends, and share this project on your social media feeds.  Get the word out - every effort helps and is greatly appreciated!

*Book title and cover design subject to change

Cover Copy

When Ari Barak, a likeable ADHD Jewish teenager leaves New York for his new Yeshiva in Israel, little does he know that he is embarking on a journey that will fundamentally shift his view of reality.

With his teacher, the enigmatic Rabbi Nachshon White, and new friend and study partner, Howard Segal, Ari gets a practical, hands-on course in the workings of the Universe.  And messes them up.  Ari and friends transport the reader on a mind trip that will entertain, challenge, inspire, and perhaps forever alter the way you look at the world.

Reviews

See what readers have to say about Ari Barak and the Choice Paradox!

This book has a really good science-fiction story that is steeped in the Jewish culture. The story contains excitement and action, and I found it a good read. The ending left me with a smile on my face.  On top of this – I found that the book made some very Jewish characters extremely accessible to me (a Christian reader).

David Mawer, Johannesburg

A book that will take you through biblical times while engaging you in ideologies about human choices and will power.   Set in Israel with Jewish ideologies and with concepts that will engage your thought process, the book will urge you to keep on reading. The book is written in a way that will appeal to (not only) the Jewish and Theology audiences, but to everyone who is imaginative, creative and open minded especially about "life navigation theories".  Shaul Behr made sure that through this book, being a scholar of the Jewish faith is as cool as being on a space ship.

Nosipho Singiswa, Cape Town

Very thought provoking, totally changed my paradigm of how I see the world.  I loved the characters and their distinctive personalities.  I couldn't put this book down!

N B, Beit Shemesh

Exceptionally well written, thought provoking, suspenseful, with a great plot.

A L, Beit Shemesh 

Sneak Preview

To whet your appetite for more, here's the prologue of Ari Barak and the Choice Paradox!

The old Rabbi lay propped up with pillows on his deathbed, smiling serenely.  His children and several of his older grandchildren were gathered around.  Tears glistened in their eyes.  Tears of laughter. 

“Abba, you really are unbelievable,” wheezed Gavriel, his eldest son, recovering long enough from his conniptions to speak.  He himself was in his late sixties.  “One might think that when a nonagenarian gadol hador[1] passes away, he might do it gracefully, with gravitas and maybe some deep wisdom in his parting words.  But you’ve done nothing but have us splitting our sides for the last half hour!”

“Good,” pronounced the old man in a creaky voice.  “If there should be anything that you will remember me by, it’s that I was never too old to have a sense of humor.”

“But Abba[2],” protested his daughter Avigail, “you should rest!  Aren’t you in pain?  Can’t I give you some pain killers?”

“Of course I’m in pain!” replied her father.  “The cancer is consuming me.  I can feel the Beis Din shel Maala[3] calling me.  But you think I should spend my last few minutes in this world drugged out, unable to feel, think, or be present with those I love?  Chas veshalom[4]!  The pain is temporary!”  He winced.  “But this time now is irreplaceable!”

He turned to another of his sons.  “Speaking of which, Uriel, has the Doctor arrived yet?  I need to speak to him.”

“I’ll check, Abba.”  He shuffled over to the door and poked his head outside, then called back in.  “Yes, Abba, he’s here.  Shall I bring him in?”

“No, I think he’s quite capable of walking in by himself,” called back the old Rabbi dryly.  His offspring burst out laughing again, several wiping their eyes as the uproar died down.

In walked a thin, neat man of around sixty.  He surveyed the gathering with a wry smile.  “Well, this certainly is the most cheerful farewell I’ve ever seen.  But laughter is the best medicine, after all, isn’t it?  Rebbe[5], you sent for me?”

“Yes, Doctor, I did.  I have something important to tell you that is for your ears only.”

A curious and awkward silence descended over the room.  The old man looked around at his family.  “I’m sorry, am I slurring my speech?  I said, what I have to say now is for the Doctor’s ears only.  Go on, now.”  He motioned feebly with his hand to usher everyone out.

“But… Abba…” protested Gavriel.

“Oh, feh, don’t worry,” he waved dismissively.  “I’ll keep myself alive until you get back.  Trust me, you’ll get your chance to say goodbye.  But now I must have private words with the Doctor.”

Reluctantly, his offspring trudged out of the room and closed the door behind themselves.  The Doctor sat himself in an upright chair near the head of the bed.

“I knew you would come,” said the aged Rabbi.

“It was fortunate that I was able to be here now.  I just got back from speaking at a conference in London, and only have a day at home now before the next one in Singapore.”

“And yet, I knew with complete certainty that I would see you again before I die.  I cannot allow myself to die yet.  Not until I have entrusted you with a sacred mission.”

The Doctor leaned closer, brows furrowed.  “A sacred mission, Rebbe?”

“Yes.  I could be dramatic and say the whole world depends on it.  But it doesn’t matter what I say, because I know you will do it anyway.  And, all going well, you could even be back here before I shuffle off this mortal coil, to tell me you succeeded.  But even if not, I know you will succeed.”

“Thank you for your confidence in me, Rebbe – I think.”  The Doctor raised an eyebrow.  “What is this mission?”

“I wrote it down for you.  Look in the top drawer of my bedside table.  There’s an envelope there, addressed to you.”

The Doctor obediently opened the drawer and found the envelope.  He tore it open and scanned the note inside.  As he read it, he blanched.  His eyes widened in disbelief, and his jaw dropped.

“Rebbe… are you… serious?  This is… quite, ah… how shall I say it?  Unexpected?”

“Much of the time, my dear Doctor, I am not too serious.  My cancer is very serious, so I do have to counterbalance it.  But on this occasion, I am dead serious.  Which is appropriate for someone who is soon to be seriously dead.”

The Doctor shook his head, blinking, breathing deeply, coming to terms with his task and all it entailed.  After about half a minute of reflection, he looked the dying man in the eyes.  “Rebbe… you never told me…”

The old man nodded weakly, a smile playing on his lips.  “It wasn’t necessary before.  But it is true, and now you know what you have to do.”

“My wife…” the Doctor mumbled, still in shock.

“You need to do this alone,” instructed the Rabbi.  “Mostly.  The Professor will help you as necessary.  Don’t worry about your wife; she won’t miss you.  You’ll be back within the hour, anyway, possibly sooner, depending on how good your aim is.”  He gave a conspiratorial wink, then winced involuntary in pain.

The Doctor took a deep breath, composed himself and stood up.  “Of course I will do it, Rebbe.  Right away.”

The old man’s face lit up.  “Good man.  I knew you would.”

“Apparently so,” replied the Doctor dryly.

“One more thing,” said the Rabbi.  “Please give me that little notepad and a pen.”

The Doctor obeyed, holding the notepad upright in the old man’s lap with one hand, and helping him grip the pen in the other.  With limp movements, the dying Rabbi scrawled a sentence on the pad, then tore off the page and handed it to the Doctor with a mischievous smile.

The Doctor accepted it with a raised eyebrow.  “I could have made one myself, you know.”

“I know,” said the Rabbi with a twinkle in his eye.  “But I couldn’t resist.  By the time you get back you’ll understand why.”

“All right, I’ll take your word for it,” replied the Doctor, folding the note along with his instructions and tucking them into his pocket.  He turned as if to leave, then paused for a couple of seconds, took a deep breath and turned back.  “Rebbe, this is an unbelievable honor for me.  Of all your talmidim[6], why me?  I’m certainly not the biggest talmid chacham[7]…”

The Rabbi smiled a knowing smile, but did not reply.

“Of course,” said his student, divining the answer himself.  “It has to be me.  I understand.  Well then, farewell for now.  And thank you – for everything.”

“No,” said the old man.  “Thank you.  What you are about to do means my life to me.”

He held out his hand.  As the Doctor took it, the old man pulled him with surprising strength into a tight embrace.  He only released his grip when the pain from his body forced him.

Without another word, the Doctor bowed his head, then turned and strode purposefully from the room.

 

[1] Literally, “a Great One of the generation”, a term reserved for only the most senior, learned and saintly Rabbis.

[2] Daddy

[3] The Heavenly Court, which judges a person after his death.

[4] Heaven forbid!

[5] “Rebbe” is a term used to address one’s personal teacher, as distinct from “Rabbi”, which is a more general, objective term.

[6] Students

[7] Eminent student
