The book is written in a way that will appeal to (not only) the Jewish and Theology audiences, but to everyone who is imaginative, creative and open minded especially about "life navigation theories".  Shaul Behr made sure that through this book, being a scholar of the Jewish faith is as cool as being on a space ship.Nosipho Singiswa, Cape TownVery thought provoking, totally changed my paradigm of how I see the world.  I loved the characters and their distinctive personalities.  I couldn't put this book down!N B, Beit ShemeshExceptionally well written, thought provoking, suspenseful, with a great plot.A L, Beit Shemesh Sneak PreviewTo whet your appetite for more, here's the prologue of Ari Barak and the Choice Paradox!The old Rabbi lay propped up with pillows on his deathbed, smiling serenely.  His children and several of his older grandchildren were gathered around.  Tears glistened in their eyes.  Tears of laughter. “Abba, you really are unbelievable,” wheezed Gavriel, his eldest son, recovering long enough from his conniptions to speak.  He himself was in his late sixties.  “One might think that when a nonagenarian gadol hador[1] passes away, he might do it gracefully, with gravitas and maybe some deep wisdom in his parting words.  But you’ve done nothing but have us splitting our sides for the last half hour!”“Good,” pronounced the old man in a creaky voice.  “If there should be anything that you will remember me by, it’s that I was never too old to have a sense of humor.”“But Abba[2],” protested his daughter Avigail, “you should rest!  Aren’t you in pain?  Can’t I give you some pain killers?”“Of course I’m in pain!” replied her father.  “The cancer is consuming me.  I can feel the Beis Din shel Maala[3] calling me.  But you think I should spend my last few minutes in this world drugged out, unable to feel, think, or be present with those I love?  Chas veshalom[4]!  The pain is temporary!”  He winced.  “But this time now is irreplaceable!”He turned to another of his sons.  “Speaking of which, Uriel, has the Doctor arrived yet?  I need to speak to him.”“I’ll check, Abba.”  He shuffled over to the door and poked his head outside, then called back in.  “Yes, Abba, he’s here.  Shall I bring him in?”“No, I think he’s quite capable of walking in by himself,” called back the old Rabbi dryly.  His offspring burst out laughing again, several wiping their eyes as the uproar died down.In walked a thin, neat man of around sixty.  He surveyed the gathering with a wry smile.  “Well, this certainly is the most cheerful farewell I’ve ever seen.  But laughter is the best medicine, after all, isn’t it?  Rebbe[5], you sent for me?”“Yes, Doctor, I did.  I have something important to tell you that is for your ears only.”A curious and awkward silence descended over the room.  The old man looked around at his family.  “I’m sorry, am I slurring my speech?  I said, what I have to say now is for the Doctor’s ears only.  Go on, now.”  He motioned feebly with his hand to usher everyone out.“But… Abba…” protested Gavriel.“Oh, feh, don’t worry,” he waved dismissively.  “I’ll keep myself alive until you get back.  Trust me, you’ll get your chance to say goodbye.  But now I must have private words with the Doctor.”Reluctantly, his offspring trudged out of the room and closed the door behind themselves.  The Doctor sat himself in an upright chair near the head of the bed.“I knew you would come,” said the aged Rabbi.“It was fortunate that I was able to be here now.  I just got back from speaking at a conference in London, and only have a day at home now before the next one in Singapore.”“And yet, I knew with complete certainty that I would see you again before I die.  I cannot allow myself to die yet.  Not until I have entrusted you with a sacred mission.”The Doctor leaned closer, brows furrowed.  “A sacred mission, Rebbe?”“Yes.  I could be dramatic and say the whole world depends on it.  But it doesn’t matter what I say, because I know you will do it anyway.  And, all going well, you could even be back here before I shuffle off this mortal coil, to tell me you succeeded.  But even if not, I know you will succeed.”“Thank you for your confidence in me, Rebbe – I think.”  The Doctor raised an eyebrow.  “What is this mission?”“I wrote it down for you.  Look in the top drawer of my bedside table.  There’s an envelope there, addressed to you.”The Doctor obediently opened the drawer and found the envelope.  He tore it open and scanned the note inside.  As he read it, he blanched.  His eyes widened in disbelief, and his jaw dropped.“Rebbe… are you… serious?  This is… quite, ah… how shall I say it?  Unexpected?”“Much of the time, my dear Doctor, I am not too serious.  My cancer is very serious, so I do have to counterbalance it.  But on this occasion, I am dead serious.  Which is appropriate for someone who is soon to be seriously dead.”The Doctor shook his head, blinking, breathing deeply, coming to terms with his task and all it entailed.  After about half a minute of reflection, he looked the dying man in the eyes.  “Rebbe… you never told me…”The old man nodded weakly, a smile playing on his lips.  “It wasn’t necessary before.  But it is true, and now you know what you have to do.”“My wife…” the Doctor mumbled, still in shock.“You need to do this alone,” instructed the Rabbi.  “Mostly.  The Professor will help you as necessary.  Don’t worry about your wife; she won’t miss you.  You’ll be back within the hour, anyway, possibly sooner, depending on how good your aim is.”  He gave a conspiratorial wink, then winced involuntary in pain.The Doctor took a deep breath, composed himself and stood up.  “Of course I will do it, Rebbe.  Right away.”The old man’s face lit up.  “Good man.  I knew you would.”“Apparently so,” replied the Doctor dryly.“One more thing,” said the Rabbi.  “Please give me that little notepad and a pen.”The Doctor obeyed, holding the notepad upright in the old man’s lap with one hand, and helping him grip the pen in the other.  With limp movements, the dying Rabbi scrawled a sentence on the pad, then tore off the page and handed it to the Doctor with a mischievous smile.The Doctor accepted it with a raised eyebrow.  “I could have made one myself, you know.”“I know,” said the Rabbi with a twinkle in his eye.  “But I couldn’t resist.  By the time you get back you’ll understand why.”“All right, I’ll take your word for it,” replied the Doctor, folding the note along with his instructions and tucking them into his pocket.  He turned as if to leave, then paused for a couple of seconds, took a deep breath and turned back.  “Rebbe, this is an unbelievable honor for me.  Of all your talmidim[6], why me?  I’m certainly not the biggest talmid chacham[7]…”The Rabbi smiled a knowing smile, but did not reply.“Of course,” said his student, divining the answer himself.  “It has to be me.  I understand.  Well then, farewell for now.  And thank you – for everything.”“No,” said the old man.  “Thank you.  What you are about to do means my life to me.”He held out his hand.  As the Doctor took it, the old man pulled him with surprising strength into a tight embrace.  He only released his grip when the pain from his body forced him.Without another word, the Doctor bowed his head, then turned and strode purposefully from the room. 
[1] Literally, “a Great One of the generation”, a term reserved for only the most senior, learned and saintly Rabbis.
[2] Daddy
[3] The Heavenly Court, which judges a person after his death.
[4] Heaven forbid!
[5] “Rebbe” is a term used to address one’s personal teacher, as distinct from “Rabbi”, which is a more general, objective term.
[6] Students

[7] Eminent student

story:
Short Summary

Please join me in the FINAL PHASE of the production of The Administrator: From Board Room and Decision Making to Driving for Uber Part 1&2.

It's a nonfiction that resonates with your every-day audience -- as evidenced -- by a survey group.

Please, accept my heartfelt appreciation for your support.

 

WHERE YOUR CONTRIBUTION WILL GO

The Administrator: From Board Room and Decision Making to Driving for Uber Part 1&2 is just about complete, all that is needed are funds for the final phases of professional editing, printing, publishing, and building a platform of promotional opportunities to maximize the impact and reach of the non-fiction. As stated, we are in the final phases of production and printing, we will ship the 240-page book soon (estimated to ship in June).

I have underwritten the costs and expenses for a professional graphic designer, layout artist, as well as the purchase of ISBN and creation of a barcode, including an eCommerce-ready Word Press website. However, I cannot do it alone. I need a professional editor, expert book review and publicity company, a web designer with expertise in WordPress and eCommerce plugins, as well as production, printing, and book marketing and promotion.

In concert with my investments thus far, the ask of $14,700 will help me cross the finish line -- production and printing of a top-notch book which is in line with the editorial process found in Big House Publishing firms. To that end, your contribution will help me to present a polished version of our book, including a book review service for self-publishers, and Marketing and PR services that help authors get exposed to consumers, Hollywood influencers and executives.

Your generous contribution to this campaign will directly support a self-published first run of The Administrator: From Board Room and Decision Making to Driving for Uber Part 1&2, and with your support, you all will be among my first readers.

What We Need: The Breakdown 

1. Production and printing of 5,000 copies: $8, 502.61

2. Professional Editor:                                           $1,595.00

3. Industry-style book review:                               $495.00

4. Marketing & Book Promotion:                       $3,809.74

5. Word Press (eCommerce-ready):                    $198.65

6. Email Marketing program:                                    $99.00

                                                        TOTAL:             $14,700.00

 

FAQ

When will the book get published?

A special edition of the book will be published within one (1) month after completion of the Indiegogo campaign -- May/June 2017. The book (paperback or hardback) will be shipped to you attractively wrapped.

 

When do I get to see the audiobook and adaptation?

  • Here and now: Your generous contribution to this campaign will directly support the production, printing, and marketing of a self-published first run of The Administrator: From Board Room and Decision Making to Driving for Uber Part 1&2, and with your support, you all will be among my first readers.
  • Next will be the production of the audiobook. The script will take 60 to 90 days to guarantee the highest quality. The strategic projection is to have the audiobook in time for the 2017 Holiday Season.

 

Risks & Challenges

  • Without a doubt -- a worthwhile project has its challenges -- including different moving parts to produce, print and market a top-notch book that reflects the editorial process in line with well-established publishers. Currently, I’m working hard and diligently as well as in consultation with professionals and book-manufacturing experts to make this a reality.
  • The goal is to complete production and printing of The Administrator: From Board Room and Decision Making to Driving for Uber Part 1&2, in spring 2017 and get it to bookshops around the world. By getting the best team on board, and in concert with your generous support and the contributions of other like-minded supporters like you, will make it a reality. Our collaboration will minimize that risk as much as possible.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I hope to count on your support in any way you can, including sharing my Campaign with your family members, closest friends, and even your neighbors.

  • Help me to get the word out and make some noise about The Administrator: A Startling True Story.
  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Many thanks!.

story:
Why This Book?

You get asked to help fund a lot of projects. In some cases your heartstrings get tugged and you feel good helping. In some cases you believe in the product. You think it is cool. You want it for yourself.

In some ways this book is both.

You might be a small business owner with an advertising budget that doesn't seem to reach as far as you would like. You might feel like famed retailer John Wanamaker who said, "Half the money I spend on advertising is wasted. The trouble is I don't know which half." You might feel overwhelmed by all the advertising sales people out there trying to convince you that they have the perfect market for your goods and services. You might be reading blogs and articles about all the newfangled ways you can advertise, about what is the hot new trend, wondering if you need to move your ad dollars there.

Let me tell you a little secret. Most advertising sales people don't know how to use their own product. Sure, they know how to sell it. They don't know how to use it. They only know how others have used it, so they create ads for you that look just like everyone else. Do you really want to look like everyone else?

I know this. I ran a giant, independent retail store for over 20 years. I worked with these salespeople for decades. I spent millions of dollars on advertising, some of it poorly. I had to learn these lessons on my own. I studied with some really smart people. I used these new principles in my own business, testing and modifying as I went along. Now many of those same advertising salespeople from before ask me to teach them what I know.

Let me tell you another little secret. It doesn't matter what media you use. It does matter what you say. This book helps you focus on your message and shows you how to deliver that message in a way that moves people toward your products and services. This book teaches you six principles that you won't find in any other book on advertising (I know, I've read tons of them.)

You might not be a small business owner with an advertising budget. You still want this book printed and published. You've watched your favorite local stores close their doors. You keep thinking, "if only more people knew about them, they would still be here." You did your part. You told all your friends. But it wasn't enough.

This book is for them. It will help them (and you) spread the word more powerfully and effectively. This little book will help keep independent, locally owned businesses open - with your help.

What Your Money Will Do

This is my third book. I know what it costs to do a book right. You do, too. You know a good book starts with great content, written clearly. But there is more than just content. You know a good book is edited for clarity of ideas, edited for proper grammar and punctuation and spelling, edited for continuity and language. You know a good book is formatted properly to look professional on the page. You know a good book will be available in digital as well as print formats. You know a good book has a professionally designed cover that grabs your attention. You know people do judge books by their cover, by their formatting, and by the professionalism of the way they are printed.

Editing, design, formatting, and printing all cost money. So does marketing.

Your support will go to pay for those services. Your support will help get this book launched in front of as many people as possible.

Here is What's In It for You...

Everyone who supports this campaign will get a signed copy of the book. The perks I am offering make it more than a donation. You're buying my products and services (often at discounted prices). 

One perk of incredible value is that I'll help you write ads for your business the way I wrote sample ads for eight other businesses in the book.

Another perk will get you a live webinar for you and your friends. I could even be compelled to stop by and visit for some one-on-one consulting or a daylong workshop for you and anyone you wish to invite. (See http://philsforum.com/retail-speaker/speaker-topics for topics.)

This Book Will Change Lives

Okay, that may seem like a bold and brash statement. But think about it... If one small business survives and grows because of this book, you've helped them and their family and their employees and their community. Multiply that times 100 or 1000 and you can see the power this book can have.

I don't have to tell you all the studies that show how locally-owned businesses are better for a community economically. You've seen those reports. This book won't be read by huge chain stores and major brands. It won't be read by Madison Avenue advertising agencies. (Although it should.) It will be read by local mom & pop shops, local service providers, and local agencies that work with these folks.

Your support helps the little guys take on Goliath and succeed.

This Book Will Launch With or Without You (But I Want You On Board)

The book is written. The book is in the editing process. I have enough money to pay the editor and the cover designer. My problem is that because of some big changes in my life the last few months I am short of cash to do the rest.

With your help I will be able to get this book printed and uploaded digitally by mid-June with a marketing campaign behind it. Together, you and I will be helping small businesses everywhere.

Without your help, it may be several months before the book is finished. But it will get done. Okay, maybe that isn't a compelling, powerful pitch to help convince you to donate. I only tell you this so that you know whether this campaign hits the goal or not, this book is launching. 

I want you on board to help me. The more money we raise, the sooner we can get this book into the hands of businesses who really need it.

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you can't support financially right now. I understand. You can still help. Here are some other things you can do...

  • Share this campaign with your favorite locally owned businesses.
  • Share this on your social media platforms.
  • Share this with business leaders and organizations like your Chamber of Commerce, Downtown Development Authority, Main Street Program, and Economic Development team.
  • Share this with your local ad salespeople. Tell your local radio and television stations about it.

Indiegogo has some cool sharing tools to help you spread the word.

Mostly, thanks. Thank you for sticking with me to the bottom of this pitch. Thank you for your support, whether time, money, or both. Every little bit helps.

Risks & Challenges

I am not a full time author at this stage in my career, and my time is split between being a father, husband, and my regular job. As you can imagine it can be hard at times having the opportunity to work on writing when I want. Those this is true it did not stop me from completing my first book. My goals could be delayed, but it will not stop me from completing this journey!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Just share my story and campaign details with as many people as you can. Even if you can't contribute or don't want to everybody has the potential to reach someone who can. Let them know that contributing goes toward a good cause, and will help bring a new book to print!

story:
I am  Emeraude Nicolas, a creative director based  in Paris. I see  the incredible waste the fashion industry is generating. Apparel and the shoemaking industries account for 8% of the greenhouse emissions on the planet, the same as the whole european union in all it’s industries. Fashion wastes 5 trillion litters of water each year in dying processes for fabrics. Because I work with  the  fashion/ beauty and jewellery industry, I felt a responsibility to generate conscience and highlight the people who are working to make our beautiful industry take better steps to respect our planet. I decided to start this magazine printed on ecological paper made of kiwi residues and other fruits to really inspire people to think outside the box and act.

http://www.thinktwice-magazine.com
story_txt:
I am  Emeraude Nicolas, a creative director based  in Paris. I see  the incredible waste the fashion industry is generating. Apparel and the shoemaking industries account for 8% of the greenhouse emissions on the planet, the same as the whole european union in all it’s industries. Fashion wastes 5 trillion litters of water each year in dying processes for fabrics. Because I work with  the  fashion/ beauty and jewellery industry, I felt a responsibility to generate conscience and highlight the people who are working to make our beautiful industry take better steps to respect our planet. I decided to start this magazine printed on ecological paper made of kiwi residues and other fruits to really inspire people to think outside the box and act.
http://www.thinktwice-magazine.com

story:
Acerca de El Bujero.

El Bujero es una novela de ficción al cien por cien, pero que hunde sus raíces en la forma de vida de un tiempo y un lugar que son totalmente reales.

También algunos de los personajes que se nombran en el libro, siempre de pasada y sin ningún tipo de protagonismo en la historia, son reales, son personas que han existido o existen aún, y que han dejado su huella en la historia de un pueblo por otra parte cargado de historia y de historias.

Tarifa está enclavada en el extremo más meridional de Europa, a tan solo 13 km de la costa africana y en la conjunción del Océano Atlántico y el Mar Mediterráneo.

En la novela Juan Martín, un jubilado, encuentra un cadáver durante uno de sus paseos por La Caleta, paraje que combina acantilados con pequeñas calas formadas por losas de roca y guijarros.

A ese primer cadáver seguirán otros sin que ni la Guardia Civil, ni el propio Juan Martín que empieza a tener pesadillas extrañas desde el primer hallazgo, encuentren una explicación  a dichas apariciones, ya que no existen denuncias sobre desapariciones ni se consigue identificar a las víctimas.

La trama lleva, al propio Juan Martín, al teniente de la Guardia Civil, Luis Barea y a la sargento Sara Arjona a vivir una experiencia única, que les obliga a actuar al margen de las autoridades.

Cuanto y para qué

Para publicar la novela son necesarios, ya lo habréis visto, 1.600€ que serán destinados íntegramente a los gastos derivados de la edición, impresión y trámites legales que el proceso conlleva y también, como no,  a la obtención de las recompensas que ofrezco por vuestra ayuda.

Le he dado muchas vueltas a como explicar la recompensa que yo obtendré por la consecución de este proyecto y, la verdad, no es nada fácil porque si digo que será la satisfacción de la publicación, de ver el libro en las librerías mentiría.

La recompensa de escribir es el acto en sí mismo: el escribir, el verte en los zapatos de los personajes, el buscar las localizaciones... La publicación es casi una consecuencia y el placer, claro de que otros lean una historia que hasta ese momento ha sido solo tuya. 

Es difícil que una historia como la que se cuenta en El Bujero ayude a nadie en ningún sentido, pero creo sinceramente que a muchos nos recordará como era la vida hace unos años, como eran los pueblos, los coches, las calles y las gentes. 

Si a los que conocen los lugares que se narran, que son todos reales y se pueden visitar, les trae a la memoria o simplemente les descubre como eran hace unos años será una gran satisfacción para mi si me lo hacen saber, de hecho alguno que ha leído ya el libro me lo ha manifestado así y eso me alegra enormemente.

Y si los que no conocen ese fantástico lugar en el mundo deciden ir después de leer el libro pues me alegrará aún más.

Por eso es por lo que pido vuestro apoyo y por lo que os doy las gracias.

Para finalizar

No voy a glosar aquí mis aptitudes y calificaciones para escribir una historia, no tengo ninguna, tan solo la afición y cincuenta o cincuenta y cinco años, de los sesenta y uno que tengo, como lector impenitente y eso, algo, ayuda. Además tonto no soy ( modesto tampoco), no lo hago mal.

SI alguien quiere comprobarlo puede hacerlo visitando mi blog,  https://www.elgrafema.com/  

Gracias a todos por vuestra colaboración, comentarios y cualquier otro tipo de ayuda que queráis aportar.

story:
Greetings, earthlings! My name is Cameron Drury, and I'm just an ordinary businessman by day who decided to write a novel by night. It's about pet ferrets who become self-aware, and go on a hilariously absurd mission to make their dreams come true: Land on the moon and trek amongst the cosmos!

I'm launching this campaign to make my own dream come true: To turn this passion project of mine into a paperback book that both kids and adults can enjoy for years to come.

My hope is that by your help and support, I can get this story out to you and the world. I am genuinely proud of this tale, and I believe it will inspire you, make you cry of laughter, warm your heart, creep you out, and keep you on the edge of your seat!

I aim to Publish by December 2020

Here is a link to the First Chapter!

Follow my Instagram @captain_hob 

 

"He was very adorable with a mostly off-white coat, a long dark streak down his back, and a dark circle around his left eye that made him appear like a little bandit or pirate. However, his stance and general attitude suggested an eagerness to exercise mischief and domination."

- Chapter 1: Operation Cherry Pie

 

 

        

Have you ever imagined what would happen if ferrets became self-aware beings, capable of complex thought and dialogue? Neither did I, until one fateful day... One sunny afternoon, my mind was illuminated by unseen forces, and the story of The Cosmic Adventures of Captain Hob flooded into my consciousness like a stampede of happy and cheerful penguins.

I am not a writer, and work in a corporate environment as a consultant. But, being possessed by this hilariously absurd and heartwarming story, I worked long nights and managed to complete this 44,000 word novel in less than a month. I HAD to tell the tale of these adorable little ferrets, and my pen just about erupted into flames as I pounded out the story from my mind onto paper.  

 

"The Captain looked out the rear window and saw those dreaded blue lights of the Law flashing behind them like bad omens. “Oh rats! It’s the law! Get this baby into OVERDRIVE!” yelled the Captain as he braced himself. Jill shifted the knob into top gear as Ivanov slammed on the gas pedal below like an angry judge's gavel, rocketing the crew down the road like a bat out of Hades."

- Chapter 15: Hot Pursuit.

 

 

   

        --Cover Art Concept I gave artist for direction--

It's a tale about an ordinary pet ferret who becomes self-aware after an alien star-ship crashes into his room. Follow the brave and mischievous Captain Hob on his incredibly daring mission to kidnap three other ferrets to build his crew and repair the downed alien ship, all while being pursued by a vengeful rotund mailman and mysterious dark figures. Will the Captain and his brave crew of ferrets achieve their dream of traveling into space, or will they be caught and their secret mission be made known? Found out in this comedic and heartwarming story where four ferrets prove that we are all meant to do great and incredible things.

Here is a link to the First Chapter!

 

"The full moon’s light pierced its way through some straggling storm clouds, shining down on Captain Hob as goosebumps spread all over his beefy little frame. At that moment, the beautiful round luminescence of the moon cemented its way into his little brain and heart. In his prior life behind bars, he would look out at the moon at night sometimes, jumping up with all his might in an attempt to fly towards it." 

- Chapter 4: The Escape Plan

 

First off, if you choose to donate, I cannot thank you enough! You are helping me in ways I cannot properly re-thank!

I will self-publish this story as both a paperback book and e-book. In order to get this novel ready, I will need your help so I can have the following things done:

  • Edits - I'll need an editor to help me get this polished to perfection. ---$350
  • Formatting - I'll need someone to format the book properly before it's printed. --- $100
  • Art - I'll need money for the Front Cover and Illustration---$1000
  • Printing - Printing costs for the Physical Perk Copies. --- $700

 

STRREEEEETTCCHH Goals 

 

  • $3000 - Illustration for each Chapter (16 chapters)
  • $4000 - So many possibilities... 

 

“Life can be painful, and sometimes we lose things along the way. Sometimes risks and pain scare us from doing the great and incredible things we were born and destined to do. But if we have dreams, even when we lose things in this life or are afraid, we will always have something to hold onto, and that is what makes life truly worth living."

- Captain Hob

 

      

If you decide to help me on my mission to bring this sweeping tale to printing press, you'll be directly contributing to a book that will bring many kids and adults joy and several hours of wholesome entertainment. It'll have more impact then when the Putorius crashed into Captain Hob's room for crying out loud. THAT'S A LOT OF DAMAGE! But meme-related jokes aside, any contribution you make, big or small, will help me make my dream come true of telling a story that will stick with people and inspire them, along with having convulsions from laughing at my ridiculous attempts at cracking jokes...

 

"A long silver metallic object lay in the center of the large room, shrouded in steam and smoke. An ominous aura surrounded the mysterious intruder, as it was illuminated by green lights that slowly blinked at the top and bottom of the structure."

- Chapter 2: The Impact

story:
Who is responsible for this Captain Grant Marsh history mystery?     

It’s July 4, 2026, the 250th birthday of the United States of America! Thousands of people watching fireworks along the Missouri River near Mandan and Bismarck, North Dakota, get a huge surprise at the end of the fireworks display. A beautifully-lit old steamboat slowly moves past them on the Missouri River. Amazingly, it’s the Far West steamboat, once piloted by Captain Grant Marsh. It had traveled this same route coming back from the Battle of the Little Big Horn with wounded 150 years earlier in 1876—when the United States had just finished celebrating its 100th birthday.

This begins a mystery, with lots of history, involving the life of the greatest steamboatman in history—Captain Grant Marsh! Numerous historical photos and illustrations add to this adventure.

About Author Kevin Kremer

Kevin Kremer got a big surprise when he began researching the life of Grant Marsh. There were so many exciting and interesting adventures that happened during Captain Marsh’s long life. As Kremer was learning more about him, he got a huge bonus—learning about steamboats and the Steamboat Era, things that were mostly new to him.

Kremer grew up in Mandan, North Dakota, and he loves to write books involving that area. He also likes to include his favorite places in Mandan and Bismarck in his writing—including Ohm’s Cafe and A&B Pizza.

Dr. Kremer has written, edited, and published more than 100 books, and he loves writing children’s books the most.

Where will the money go? 

Any money contributed will be used to pay for the first printing plus the pre-publishing expenses, including book design, travel, illustrations, and historical photos.

What about the perks?

Kevin Kremer has designed perks that will enable contributors to get the first signed books at less than the cover price, one or two months before the signed books are available to anyone else. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help spread the word about this campaign.

story:
Mit navn er Diana Lund.

Min kæreste som jeg bor sammen med har sclerose og jeg mistede min far til kræft i sommeren 2018.

Jeg har besluttet mig for at skrive en bog om det at være pårørende, da rigtig mange pårørende glemmer sig selv i forbindelse med svære sygdomsforløb. 

Det kan være rigtig hårdt, grundet de mange praktiske ting, som er forbundet med det at have en syg tæt på sig. For ikke at nævne det store psykiske pres, som kan blive så stort at pårørende desværre rammes af sygdomme som stress og depression.

Bogen handler netop om at være pårørende, og jeg fortæller naturligvis min egen historie, men jeg har også været ude og interviewe andre pårørende, som har det helt tæt inde på livet, og som har måttet træffe mange tunge og svære valg undervejs.

Det bliver desuden en bog med gode råd til hvordan vi som pårørende passer på os selv i en hård proces. For det er desværre ofte svært at vide hvor man skal henvende sig for at få hjælp, og ofte også at få hjælpen, før man selv bliver syg.

Faktum er at 1 ud af 3 danskere får kræft inden de fylder 75, ca. 16.000 danskere har sclerose, 50.000 har epilepsi og omkring 75.000 lider af en spiseforstyrrelse. Bag dem står de pårørende, så problemet er ægte, og noget vi er nødt til at forholde os til.

For at kunne producere bogen har jeg valgt at gøre brug af crowdfunding. Det betyder at du som privatperson, eller firma, kan støtte/forudbestille bogen og andre relaterede ting som f.eks. foredrag. Bogen leveres når den udkommer i efteråret 2019.

Målet er at samle 78.000 kr sammen. Det dækker 53.000 kr til korrektur, grafisk arbejde og opsætning af bogen, 19.000 kr til tryk af 500 bøger, samt 6.000 kr til markedsføring.

Jeg håber du vil hjælpe mig med at sprede dette meget vigtige budskab. Kontakt mig gerne ved spørgsmål eller for uddybende info.

Mvh Diana Lund

story:
Short Summary

I started an Instagram account for Elvis four years ago in an effort to share my special moments with him to add some positivity into the world. Since then, I've been able to build a community who genuinely enjoy the content Elvis and I create and put out into the world. I've been able to connect with people all over the world and brighten their day through sharing original photos and videos of Elvis. We regularly use our platform to bring awareness to causes close to our hearts such as mental health awareness, animal welfare & responsible pet-ownership. As someone who faces daily battles with anxiety & depression, the past year was particularly fraught with challenges such as a heartbreak, career changes & supporting parents throughout their battle with cancer. I feel very lucky to have Elvis by my side through these trying times and he has taught me so much about being present, resilient and grateful for the beauty of those fleeting ordinary moments. I created this book as an expression of gratitude, in an effort to give back to the universe for giving me the opportunity to learn and grow with this magnificent dog. This book is filled with daily reminders & joyful messages and my intention is to spread this message of positivity as far as I can. I like to describe it as a children's book for adults because both the images & messages resonate with both adults and children. I fundamentally believe that teaching young people about mindfulness & presence can change their lives for the better and that's exactly what I would love your help to do. With your help I hope to print as many copies of this book as I can and donate it to schools, hospitals and absolutely anywhere that could use a little ray of sunshine. Best of all, your contributions will also support local businesses because this book will be printed in Canada. Ultimately I would love to print and distribute as many copies as I can so I can work with a publisher and reach even more people, and create more books & content!  I truly believe that the messages contained within the pages of this book has the ability to change the way you look at life, and will at the very least bring a smile to your face. 

What We Need & What You Get

We would love to raise  $6,000 to fund the following initiatives: 

- Multiple print runs to donate copies to schools, hospitals & libraries.

- All the shipping and distribution.

- Work with other creatives to create content. 

Whatever I raise will be put into printing copies of this book to get it in the hands of as many people as possible in the places that need it the most. 

The Impact

Together we can add a little more positivity into the world and spread the message of presence & mindfulness to shift ways of thinking that can help turn children into healthy adults and sad adults into happier ones. 

Through the Instagram community I have been able to create with my content, I have seen the ways in which Elvis has impacted the lives of countless strangers around the world and know that this impact can be reached even further with your help.

Risks & Challenges

My commitment to support local businesses by  printing in Canada definitely comes at a cost but it is well worth it to me. 

Shipping and distribution is something I have been funding and handling myself, with your help I can take it even further. 

Through this project & my work as a creative content creator, I have also been able connect and support other entrepreneurs and freelance creatives by collaborating on like-minded projects and initiatives that seek to make the world a little more beautiful. 

Other Ways You Can Help

story_txt:
Short Summary
I started an Instagram account for Elvis four years ago in an effort to share my special moments with him to add some positivity into the world. Since then, I've been able to build a community who genuinely enjoy the content Elvis and I create and put out into the world. I've been able to connect with people all over the world and brighten their day through sharing original photos and videos of Elvis. We regularly use our platform to bring awareness to causes close to our hearts such as mental health awareness, animal welfare & responsible pet-ownership. As someone who faces daily battles with anxiety & depression, the past year was particularly fraught with challenges such as a heartbreak, career changes & supporting parents throughout their battle with cancer. I feel very lucky to have Elvis by my side through these trying times and he has taught me so much about being present, resilient and grateful for the beauty of those fleeting ordinary moments. I created this book as an expression of gratitude, in an effort to give back to the universe for giving me the opportunity to learn and grow with this magnificent dog. This book is filled with daily reminders & joyful messages and my intention is to spread this message of positivity as far as I can. I like to describe it as a children's book for adults because both the images & messages resonate with both adults and children. I fundamentally believe that teaching young people about mindfulness & presence can change their lives for the better and that's exactly what I would love your help to do. With your help I hope to print as many copies of this book as I can and donate it to schools, hospitals and absolutely anywhere that could use a little ray of sunshine. Best of all, your contributions will also support local businesses because this book will be printed in Canada. Ultimately I would love to print and distribute as many copies as I can so I can work with a publisher and reach even more people, and create more books & content!  I truly believe that the messages contained within the pages of this book has the ability to change the way you look at life, and will at the very least bring a smile to your face. 





What We Need & What You Get
We would love to raise  $6,000 to fund the following initiatives: 
- Multiple print runs to donate copies to schools, hospitals & libraries.
- All the shipping and distribution.
- Work with other creatives to create content. 
Whatever I raise will be put into printing copies of this book to get it in the hands of as many people as possible in the places that need it the most. 


The Impact
Together we can add a little more positivity into the world and spread the message of presence & mindfulness to shift ways of thinking that can help turn children into healthy adults and sad adults into happier ones. 
Through the Instagram community I have been able to create with my content, I have seen the ways in which Elvis has impacted the lives of countless strangers around the world and know that this impact can be reached even further with your help.

Risks & Challenges
My commitment to support local businesses by  printing in Canada definitely comes at a cost but it is well worth it to me. 
Shipping and distribution is something I have been funding and handling myself, with your help I can take it even further. 
Through this project & my work as a creative content creator, I have also been able connect and support other entrepreneurs and freelance creatives by collaborating on like-minded projects and initiatives that seek to make the world a little more beautiful. 


Other Ways You Can Help
You can follow us on Instagram @ElvisPawsleyTheCorgi to enjoy and share the content we create! 
Help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign,  feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Who We Are

Siaara Freeman (she/her) is a performance poet who has travelled around  the world sharing her poems centering in her identity as an Urban Black Queer Femme.  Her book, Good Morning Hood Warning, is inspired by a need to show there is joy where most least expect it. She is driven to make herself and her talents accessible, because she believes that is the key to grace. She wants queer writer's to feel seen without a heteronormative gaze.

Lou Barrett (they/them) runs a Cleveland based publishing company called Purpled Palm Press, which only publishes writing by LGBTQ+ people. They released their own series, Pen Dive, which centers around a lesbian living in the Midwest; It's everything you could wish for in a dramedy, but with queer people. Lou's mission is to help eliminate shame around being LGBTQ+ one book, poem, or heartfelt conversation at a time. They also do everything they can to put Cleveland "on the map" as a place for queer culture and entertainment.

With both of our passions combined, we have decided to create an annual queer writing retreat called Outsiders.

Outsiders is dedicated to providing accessible writing support to queer writers in the Midwest by hosting an annual inclusive writing retreat in Southern, Ohio.

Through building community and giving writing workshops, writers can leave the retreat feeling more equipped to finish projects and use their LGBTQ+ identities to positively influence their writing.

Why We're Crowdfunding

We are doing a lot of local fundraising throughout the summer. However, people have asked us where they can donate to our project and we wanted a place that was easy and accessible for people to donate to if they wanted to.

Outsiders will take 8 writers who are chosen through a submission process. We require a 25 dollar submission fee from writers, but after that we aren't requiring any payment or fees from writers who are chosen to participate in this retreat.

That means that writers coming to Outsiders will get:

  • Four days and three nights stay in a cabin in Southern, Ohio
  • Delicious meals from local businesses for their time with us
  • Workshops by published authors in a variety of writing disciplines (all LGBTQ+)
  • Their work published in an anthology created by Purpled Palm Press
  • Four blissful days being surrounded by fellow queer people while building community and sharing space with each other

... all for 25 dollars.

We wanted to make sure that this retreat would be accessible to people in varying income brackets. It didn't feel fair or right to hold a writing retreat for queer people that required them to pay hundreds of dollars.

This means we have to cover the costs of the cabin, the workshop hosts, the food, etc etc.

We have started connecting with people to get some of the food donated. We feel confident that we can make this happen with or without donations because of our submission fee.

However, we wanted to give you the chance to donate to this if it's something you believe in.

The Book

We don't want you to give us money to fund this without getting something in return. The Outsiders Queer Writing Retreat participants will submit a finished piece of their writing as a part of their participation in our retreat. Purpled Palm Press will publish an anthology of the writing produced at the retreat, which will be released in the beginning of 2020.

As long as you donate at least 25 dollars, you'll get a copy of the book signed by us: Siaara Freeman and Lou Barrett.

For 50 dollars your book will be signed by not only the two of us, but the 8 writers participating in Outsiders as well.

Other Ways You Can Help

Something like this retreat take a lot more than money. We are happy to accept donations of items such as:

  • Notebooks
  • Pens
  • Pencils
  • Snacks
  • Food
  • Drinks (tea, coffee, water, etc)
  • Gas cards
  • Queer stuff
  • Anything you can think of that you think we haven't thought of!

story:
Welcome to Salix Kids

 

Salix Kids strives to create wholesome, inspirational, and relevant content for parents and children to enjoy together. 

I'm Willow, I created Salix Kids because I saw a need for children's content that teaches kindness, self-esteem, and social and emotional growth, without sacrificing quality story telling and parent's interest. I believe it is possible to have children's content that is loved equally by kids and grownups alike. 

My first project is Actually, I Can. The story of Ruth, a spunky young girl who is struggling to find her place in this world. It seems everyone around her is telling her what she can and can't do. In Actually, I Can you get to follow Ruth along her journey of finding her voice, and being the strongest she can be. 

 

Here's where you come in

I need help making this dream come true. I am asking for donations to make this dream a reality. 

What I Need & What You Get

I need $2000 to make this happen. 

Money raised from this campaign will be used for:

  • Illustration costs
    • I am so excited to be partnering with an amazing illustrator for this project. Monica Pearson has a Master's Degree in Graphic Design from Iowa State University, and just so happens to be one of my dearest friends.
  • Printing costs
  • Advertising costs

The amount you could contribute is very flexible. Each amount includes the correlating incentive, as well as each incentive listed in the lesser amounts.

  • $500 - Receive two personalized Actually, I Can 8X10 inch posters. Each poster will be personalized with the name and likeness of your choosing.
  • $250- Receive one personalized Actually, I Can 8X10 inch poster. (See above description)
  • $100- Receive a standard Actually, I Can 8X10 inch poster. This poster will feature our main character, Ruth, standing proudly under the words, "Actually, I Can".
  • $50- Get your name in the "special thanks to" section of the book
  • $25- Get a signed copy of Actually, I Can  with a personalized message 
  • $20- Get an Actually, I Can tee shirt or onesie
  • $10- Get a copy of Actually, I Can  upon printing. US Shipping costs included

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute financially, you can still help me! 

Get the word out about my project! 
Post about my project on facebook, email your friends and family, share this page with anyone you know.

Post multiple times to keep this campaign in people's minds.

Use indiegogo's sharing tools to easily share this project VIA Facebook, twitter and other social medias.

 

If you have any questions about Salix Kids or Actually, I Can feel free to email me at salixkids@gmail.com

Thank you so much for taking the time to check out my project, I hope you chose to contribute!

story:
Greetings!

My name is Monte Stone. I'm a published expert on the works of Richard Wagner. I am the producer and author of The Ring Disc: An Interactive Guide to Wagner's Ring Cycle. The New York Times called it "...the most complete, accessible, and sophisticated guide to Wagner's Ring ever created...an amazing tool".  Since its release 20 years ago I have watched with dismay as many books and articles have appeared claiming that Wagner "influenced" Hitler;  some insisting that Wagner bears responsibility for World War II and the Holocaust. This "theory " it total rubbish, and my book proves it with excruciatingly detailed documentation. Simply put,  Adolf Hitler never said or wrote a word about "Wagnerian inspiration", and the "theory" is  fiction contrived from a few Hitler "quotations" from thoroughly debunked sources. Among them:

Hitler never said "Whoever wants to understand National Socialism must know Wagner". 

Hitler's "new interpretation" of Parsifal and "Parsifal religion" come from two ass-covering "former" Nazis, one of whom was hanged at Nuremberg in 1946. The two Nazis plagiarized  an obscure Nazi musicologist writing in 1931, placing his words on Hitler's lips.

The Nazi rallying cry "Germany Awake!" does not come from Die Meistersinger, but from Hitler's pal Dietrich Eckart. 

It is vitally important to set the record straight on this issue, not only for admirers of Wagner's operas, but also for proponents of honest and empirical Third Reich history.

My book is written. Buy an advance copy.

My book is finished and edited, and a designer is working on it now. This campaign will cover the costs of editor and designer, and the printing costs of the first edition. The book will be issued as a high quality paperback.

The "perks" program is pretty straight forward. Your contribution buys an advance copy of the finished book, hot off the press. I am asking those who are able to purchase additional copies for distribution to reviewers, publicists, Wagner Societies, etc.

Visit the FAQ for more information. Please feel free to contact me with any questions.

Please share the fundraiser far and wide! Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
My Campaign for Hollywood Weekly is simple: Help us continue our Mission of using Entertainment to connect and unite people around the World by subscribing to my Publication. That's it. Every reader counts to me. Your subscription to Hollywood Weekly Magazine is part of the Global Synergy that has catapulted my Publication onto the World stage -- but there is much more work to be done. 

I'm creating an infrastructure for a Movement of Cultural Acceptance and Understanding through "Entertainment" as a common denominator that binds people around the World. By subscribing to Hollywood Weekly Magazine YOU become part of that Movement.   

My Personal Story..

Began when I moved to Mississippi from Germany as a young boy, and was introduced to the legacy of cultural insensitivity in the American South. My father was a military man, and he and my mother were stationed in Germany, where I was born. I had just finished second grade when my family moved back to America. Southern acclimation for a young black boy coming from Europe was not easy. All of my friends in school back in Germany were children of military parents. It was a multicultural education, but more importantly, there was unity amongst the children: regardless of the color or original heritage or ancestry of any individual child, all my friends  and classmates in Europe were united and bonded by one fact -- they were all American. Things were, to say the least, more black and white for me in the United States.

By the time I graduated high school, I wanted to recreate the harmonious, loving friendships that I experienced as a child with all the other military children of various ethnicities- with one
exception: my dream was to connect people around the planet as Citizens of the World. Through HW our publication has systematically made its way around the world. Spreading the message of multicultural acceptance and “Celebrating Diversity In The Entertainment Industry.”

My Campaign for Hollywood Weekly is simple: Help us continue our Mission of using Entertainment to connect and unite people around the World by subscribing to my Publication. That's it. Every reader counts to me. Your subscription to Hollywood Weekly Magazine is part of the Global Synergy that has catapulted my Publication onto the World stage -- but there is much more work to be done. 

 

WHY WE NEED YOUR DONATION

Part of your donation will go towards costs associated with running Hollywood Weekly Magazine. This includes:

Printing costs, creating magazine content (paying writers, staff, contributors) 

Photography, editorial, we need assistance

Cost of website development & hosting fees

Miscellaneous costs including business registration, barcode purchase, copyrights & trademark, accounting, shipping, and legal fees

Basic advertising costs to promote the magazine and calls for submissions via digital and print collateral

The cost of fulfilling the print copies is fully covered by the perk levels

 

We have worked with big stars, such as Monsta X and Ringo Starr.

Hollywood Weekly Magazine attends Anime Expo 2019 (featuring the Hollywood Weekly sweatshirt).

 

Hollywood Weekly covers huge events and festivals, like Real Street Fest and Once Upon a Time in the LBC.

WHAT WE NEED, WHAT YOU GET & THE IMPACT YOUR HELP MAKES

A 12-Month Subscription to Hollywood Weekly Magazine is $95. Every Month you will receive a copy of Hollywood Weekly Magazine, which will bring stories in the Entertainment Industry from around the world. The faces you see in Hollywood Weekly reflect the faces you see around you every day, and hopefully will help you understand the people behind those different faces around you. That's where change starts. But let's get to the Fun:

I've always found great joy in providing access to Hollywood and the Entertainment Industry to people striving for a career in this business, or simply everyday folks who love Hollywood and would love to attend red carpet premieres and exclusive Hollywood events. Anyone who purchases a 12-Month Subscription to Hollywood Weekly Magazine will receive complimentary tickets to my 6th Annual Hollywood Weekly Film Festival being held at Warner Brothers Studio in Burbank, California.

Thank you so much for your interest in Hollywood Weekly Magazine. We're going to change the face of Hollywood and spread Cultural Acceptance around the World one subscriber at a time

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP​

Tell friends and family

Share this campaign

Follow us on Social Media:

Instagram: @hollywoodweekly

Twitter: @hollywoodweekly

Facebook:https://www.facebook.com/HollywoodWeeklyMagazine/

story:
About Last Reason Jr.

I am an expat with 2 full time jobs - being one of them, raising three kids. Wishing for a private life, I use a pseudonym that has been in the family for a while.

*(Last reason was a writer from Uruguay around the 1920s and 1930s).

 

About PLEH

"PLEH. No warning" is a little book that I began writing a long time ago, soon after I started working with climate change.

I used many, many lunch breaks and precious moments of "free time" to write myself emails and notes with ideas. Of course, it took me years to organize that mess and make some sense out of it. I mainly wanted to share some thoughts with my kids.  And maybe with you too?

Find the first chapters here:

https://www.lastreason.me/

 

Why Support

---Any earning from PLEH  will be used to protect natural land and fund environmental education activities---

Goal 1 - I'm writing PLEH in Spanish, my mother tongue. With your support, I would be able to translate PLEH into English. In addition, I would also like to include simple illustrations for the "quotes" within PLEH. 

Goal 2 - Any earning beyond the campaign goals will be used to support the development and implementation of Caballito de Mar, a transformative education project in Punta del Diablo, Uruguay. (For more details, please visit: https://sustainablelife.school/caballitodemar-eng).

​ 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please share.
  • Any ideas? Please write! lastreasonjr@gmail.com

story:
Background

First, a snippet...

The beginning is the ending and the ending is the beginning. These are the words silence offered to me as I contemplated how to open this story. Where do I start? How did it all begin? Where exactly do I demarcate the before and the after when there are so many lines? I try to stretch it out linearly in my mind, but it recoils. Folding, spiraling, weaving, shifting, integrating.

“I want you to go back now, to one of your earliest childhood memories. In 10, 9, 8, 7… Be there.” Prior to the group hypnosis, Dr. Brian Weiss asked us to pay attention to feelings, messages, and themes expressed during the regression; for what we would receive in that moment is what we were meant to receive. I was expecting a dramatic, pivotal memory. The divorce of my parents or the death of my grandmother maybe. But pivotal is relative.

Following the gentle countdown, I saw myself at the beginning of my life, about four years old, in vivid technicolor. Almost naked, save for the plain white underwear clinging to my little body, shrill giggles emerged from my being, penetrating the heat of a long past Louisiana summer. My cousin was there too. Consumed with bliss, we ran and danced through the sprinklers in our grandparents’ front yard.

As I observed cars passing on the busy highway in front of the house, I didn’t give a damn I was naked in full view of passersby. As I gazed at my grandmother, my mom and my aunt lounging in lawn chairs nearby, I knew I was loved. As I lay on the cool ground with soggy grass between my toes and sunlight spattering down on me between the needles of pine trees, I understood oneness. And the silence offered these words: “This is who you really are. You are joy. You are love. You are free.” Tears welled up and bathed this moment of knowing whispered to me from the universe. That had been me. Before sexual abuse. Before heartbreaks. Before illness. Before debt. Before suicide. Before the before evanesced into illusion. Before I would find it, lying veiled within the after and beyond.

The beginning is the ending and the ending is the beginning.

*****

Hi, I'm Laurie, the naked girl in the sprinklers. You've just read the opening of my memoir, The Suicide Slippers, a weaving, winding, labyrinth of a tale.

There was a time when authoring a book didn’t exist in my realm of possibilities. Writing was a side note reserved for journals, for processing melodramas and difficult break-ups. If writing failed me, I’d call my go-to guy, Phil, who always talked me through the shittiest of times.

Phil. He and I had fallen in love and dated until life’s circumstances separated us, but our bond endured. It was his pushing that prompted me to begin the healing process for my childhood trauma, and in many ways, I viewed him as my savior. 

In July of 2012, Phil took his own life. I couldn't save my savior. Suicide killed him. It killed everything I thought I was and everything I thought I knew. After he left, I looked down at my feet and wondered how or if they could step out of the dilapidated shelter I found myself in. They were not adorned with the ruby slippers I’d always dreamed about, but imprisoned in shoes I’d never asked for, nor conceived of. I was left with the choice to stand my ground and disintegrate, or to break them in.

All bearings lost, I walked, I wandered, I fell on my ass and I walked some more. Along the way I sought a companion—a guidebook that spoke my language, but no such book had been written, so I released my own words. Writing became something I had to do—to survive, to heal, to educate, to shatter stigma, to connect. I wanted to talk about what no one else wanted to. I wanted people to understand that Phil wasn't selfish or a coward. When I discovered unconventional, mindful, novel ways of enduring grief, I wanted to scream them from the rooftops and scatter the pages for the world to find. 

When life threw more obstacles my way, I set writing aside. My healing evolution continued, and without conscious effort, the story entered a massive collecting era, culminating into a solo trip to Thailand in 2018. There, I was met with wonder and mishaps and parallels and metaphors galore. I wrote it all down in the journal I brought with me--a flimsy pink one with gold pineapples on it. Upon returning home, words continued to pour out and didn’t stop until there was a book.

What's in the book?

  • A raw account of enduring childhood trauma, suicide grief and stigma
  • An invitation to join me in my steps and missteps, adventures and misadventures as I intertwine my childhood, my story with Phil and my trip to Thailand, to convene in one destination--home. 
  • F-bombs. Suicide, when it came to me, wasn't coated in sugar, that's why.
  • Humor. Because when the heavy parts aren't coated in sugar, doses of humor make them more digestible.
  • The impact of stigma--a call to raise awareness. 
  • Complications of traumatic grief
  •  A collection of unconventional, new-agey, mindfulness-heavy tools to navigate grief and trauma
  • Spiritual evolution, resilience, transcendence, hope

 

If I had to sum up the feedback from my beta readers, it would be this: “You’re a dumbass if you don’t pursue this.” This book will be life-changing for people, they say. They say it and the oldest, wisest part of me knows it too. And so, onward I go. This is where you come in…

 

Funding--What for?

  • It's not easy being an un-famous, first-time, non-fiction author. I've got an important message, but what I don't have, as a semi-normal person, is a plethora of social media followers. Big publishers ain't got time for that.
  • But...smaller publishing houses might, or there's self-publishing (see my FAQ's as to why this is not a cop out).
  • Before I send this manuscript/book proposal out to potential publishers and agents, I want it to be as polished as possible, which means professional editing is a must. I've sent a sample to an agency here in Austin. One of their editors, a New York Times bestselling author wants to take it on and I'd like to take her up on that. 
  • Developmental and copy editing will cost at least $5,000.
  • If I don't reach my fundraising goal, it's all good. Any little bit will help. Every step forward is a step closer.

 

The Impact

  • A person who has lost someone to suicide is almost 10 times more likely to die from suicide themselves in the aftermath. When it happened to me, I felt isolated and directionless. I wanted to die. This is the book I needed but couldn't find. I know it will be a valuable find for others--a connection, a companion, maybe even life-saving.
  • This book isn't only for suicide loss survivors. It can benefit anyone who has ever dealt with trauma, grief or an innate feeling of defectiveness or disconnectedness.
  • It will be a useful guide for knowing how to approach or deal with someone in your life who may be going through traumatic grief or a life upheaval. 
  • Along with my raw, unapologetic story, I share specific tools and mindfulness strategies to bolster healing and hope for others.
  • My book raises mental health and suicide stigma awareness.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • No money? No problem. It's free to share this campaign through social media or email. Hell, I don't care if you want to go old school and print flyers to post on a public bulletin board.
  • Follow my journey, keep tabs and check out the book when it's published. IG: @laurheb2
  • Take a page from Plato and "Be kind, for everyone you meet is fighting a hard battle"--Suicide prevention at its simplest.

 

More About the Author

Laurie Hebert is a pediatric occupational therapist by day, who utilizes Matrix-style maneuvers to dodge boogers and stray Legos, while never losing sight of the privilege to see the world through children's eyes. She is currently a Martha Beck life coach in training, passionate about enhancing her ability to help others navigate life's uncertainties and the aftermaths of trauma and tragedy. Laurie is also an aerial yoga & mindfulness instructor for children, committed to equipping children with the tools she never had growing up, in the hopes they will become more adept at handling life's challenges, and in the hopes they will be able to stay here on earth for the long haul. Laurie resides in Austin, Texas. She's obsessed with making a difference in the world, mindfulness, LSU football, laughter, Martha Stewart, Dolly Parton, Snoop Dogg, sloths, puppies and cupcakes (Oh, and writing. Writing without going bankrupt that is--hence, this campaign).

story:
Short Summary

Many confuse intimacy with sex, but it is so much more. It is the stuff that forms a solid foundation for relationships. If we consider a house as love, and intimacy as the foundation supporting that love, then we understand that if ingredients in that foundation are missing, it can crack. If the foundation fails, so does the love.

Intimacy is an intoxicating cocktail of trust, respect, care, affection, nursing, honesty, sex , romance and more. It lasts longer than the 7 minutes of physical pleasure. It can endure a lifetime, if we know what’s involved.

The ABC’s of Intimacy explores all the ingredients and helps you understand their importance and value. We all seek to belong in a loving relationship with our lovers, spouses, family members and friends, but we must first begin with ourselves. Self love allows us to understand how love feels and when we know love for ourselves. We can embrace the idea of “Love thy neighbor as you love yourself” and know what we need and want in a loving relationship.

Whether you chose to purchase the book, listen to the audio program or attend a live event, the ABC’s of Intimacy is a gentle reminder of what may be missing or overlooked in your relationship.

Why search or wonder what is missing any longer? Reignite the passion, fun, and happiness you once shared. It’s as easy as ABC. 

What We Need & What You Get

I am aiming for 250 hard cover books and need to raise $3000 to cover those costs. I am using a local printer so I can pick up those books and save on shipping. Everything is done except the printing and I'll be off and running.

The Impact

If you have ever had a relationship challenge you understand how love can make you crazy. Well its not love. Love is easy, Its relationships that are tough because we are intermingling so much of our lives that it takes some understanding of what is going on to make it smooth and lasting. My focus is to help you resolve our issues and expand your capacity to love and be loved.

Risks & Challenges

The only risk or challenge is that if I don't get all the money raised here it will take me just a bit longer to get your copy to you. But I will not give up on you if you won't give up on me.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign with your friends, matchmakers, dating coaches, family,  and consider it as a gift for a friend who is going through some love changes.

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Newvember Book Blurb

1 dare, 30 days, 30 new things... The dare was simple, but it turned into a life-altering journey. This is inspirational thinking in disguise.

When Willow decides to take the stairs, instead of the elevator, she runs into Sawyer, who knocks her off her feet, and something in her psyche shifts. She is propelled into the adventure that is her own life. Filled with twists and turns that can only come from losing her inhibitions, she makes risky decisions, bares her soul, and discovers the chaotic emotions that lurk beneath the surface. Each new event becomes a catalyst in the development of Willow’s relationships with her friends, co-workers, siblings, and love interests.

Willow's life will never be the same after Newvember.

The Dare:

1 month, 30 days, 30+ new readers.

Join Willow as she steps outside of her comfort zone, takes risks, and lives the adventure that is her life. Let this intriguing novel inspire you to try something new, too.

Here’s what I need to succeed:

  1. A fresh, wrap-around, professionally designed cover because first impressions are everything
  2. The insides formatted to perfection because reading a poorly formatted novel isn’t fun for anyone.
  3. A professional line edit because once a book is in print, corrections can't be made.
  4. A quality printer and distributor so the book can reach more readers.
  5. Advertising! Social marketing is a great start, but the reach is limited… and the more people who experience Newvember, the happier everyone will be.

Remember Newvember:

In 2011, I self-published Remember Newvember. It was chick lit in all it’s light and fluffy glory. Unfortunately, it was repetitious and needed a solid edit, a new cover, expanded dialogue, and new scenes. That’s done, and the eBook is available in most eReader file formats (Mobi, ePub, PDF). With a little help, it can be made available in print with distribution and everything!

The Newvember Story:

In 2009 my friend Jo “dared” me to write for NaNoWriMo (National Novel Writing Month). She knew I wanted to write, but I needed a little shove to get me going. With the challenge accepted and rewards in place (mostly of the coffee, chocolate, and TV-watching variety),  I had a very messy, 50 000-word first draft completed within a month. Undaunted, I set to work editing, rewriting, and polishing the prose.

Remember Newvember was well-received. Readers were inspired by the concept, and left positive reviews, sent encouraging emails, and asked when the next book would be available. I kept writing, fans kept reading, and I forgot about my first book for a little while.

And then… I received an honest review with much-needed constructive criticism. My inexperience as a first-time novelist peeked through the glowing reviews. The repetition and clichés needed to go.

I tucked my writerly feelings in my back pocket, took out my content editor's hat, and worked through the text. It was riddled with cringe-worthy phrases, scenes that didn’t make sense, and a couple of plot holes. All very fixable, and I’m glad I took the time to clean it up. The updated version has 10 000 never-before-read-words, which means there's something new for everyone to enjoy. 

Releasing it as an updated eBook was easy enough. The next step is to make the print version available. With a little help, a lot of work, and some solid encouragement, I hope to have it on bookstore shelves in the near future.


Can't contribute but want to help? It’s easy to be supportive:

Aside from the obvious monetary donations – you can help by sharing this campaign through your social networks. You can also like me on Facebook, follow me on twitter, join my Google+ network, and check out my blog.

If you read the original version of Remember Newmember and enjoyed it, let people know that it was a fun and inspiring book, and it’s worth taking the risk to read an independent author’s work.

story:
Slate Roof Press

is a member-run, not-for-profit poetry press based in Western Massachusetts that publishes limited edition, hand-sewn and -assembled chapbooks with letterpress covers and art paper. Our poems and the pages they are printed on are art. The photos in the gallery don't do the books justice; you have to see and hold the books to know how beautiful they are. We believe that poetry is essential to our collective well-being and that poetry (its creation and its enjoyment) should be accessible to all, regardless of income.  
Since 2004 we have been publishing regional poets; our members work together to oversee every step in the book creation process. No one gets paid; we all donate our time to the press. 

Help Us Pay Our Contest Winner and Lower Submission Fees

No one expects to get rich writing or publishing poetry. However, we believe that poetry has value and want to be able to pay poets for their work. 
We currently operate on a contest model: contest entry fees and book sales cover the bulk of the cost of printing our books (the rest gets covered by small local grants). There is no money left over to offer a purse to our contest winner, and our entry fees are higher than they should be. 
We want the number and quality of our submissions to be determined by the enthusiasm people feel for the work of our press, not by their ability to afford contest fees. And we want the winner of our contest to be rewarded with a small cash prize, in addition to the author copies we normally give. 
Funds raised in this campaign will allow us to lower our contest submission fees as well as offer a small prize to next year's contest winner. 


Please Help Us Spread the Word!

We are grateful for any and all forms of assistance, whether in the form of donations or spreading the word far and wide. Check out and share our website and Facebook page (links below). Thank you!
